loans.name: Nubar

texts.en: Nubar is an IDP from the war-torn Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. She lives in a hostel in Sumgayit town, together with her two children. Her husband died. She has had a hard life as an IDP and a widow. She constructed a small shed hear the hostel where she lives, to keep livestock there. She buys sheep and calves from wholesalers who bring them from regions and sell them to butchers or other people. She has borrowed three loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and has a good repayment history. She needs to buy more adult animals and is now applying for the next loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Amada Maurilia

texts.es:
AMADA IS 35 YEARS-OLD. SHE IS A SINGLE MOTHER OF TWO SONS AND SHE RUNS HER OWN BAKERY BUSINESS FROM HER HOME SELLING BREAD TO FOLKS IN HER NEIGHBORHOOD. SHE AND ROSA DIAZ JIMENES, A DOOR-TO-DOOR CLOTHING SALESWOMAN, BELONG TOTHE "BAMBOO GROUP NUMBER 8". AMADA INTENDS TO PURCHASE LARGER AMOUNTS OF RAW MATERIAL NEEDED FOR BREAD KNEADING AND ADD MORE BAKING TRAYS TO INCREASE PRODUCTION. ROSA, IN TURN, WOULD SPEND THE LOAN AMOUNT TO TRAVEL CLOSER TO THE BORDER AND PURCHASE CLOTHING ITEMS AT A SPECIFIC AREA KNOWN FOR LOWER PRICES. THIS COULD ENABLE INCREASED PROFIT MARGINS.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

AMADA TIENE 35 AÑOS ES MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA AMASANDERIA EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE PAN A SUS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD . JUNTO CON ROSA DIAZ JIMENES ( VENTA DE ROPA DE CASA EN CASA ) PERTENECEN AL GRUPO BAMBU 8 . CON EL PRESTAMO AMADA ESPERA COMPRAR MAS MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DEL PAN Y ADEMAS CHAROLAS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION , EN CAMBIO ROSA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO PODER VIAJAR A LA FRONTERA A COMPRAR MAS ROPA EN UN LUGAR DONDE ES MAS ECONOMICA PARA ASI AUMENTAR LAS GANANCIAS DE SUS VENTAS .

loans.use: VENTA DE PAN

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
ROSALVA IS 40-YEARS-OLD, MARRIED AND HAS A 4-YEAR-OLD BOY. HER HUSBAND WORKS AT A VULCANIZATION PLANT. SHE HELPS HIM INCREASE THEIR TAKE-IN AMOUNT BY SELLING CLOTHES DOOR-TO-DOOR IN HER COMMUNITY. SHE PURCHASES MERCHANDISE IN THE CITY OF COMITAN BECAUSE SUPLLIERS THERE SELL FOR LESS; THUS, MAXIMIZING PROFIT. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP CHIFLON 2 ALONG WITH TWO OTHER LADIES: LIDIA LOPEZ SOLIS, WHO PRODUCES CEMENT BLOCKS USED IN CONSTRUCTION, AND MARTHA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ, A HOME-BASED FOOD RETAILER. ROSALVA WISHES TO SPEND HER SHARE OF THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE AT ONCE AND AVOID EXTRA RESTOCKING TRIPS. LIDIA WILL BUY MORE CEMENT TO INCREASE BLOCK PRODUCTION AND MARTHA WILL USE HER PART TO BUY MORE NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS FOR HER BUSINESS.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSALVA ESTA CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS Y 40 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA VULCANIZADORA.ELLA LO AYUDA VENDIENDO ROPA DE PUERTA EN PUERTA EN SU COMUNIDAD , SU MERCANCIA LA COMPRA EN LACIUDAD DE COMITAN PORQUE ES MAS ECONOMICA Y ASI LOGRA MAS GANANCIAS .PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 2 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : LIDIA LOPEZ SOLIS ( ELABORA BLOCKS DE CEMENTO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION ) Y MARTHA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA )ROSALVA ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS ROPA YASI DISMINUIR LA CANTIDAD DE VIAJES QUE TIENE QUE HACER . LIDIA COMPRARA MAS CEMENTO PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE BLOCKS.Y MARTHA POR SU PARTE CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA SU NEGOCIO..

loans.use: VENTA DE ROPA

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
MERCEDES IS 44 YEARS OLD AND SHE LIVES IN UNION LIBRE. SHE HAS 3 SONS. SHE AND HER SPOUSE OPERATE A SMALL RESTAURANT OUT OF AN ADAPTED ROOM IN THEIR HOUSE, SERVING HOME-MADE FOOD TO OTHER RESIDENTS OF THE SECTOR. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP CHIFLON 2, WHICH ALSO HAS ROSARIO NAJERA PEREZ - A CEMENT BLOCK SALESWOMAN. MERCEDES PLANS TO USE THE LOAN TO BETTER EQUIP HER RESTAURANT AND TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL KITCHENWARE. ROSARIO WISHES TO INVEST HER PART OF THE LOAN TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CEMENT BLOCK MOLDERS SO THAT SHE CAN INCREASE HER SALES.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MERCEDES TIENE 44 AÑOS VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE 3 HIJOS JUNTO CON SU PAREJA TIENEN EN SU CASA UN LUGAR HABILITADO COMO PEQUEÑO RESTAURANT DONDE VENDEN COMIDAS CASERAS A LAS PERSONAS DEL SECTOR.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 2 JUNTO CON ROSARIO NAJERA PEREZ ( VENDE BLOCKS DE CEMENTO ). CON EL PRESTAMO MERCEDES QUIERE INSTALAR UN RESTAURANT MEJOR HABILITADO Y COMPRAR IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA , EN CAMBIO ROSARIO ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL PARA AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE MOLDES QUE NECESITA PARA MEJORAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: TIENDA DE COMIDA

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
MARIA SOLEDAD IS MARIED, HAS 3 SONS AND SHE IS 31 YEARS OLD. HER HUSBAND WORK AS A WELDER. SHE HAS A KITCHEN WHERE SHE PREPARES TYPICAL DISHES FROM HER REGION THAT ARE THEN SOLD TO CUSTOMERS THAT COME IN EVERYDAY. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3. SHE WISHES TO USE HER LOAN TO BUILD A SMALL RESTAURANT IN HER HOME AND TO BUY ADDITIONAL KITCHENWARE.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA SOLEDAD ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS Y 31 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO SOLDADOR ELLA POSEE UNA COCINA ECONOMICA EN SU CASA EN DONDE HACE COMIDAS TIPICAS DE SU ZONA Y VENDE A LAS PERSONAS QUE VIENEN A SERVIRSE DIARIAMENTE. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3 . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA YA INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO RESTAURANT EN SU CASA Y COMPRAR MAS IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA .

loans.use: VENTA DE COMIDA

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
ANA ISABEL IS 34 YEARS OLD. SHE LIVES IN UNION LIBRE WITH HER 3 SONS AND HER SPOUSE, WHO WORKS AS A RETAILER. SHE HOPES TO USE HER LOAN TO SET UP A FOOD SUPPLY STORE IN HER HOME AND TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR IT. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

ANA ISABEL TIENE 34 AÑOS , VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE 3 HIJOS , SU PAREJA TRABAJA COMO COMERCIANTE . ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO PODER INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y COMPRAR MERCADERIAS PARA ABASTECER LA TIENDA . . PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
CECILIA HAS BEEN DIVORCED FOR ELEVEN YEARS. SHE IS 43 YEARS OLD AND HAS FIVE CHILDREN. SHE WANTS TO USE HER LOAN TO START UP A FOOD SUPPLY STORE, SINCE SHE ALREADY SELLS PERISHABLE ITEMS TO OTHER LADIES IN HER NEIGHBORHOOD. THAT IS WHY SHE WISHES TO INVEST THE LOAN IN ADDITIONAL MERCHANDISE TO INCREASE SALES AND EXTRA STORAGE SHELVING FOR HER STORE. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

CECILIA ESTA SEPARADA DESDE HACE ONCE AÑOS TIENE 43 AÑOS Y CINCO HIJOS , SU PRESTAMO LO QUIERE INVERTIR EN UNA TIENDA DE ABARRROTES YA QUE ACTUALMENTE TIENE MERCADERIAS COMESTIBLES LAS CUALES VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES QUE VIVEN CERCA DE SU CASA. ES POR ESO QUE ESPERA INVERTIR EN MERCADERIA PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y EN ESTANTERIAS PARA FORMAR UNA TIENDITA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA IS 30 YEARS OLD AND HAS 3 CHILDREN. HER SPOUSE WORKS AS AN AUTOMOTIVE MECHANIC. SHE SELLS KNITTED BEDDING ITEMS AND SHE PLANS TO APLLY THE LOAN AMOUNT TO PURCHASE SHEETS, BLANKETS, BEDSPREADS AND COMFORTERS, SO THAT SHE CAN SELL THEM AT THE LOCAL MARKET. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ELENA TIENE 30 AÑOS , TIENE 3 HIJOS Y SU PAREJA TRABAJA COMO MECANICO EN UN TALLER DE REPARACION DE AUTOMOVILES ELLA VENDE ROPA DE CAMA BORDADA Y ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN COMPRAR COLCHAS , CUBRECAMAS Y SABANAS PARA PODER SALIR A VENDER TAMBIEN EN EL MERCADO DEL PUEBLO.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3

loans.use: VENTA  ROPA DE CAMA

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
MARIA DEL TRANSITO IS 51 YEARS OLD. SHE HAS 4 CHILDREN AND HER HUSBAND IS A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPERATOR. SHE SELLS COSMETIC AND BEAUTY PRODUCTS OUT OF HER HOME. SHE WISHES TO INVEST THE LOAN AMOUNT TO SET UP A SMALL COSMETICS STORE TO INCREASE CLIENTELE AND; THEREFORE, PROFITS. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL TRANSITO TIENE 51 AÑOS , 4 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LA LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA . ELLA VENDE EN SU CASA COSMETICOS Y PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO CENTRO DE ESTETICA PARA ASI AMPLIAR EL NUMERO DE CLIENTAS Y POR LO TANTO SUS INGRESOS . ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3

loans.use: VENTA DE COSMETICOS

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco and his wife own a restaurant at the edge of Nuevo Laredo. "We depend on the business to make a living. It's a restaurant and we also cater parties. We've been working there for more than three years. All that we want is to remodel the restaurant and purchase special pans for buffets. We're requesting a loan of $1,200 to pay for the remodeling and buying cookware."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Francisco y su esposa son dueños de un restauran en las orillas de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. El negocio que tenemos es el sustento de nuestra familia es un negocio de restauran y banquetes para fiestas tenemos ya mas de 3 años trabajando en el. Solo que queremos remodelar el negocio y comprar unas sartenes especiales para buffet. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 DLLS. Para la remodelación del negocio y compra de materiales para cocinar.

loans.use: Remodel restaurant

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
ENGLISH

Rosalinda is married and has nine children, but she lives alone with her husband because all her children are married. Her husband works as a refrigerator repairman from their home. Rosalinda began her business 10 years ago and she does not have any employees. She began the business because she needed to help her husband with the family expenses. Her husband’s income varied from month to month, and with nine children to provide for and educate, it was necessary for her to work. Rosalinda started her business with a small capital of US $50.00, with which this she bought notebooks and pencils, and this was how she began her stationary business. She has added diverse products to her business, at the request of her customers, and would like to continue with the business.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan in the amount of $925.00 to purchase gifts and others new merchandise, which will give her a better variety of products to offer in her business. She offers to repay the loan in 6 months. She and her husband thank you for your support, which will allow her to continue with her business.

SPANISH

Rosalinda esta casada y tiene 9 hijos, pero ella vive sola con su esposo, ya que todos están casados. Su esposo trabaja como técnico en refrigeración y lo tiene establecido en su domicilio, ella no tiene empleados e inició hace 10 años con su negocio, ya que tenía que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia por que sus ingresos no eran fijos y con tantos hijos a los cuales mantener, brindarles sus estudios y alimentación, era necesario trabajar. Rosalinda inició con un pequeño capital de US $ 50, con los que adquirió libretas y lápices y fue así con eso como empezó su negocio de papelería, el cual ha seguido agregándole diversos productos a pedido de sus clientes y desea continuar con su negocio.

Rosalinda esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para poder comprar regalos y novedades los que harán tener más surtido para su negocio y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen mucho por apoyarla a continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
My house is very unsafe and only my mother, my wife and I live there but we all work during the day. I would therefore like to put up a fence around the house for better protection. I need $1200 to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Mi casa esta muy insegura vivimos solo mi mama, mi esposa y yo pero los tres trabajamos todo el día, así es que me gustaría poner una barda alrededor de la casa y también rejas para mayor protección”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir la barda y poner las rejas.

loans.use: To build a fence/Construir una barda e instalar rejas

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
ENGLISH

Virginia is married, her husband is retired, and they have three sons who are all married. She began her small grocery and seafood store 7 years ago and has been able to employ two people to help her. Her goal when she began her business was to provide for her 3 children, especially for their basic needs and education, which was her primary concern. She has achieved those goals and wants to continue with her business in order to be able to leave her children an inheritance and continue helping them.

Virginia is requesting for a loan of $1,200.00 to remodel her business and to purchase merchandise to her grocery store. She offers to repay the loan in 4 months. She and her husband thank you for your support, which will allow her to continue with her business.

SPANISH

Virginia está casada, su esposos es pensionado y tienen 3 hijos que ya son casados, ella ha podido dar empleo a dos personas en su negocio y ya tiene 7 años que inició con su tienda de abarrotes y mariscos, su objetivo fue sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos cuando decidió iniciar su negocio, en lo que a su manutención y sus estudios se refiere, lo que era su principal preocupación, ella ha logrado lo que se ha propuesto y desea continuar con su negocio para dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio y continuar ayudándolos.

Virginia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,200 para remodelar su local e invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen el apoyo que les das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To remodel and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
My family's safety is the most important thing for me. I work nights and I would like to finish the fence so that my family will be safer at home. I need $1200 to finish doing this.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“La seguridad de mi familia es lo principal para mi, yo trabajo toda la noche y me gustaría terminar la barda y las rejas de esta manera estará mi familia más segura dentro de la vivienda”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: To build a fence/construcción de barda e instalación de rejas.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and hard work I have managed to build a part of the extra room that I need, but I cannot continue. I would like to finish it but I need flooring and windows. I need $1200 to finish the building work.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo he logrado construir una parte del cuarto que necesito, pero ya no pude continuar, me gustaría poder terminarlo me falta la losa, el piso y las ventanas” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: To finish building a room/terminar la construccion de la losa y poner el piso

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
I need to put flooring down in my home as it is a source of illness and infection for my children. I have not been able to put it down yet as I have had to do other, more urgent, things. I need a loan of $1000 to put down the flooring and for bars.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito poner el piso de mi casa ya que es una fuente de infección y enfermedad para mis hijos,no he podido ponerlo debido a que he tenido otras cosas más urgentes”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner el piso de mi casa y las rejas.

loans.use: To put bars and flooring/Poner piso y rejas

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
There is very little room in my house and I therefore want to build an extra room for my family as one of my children currently sleeps on the floor as there is no space for a bed. I need $1200 to build this room.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey., Kiva Volunteer

“El espacio en mi casa esta muy reducido por eso quiero construir un cuarto más para la comodidad de mi familia, ya que uno de mis hijos duerme en el piso porque no hay espacio para poner una cama”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto".

loans.use: To build a room/Construccion de un Cuarto

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina T. is a single mother raising her four children, Claudio (19), Ambreisi (17), Rosmery (13) and Ana (13). Regina supports her children by running her own clothing and personal care product store from their home in San Pedro de Macoris. She has requested this loan so she can expand her inventory from hygienic products to t-shirts. Regina says that by using these loans to develop her store, she hopes to help her community and family to become more successful and improve their lives.

NOTE: This $750 loan will go to fund Regina's business, as well as four other businesses within her solidarity group. She and four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community came to Esperanza and formed their own group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive shares of this $750 loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the success and struggles of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Soap, deodorant, hair products and collared shirts

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina J. has opened a small store out of her home in San Pedro de Macoris. She uses her profits to care for her four young children: Anehicio J. (13), Ramonita J. (9), Gravier J. (8), Maria J. (5). Ramonita and Maria are pictured with their mother next to her small store, where she currently sells a variety of household items. Miguelina wants to expand her inventory to include shirts and pants, which is why she has requested this loan. She hopes to save up enough money to purchase a proper store.

NOTE: Miguelina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase shirts and pants

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and has two small children. His desire to improve his family’s living standards is what motivated him to start his business six years ago. He sells sunglasses and accessories, which is how he earns the income necessary to provide for his family and give an education to his children. Fortunately, his products have been well received by his customers and he has been able to locate himself in several markets where he has been able to successfully sell his merchandise.

Antonio needs to continue growing his business, and in order to cover the increased demand he has had lately, due to the beginning of the hot season, he is requesting a loan of $475.00. He will use it to buy merchandise, and he promises to return the loan in 6 months. Please be an important part of this business and the life of Antonio and his family. They are very thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, los deseos de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia motivaron a Antonio a iniciar su propio negocio desde hace seis años, donde vende accesorios y lentes, de esta manera es como obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia y darle educación a sus hijos. Afortunadamente las ventas de sus productos han tenido buena aceptación de sus clientes y ha logrado ubicarse en varios mercados donde comercializa con éxito sus productos.

Ahora Antonio quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y para cubrir la alta demanda que ha tenido por la entrada de la temporada de calor solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en este negocio y en la vida de Antonio y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
ENGLISH

Francisco is 41 years old, is married and has three sons. Two of them are studying and the other one is married and works. The two who are students are economically dependant on Francisco. His wife helps him in the business. She makes candies and he makes brooms and mops for sale. He has been working in this business, which he learned from his parents, since he was 10 years old. He has been working for 18 year working with his wife and thanks to his business he has been able to provide for his family. He does not have any employees who help him with the business. His dream is to leave it to one of his sons so that he can continue with the business.

Francisco is requesting for a loan of US $ 475.00 to purchase raw materials for his business, which he offers to repay in 6 months. He and his family thank you for the support you give, allowing them to continue with their business and get ahead.

SPANISH

Francisco tiene 41 años, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y el otro ya es casado y trabaja, los otros dos dependen del él, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, en lo que respecta a la elaboración de dulces, y él se dedica a la elaboración de escobas y trapeadores para su venta, tiene desde los 10 años de edad dedicándose a este oficio, el cual fue aprendido por enseñanza de sus padres, y tiene 18 años trabajando con su esposa, gracias a su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. El no tiene empleados que le ayuden en el negocio, más bien su ideal es dejarle el negocio a alguno de sus hijos para que continúen con el. Mismo.

Francisco está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar materia prima para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Maria  Benita

texts.es:
Maria Benita is a widow. She has six children, and in order to cover expenses she began her business, selling foods, five years ago. She is originally from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her love for her children and her desire to see them become professionals have motivated her to work very hard every day. Fortunately, she has been able to get ahead with her family and her business, which has grown little by little, thanks to the quality of the products she makes and the good service she provides to her customers.

In order to grow her business Maria is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy furniture and also ingredients to increase the variety of foods she offers. She promises to return the loan in 6 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and be a part of Maria’s achievements. She and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Benita es viuda, tiene seis hijos y para poder cubrir sus gastos inició su negocio hace cinco años, donde elabora y vende comidas, ella es originaria de la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. El amor hacia sus hijos y el deseo de verlos convertidos en profesionistas la han motivado a trabajar arduamente todos los días. Afortunadamente ha salido adelante con su familia y su negocio, que ha visto crecer poco a poco, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora y a su buen servicio cuenta con la preferencia de muchos clientes.

Ante la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mobiliario e insumos para incrementar la variedad de sus comidas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y se parte de los logros de Maria, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy furniture and food ingredients

loans.name: Xi

texts.en: Miss Xi is 34 and her husband is 38 years old. They have 3 children between 12 and 8 who are going to school in grade 6, 2. They have a little land for rice, about 3000 square meters. Tam, her husband works as a daily laborer but he only works in the dry season. So Xi sells food for breakfast in the morning from door to door. This way increased her family about $1.6/person/month. Average is low at $8.5/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling and buying fertilizer.

loans.use: sells food

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
I built a garage to keep my car safe as the hubcaps had been stolen a few times before. However, I have recently realised that I need an extra room for my family as we have very little space. I need a loan of $1200 to build this room.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Construí la cochera para poder meter mi auto ya que me has robado varias veces las copas de las llantas, pero con el paso del tiempo me di cuenta de que necesito más un cuarto para la comodidad de mi familia ya que tenemos muy poco espacio”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room/Construcción de un cuarto

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana is a very hardworking and responsible person. She is married and has 3 young children. Her husband works in automotive bodywork and paint. He works for himself; therefore he doesn’t have a steady income with which to support his family. At times they have gone into debt to cover expenses. In order to help her husband, Iliana decided to start selling cosmetics one year ago. Thanks to her liking for sales and the ease with which she speaks to people, she has increased her number of clients.

In order to cover the orders she has, Iliana is requesting a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy merchandise in order to offer better and faster service to her customers. She promises to return the loan in just 3 months. Please decide to help Iliana, she needs your help. She wants to get ahead and you can make that possible. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Iliana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene 3 pequeños hijos, su esposo se dedica al enderezado y pintura automotriz, trabaja por su propia cuenta, así que no tiene un salario fijo para el sostén de su familia, en ocasiones incurrían en deudas para poder cubrir sus gastos, para poder ayudar a su esposo Iliana decidió iniciar con la venta de cosméticos desde hace un año, gracias a su gusto por la ventas y su facilidad de palabra, ha incrementado mucho su numero de clientes.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene, ahora Iliana solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer un mejor y rápido servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Decídete a ayudar a Iliana, ella necesita mucho de tu apoyo, solo desea salir adelante y por ti será posible, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita has been making foods for five years. She is married and has a young son. She began her business when she needed a source of income because her husband lost his job. She began selling tamales and cheeses to businesses in her area, and she later added tortillas. Her greatest demand has been for tortillas, which is why she has increased production. The good quality of the foods she makes and her desire to get ahead have been the reasons for the success of this business.

In order for her business to continue growing, Juanita is requesting a loan of $200.00, which she will use to buy ingredients and to remodel her kitchen. This will help her to keep up with demand and to offer better service to her customers. She will return the loan in 3 months. Be a part of Juanita’s achievements and help her in her business. She and her family are very thankful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años Juanita se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso ya que su esposo se encontraba desempleado. Comenzó vendiendo tamales y quesos en las empresas, posteriormente incorporó la venta de tortillas, en donde ha tenido una mayor demanda, por lo que ha incrementado su producción. La buena calidad de los alimentos que prepara y los deseos de salir adelante han sido unos de los motivos del éxito de este negocio.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, Juanita solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos y en la remodelación de su local, para cubrir las demandas y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a retornar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Juanita y ayúdala en su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and to remodel her kitchen

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. R. (pictured with one of her grandchildren) is a 42-year-old mother of three: Jenifer (14), Johantan Obispo (14) and Wilna Demerva (25). Lourdes is requesting this loan to expand her business selling fresh vegetables and dairy products to neighboring communities. She will use the loan capital to travel to regional markets where she can stock up at wholesale prices, then sell at the local level from her store. Lourdes also has a refrigerator to store products over a longer period of time. This cuts down her traveling expenses and allows her to purchase goods at a lower price by buying in bulk. This loan will go far in developing her business.

NOTE: Lourdes is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase plantains, eggs, tomatoes and other food staples

loans.name: Jorge Rosendo

texts.es:
The neighbourhood where we live is very dangerous and there is little light in the streets and therefore there are lots of robberies. Fortunately my house has not been robbed and so before this happens I need to put bars on the windows to make the house safer. I need $1000 to fit these bars.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“El Fraccionamiento en donde vivimos en muy inseguro y en las calles hay poca luz, debido a eso se han dado varios robos, afortunadamente a mi vivienda no se han metido a robar pero antes de que eso suceda, necesito poner rejas para que estemos más seguros”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la instalación de rejas en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To install bars/Instalacion de Rejas

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela is married and has two children. The family lives in Monclova, Coahuila. Marisela has been making flour tortillas, which is a much-consumed product in northern Mexico, for the last 15 years. She began her business due to the need to help her husband with their children’s education and with improving their quality of life, which would have been impossible with her husband’s low salary. She has arranged a part of her house for making her torillas, for which there has come to be so much demand that she cannot keep up.

In order to improve the area of her house where she makes the tortillas, and to increase her production, Marisela is requesting a loan of $475, which she promises to return in 3 months. The growth of this business, and Marisela and her family’s wellbeing, is in your hands. Please decide to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisela es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Desde hace 15 años Marisela se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, que son un producto muy consumido en el norte de México, inició con su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos y mejorar su calida de vida, que sería imposible con el salario tan bajo que recibe su pareja. Ella ha acondicionado un lugar de su casa para la elaboración de sus productos, que poco a poco ha sido insufciente para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Para poder tener mejor acondicionado su local, y poder incrementar su producción, Marisela solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. El crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de Marisela y su familia está en tus manos, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
I have been selling second hand clothes, sneakers and shoes for 6 months, and up until now I have not had very many clients. I would therefore like to invest in more merchandise so that I will have more clients so that my sales increase. I have a lot of faith that that will happen, and I will work hard so that it does. I would like a loan of $1200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo 6 meses con la venta de ropa, tenis y zapatos usados en realidad ahora he tenido pocos clientes, así es que me gustaría invertir en mercancía para tener más clientes y mis ventas aumenten tengo mucha fe en que así será y voy a trabajar duro para lograrlo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise/Invertir en la compra de Mercancia

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry D. J. is the mother of 11-year-old Maria. They live together in San Pedro D. Macoris near the southern coast of the Dominican Republic. DeJ. owns her own store selling household supplies, but she wants to expand to selling fruits and vegetables. So she has applied for a loan with Esperanza to purchase items essential to many of the homes of her customers from potatoes and yucca to bananas and plantains. Dejanne says her goal is to improve her store and, in doing so, change the living situation of her family and community.

NOTE: This $750 loan will go to fund Henry's business, as well as four other businesses within her solidarity group. She and four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community came to Esperanza and formed their own group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive shares of this $750 loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the success and struggles of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Purchase plantains, yucca, bananas, potatoes and avocado and fruit

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.en:
Olga is a hard-working woman. She is married and has two kids. Her husband works in a security company, however, his salary is very low and insufficient to pay for all the expenses of his family. Owner wants to offer a high quality education to her children and improve their living standards. This will be impossible on the salary of her husband alone. Therefore, Olga found it necessary to generate an extra income and started to sell shoes and dairy products two years ago.

To bolster her business and to continue growing, Olga requested a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise in order to satisfy customer demand, and to offer a good service. She commits to repay this amount in three months. Please be a parts of Olga's accomplishments and help her to make her dreams come true. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, sin embargo, su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su familia. Olga desea poder ofrecer una educación de calidad a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, lo que sería imposible solo con el salario de su esposo, por lo que Olga vio la necesidad de un ingreso extra y comenzó a vender zapatos y productos lácteos desde hace dos años.

Para poder darle un impulso a su negocio y continuar creciendo, Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Olga y ayúdala a realizar sus sueños, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a very active and entrepreneurial woman. She is married and has four children. For five years she has sold curtains and blankets. She started her business because you need it extra income to help her husband with some of the debt of his home. Thanks to the pleasure she finds is selling and to her character that makes it easy to relate to other people, Silvia has been able to grow her business and increase her sales. The assistance of her family has also been an important factor in the development of this business.

Silvia is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise. With this, she expects to be able to meet the demands of her customers and to continue doing what she likes most. She promises to repay this amount in three months. Please contributes to the growth of this business. Silvia and her family much appreciate your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender cortinas y colchas, inició con su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para poder ayudar a su esposo con las deudas de su hogar. Gracias al gusto que tiene por las ventas y a su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás, Silvia ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, el apoyo de su familia también ha sido indispensable para el desarrollo de este negocio.

Silvia ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Silvia y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is married and has three children. Her husband works for a company but his salary is very low. In order to help with household expenses, Maria started her own business five years ago, selling paper and stationery. She started her business after the company she worked for closed. She received her severance payment and with this she bought merchandise and set up a room in her home to start selling. This way she is able to help pay for household expenses while taking care of her small children.

Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to increase the variety of her products. In addition she started to give handicrafts classes and she needs to set up a workshop. She commits to repay this amount in three months. Please be a part of the growth of this business. Maria and her family are very thankful of your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rosario es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, para poder ayudar con los gastos de su hogar Maria inició su propio negocio hace cinco años, donde vende papelería y mercería. Comenzó su negocio después de que cerró la empresa para la que laboraba, recibió su liquidación y con esto compró mercancía y acondicionó un lugar en su vivienda para iniciar con las ventas, de esta manera es como ayuda con los gastos de su hogar sin descuidar a sus pequeños hijos.

Ahora Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos, además ha iniciado a impartir clases de manualidades y necesita acondicionar un lugar de su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a hard-working women. She is married and has three small children. Her husband is a bus driver, but his salary is too low to pay for all the family necessities. Marisol wants to offer her children a better quality of life and therefore she started to sell cosmetics six years ago. This way, she helps her husband to pay for household expenses and has time to take care of her children.

In order to satisfy customer demand, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise. This way she will be able to offer aid to its service to her customers and to continue doing what she likes most. She commits to repay this amount in three months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and improve the well-being of this family. Please help them.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es chofer en un autobús urbano, pero su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir las necesidades D. su familia. Marisol desea ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida y para ello desD. hace seis años se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, D. esta manera puD. ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar y tener el tiempo para los cuidados y atenciones que sus hijos requieren.

Para poder cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes, Marisol solicita un préstamo D. $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra D. mercancía, D. esta manera logrará ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en tres meses.Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento D. este negocio y mejorar el bienestar D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is married and has two children. One goes to primary school and the oldest one studies business at the University. Her husband works in a fruit store, but the little bit of salary that he gets is insufficient for all the household expenses. To enable her children to continue studying and to proviD. them with opportunity of a better future, Maria Elena started selling cookware 4 years ago. The quality of the products that she sells have allowed Maria to increase her sales quickly.

At this moment, she is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to satisfy customer demand. She commits to repay this amount in 3 months. Maria's greatest wish is that her children can finish their studies. For this, she is willing to work hard. You can become an important part of the life of this family, please help them out. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno estudia la primaria y el mayor se estudia administración en la universidad. Su esposo trabaja en una frutería, pero el poco salario que recibe es insuficiente para todos los gastos del hogar, para poder ayudar a que sus hijos continúen estudiando y tengan acceso a un mejor futuro, Maria Elena inició con la venta D. artículos para la cocina desD. hace cuatro años, la calidad D. los productos que comercializa y las facilidades que les otorga para cubrir su costo han ayudado a Maria a incrementar sus ventas rápidamente.

Ahora necesita D. un préstamo D. $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. El máximo anhelo D. Maria es que sus hijos puedan terminar su carrera, para lo que está dispuesta a esforzarse mucho, tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Leticia is an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman. She separated from her husband six years ago. She receives absolutely no help from him to pay for the expenses and studies of her son. Therefore, Leticia as had to work hard to get ahead. The salary that she received as maid was very low and in order to pay for all household expenses, she started her own business three years ago, selling flowers and presents.

Leticia wants to give a new impulse to her business to increments her income. Her son is now studying in the University and has a lot of expenses. She wants her son to be able to finish his studies and therefore she is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to increment the variety of her business and to continue growing. She will repay this amount in 3 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and become an important part in the life of Leticia and her son. They are very thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, está separada de su esposo desde hace seis años, no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda de él para el sostén y estudio de su hijo, por lo que Leticia ha tenido que trabajar y esforzarse mucho por sacarlo adelante, el salario que recibía como empleada era muy bajo y para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio hace tres años, donde vende flores y regalos.

Leticia desea dar un nuevo impulso a su negocio para poder incrementar sus utilidades, su hijo ya está en la universidad y tiene muchos gastos, ella desea que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios y para ello solicita un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtida su negocio y poder continuar creciendo, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye el crecimiento de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de Leticia y su hijo, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es:
"Right now I sell food from a small cart, but I would like to add a room to the front of my house where I can serve food. I'm asking for $1200 to construct this dining room."

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo un carrito en donde vendo platillos de comida, pero me gustaria construir un cuarto enfrente de mi vivienda y acondicionarlo para vender ahi la comida ya que necesito más espacio ”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto para poner mi negocio.

loans.use: To build space for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum O. is 42 years old and a mother of 2 children. She lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She runs a small booth selling fruits at a market, where she typically generates around $6.5/day in revenue. Meanwhile, her husband helps in financing the family by working at a construction site, while one of her children works at one of the garment factories in the city. The rest of her children are enrolled school. She and her family are commitment and hard working, which motivates Soum O. to go ahead and increase her business. Currently, Soum O. needs to purchase more fruits in order to meet her clients’ needs and grow her business. She hopes to use another part of the loan to repair her house, which normally leaks during rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for her inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M. is 49 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia, where she and her husband together sell beef / pork rice and porridge to the people in her area. This business activity provides her with an average of around $5 in revenue per day. Meanwhile, one of the children runs a small booth at a market selling women’s handbags and the rest of her children are enrolled school. Mrs. Kung M. currently needs to expand her business by purchasing more food supplies and more utensils in order to meet her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to save enough money for her children’s education.

loans.use: Needs to expand her business by purchasing more food supplies and some utensils to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment:
Congratulation to Mrs. Kung Mach!!!!!!!!

Now She is able to pay off her loan very early. On behalf of Mrs Kung Mach, we would like to say greatly thank to all the lenders who always support and help our poor entrepreneurs. your loan can make different. 

we will provide the Journal update of Kung Mach family as soon as we could so that you will understand what different your loan make on her and her family. 

Many Thanks again

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Mrs. Vorng S. is 31 years old and a mother of 2 children – both of whom are students. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes an average of around $3/day in revenue by renting rooms to the garment workers in her area. Meanwhile, her husband is self-employed as a chef, which is a help to the household. Currently, Vorng S. needs to build more rooms due to an increase of potential tenants. She hopes the loan will help her succeed in this activity, and she is very grateful for any help you can give her.

loans.use: Needs to build more rooms to rent to the garment workers in her area.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen T. O., 46 years old, lives in a peaceful village in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Her husband is three years older than she. They have 3 children aged 22, 24 and 26. The first child is at Music College and the second one is at Medical Equipment College. The third one graduated from Medical School some months ago. Supporting three children going to school, she and her husband have done plenty of work to earn money. Her husband has been working in the field and raising pigs and chickens. She has been running a general store with different kinds of goods such as souvenirs, mash and consumer goods for 7 years. Every month her profit is $31.3, which is not enough for her family. That is why she wants to borrow $325.00 to buy 1 ton of mash for her store. She hopes that this kind of product will sell like hot cakes and she will earn more money.

loans.use: She wants to buy 1 ton of mash for her store.

loans.name: Tran

texts.en: Mrs. Tran T. K., 51 years old, is a nice woman in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. She not only lives in harmony with her husband and two children aged 23 and 17 but also participates enthusiastically in social activities. She used to be a Center Chief and a Secretary in her TYM center. In 2002, she opended a small grocery at home with some types of goods. Last year, she expanded her store to have more space for more shelves of goods. Day in day out she notices that there are more demands for beer and sweets, so she wants to borrow $ 1,200.00 to buy more draught beer, bottled beer and sweets. With a profit of about $ 3.2 per day, she believes that her business will be successful with every passing day.

loans.use: She wants to buy draught beer. bottlted beer and sweets for her grocery.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Mrs. Tang Y. is 54 years old and a mother of 2. She lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. She and her husband are both farmers growing rice crops and selling a kind of roof made from palm leaf –creating around $3/day in revenue. Two of her children help the family financially by working at a local private company, and the rest of the children are students. Mrs. Tang Y. currently needs an irrigation machine to help with cultivation, so that she will no longer have any troubles with her water system. She believes the loan will help her increase the number of crops and her family’s savings.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation machine to help in cultivating crops.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Tang Yung for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen T. T., 48 years old, is a busy but cheerful woman in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Having separated from her husband many years ago, she has had to work hard to support three children, a daughter and two sons. Now her oldest child, the daughter, is 26 years old and is married. The second one is a worker. She only has to support the youngest child who is apprenticing to a hair-stylist, yet she still takes pains to work because working is an indispensable part of her life.

She raises corn, beans and peanuts in a field of almost 1ha. In addition, she has chickens, pigs and a cow in her old raising facilities. However, she is not pleased with herself and wants to expand her business. She wants to borrow $575 to invest one half in building new raising facilities. The other half will be used for buying 250 more chickens and mash as well as paying for her child's apprentice expenses. Thinking that she will have a profit of more than $31.3 per month, the current income, she cannot hide her excitement.

loans.use: She wants to build new raising facilities and buy more chickens and mash and pay for her child's apprentice expenses.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen T. T., 48 years old, is a busy but cheerful woman in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Having been separated from her husband for many years, she has had to work hard to support three children, a daughter and two sons. Now her oldest child, the daughter, is 26 years old and is married. The second one is a worker. She only has to support the youngest child who is apprenticing to a hair-stylist, yet she still takes pains to work because working is an indispensable part of her life.

She raises corn, bean and peanut sin the field of almost 1ha. In addition, she has chickens, pigs and a cow in her old raising facilities. However, she is not pleased with herself and wants to expand her business. She wants to borrow $575.00 to invest one half in building new raising facilities. The other half will be used for buying 250 more chickens and mash as well as paying for her child's apprentice expenses. Thinking that she will have a profit of more than $31.3 per month, her current income, she cannot hide her excitement.

loans.use: She wants to build new raising facilities and buy more chickens and pay for her child's apprentice expenses.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en: B. Naim is in the dried fruits buying and selling business. He works at markets in the Kanibadam region. He has a degree but as he cannot find a job so he has to look for activities with a short-term income. His entrepreneurial business is the main source of income for his family. His family is big; he has a wife and four children. Recently he received a loan from Microinvest and started to buy dried fruits on the market. Naim would like to get an additional loan to buy more dried fruits at low seasonal prices. This would bring him a good profit.

loans.use: to buy more dried fruits at low seasonal prices

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en:
Zamin is 23 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Kalbadjar region, Almalig village. This single man is settled in the Khirdalan settlement.

Zamin has a lorry. He sells building materials with his lorry. He has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to do capital repairs on his lorry to improve his business.

loans.use: To do capital repairs of his lorry

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch N. is 38 years old (she stands in the middle of this picture) and lives with her husband and two nieces in a part of the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband are both farmers growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables in their rice paddy. This activity typically contributes around $2 each day to the household, while her two nieces help in generating more income by working at one of the garment factories in the city. Mrs. Uch N. currently needs a motorcycle to assist in transporting their outputs from the paddy to the market, where she can sell them. The couple believes the loan will play a very important role for the family.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to assist in transporting her outputs to a market.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som S. is a widow and lives with her 3 children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes a living by running a grocery store near a market, where she makes a moderate revenue of about $3/day. Fortunately, 3 of her children are married and assist her in selling goods. Currently, Som S. needs a loan to add more grocery products to her stock in order to meet her clients’ needs. She hopes to expand her business as well as giving her family a better quality of life one day.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam has been engaged in business for over 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a teacher. Rustam is educated as a physician but he could not find a good job in this sector. Rustam therefore decided to sell books and office supplies. He became a client of Micro Invest in 2004. Due to the loans he could increase the turnover of his goods and expand the assortment of his books. His business is located in the centre of Khujand in the open-air market of office supplies. Today he has many clients and always tries to meet their needs. In the future he plans to build bookshelves, which is why he is requesting a 600 USD loan.

loans.use: Building bookshelves

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en: Saidniso has worked in the wholesale market for 12 years. Her business is the trade of sacks of flour. Her business is located in the centre of Panjshanbe market in Khujand, and she buys her goods from suppliers in Kirgizistan. Her elder son helps her in with the business. She became a client of Micro Invest in 2003, which helped her to increase the turnover of her business and today she is an experienced businesswoman. She has a lot of clients because her flour is of highest quality and she also sells 3 different varieties of flour. She has concluded an agreement with several bakeries and pasta workshops for a partnership. Now she wants to buy 200 sacks of flour and she needs 1000 USD for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of 200 sacks of flour

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea has been married for 7 years and has 2 children, a son and a daughter. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband Mr. Sou Thoeurn sells ice from village to village with his father's small truck. He has been selling ice for more than 6 years. He plans on buying a small truck with the money he has saved and the loan he receives from MAXIMA. In addition, his family has a small machine for grinding rice. 

With the requested loan amount of $700 Sothea intends on purchasing ice, grocery, rice grains for grinding and a small truck. Their family's standard of living is getting better and they will not have a problem repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing ice, grocery items  rice grains and a small truck.

payments.comment:
Dear all lenders,

Sothea Dhim already paid off the loan. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka U. is woman of great dignity and influence who runs a small shop where she sells drinks to the people of her community. She is 25 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Benin City, and has come to us for a loan to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang T. T., 38 years old, lives in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Her husband, a 45 year-old watchman, works far away from home. They have 2 children aged 18 and 16. As they are both at high school, she has to spend a lot of money on their education ($43.8/month). As her husband is not at home and her children have to focus on their studies, she is responsible for 3 pigs, 2 cows and 40 chickens, not to mention a large field of corn and beans. Although she has to work hard, she wants to borrow $575.00 to buy 6 more pigs and mash. She hopes that her income will not stop at $43.8 per month so that she can facilitate her children's studies.

loans.use: She wants to buy 6 pigs and mash.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is married since 1979 and has 9 children, 4 daughters and 5 sons. She opened a grocery store 3 years ago. In addition, she also sells flowers at her store. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her sons works in A private company and the others are still studying. 

She has previously borrowed money from MAXIMA. The current loan amount that she is requesting is $1,000. The loan will be used for purchasing more grocery items in order to expand her business. This family has the ability to repay the loans.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items.

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Saroeurn Ruos already paid off the loan. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is married since 1980 and has 5 children, 3 daughters and 2 sons. She started planting flowers in 1980. Her husband farms. One of her sons is working in a security company in Phnom Penh city.   

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. The loan money will be used for preparing land, plowing and cleaning and repairing their house. This family has ability to repay the loans.

loans.use: Preparing land, cleaning and plowing for farming.  Also will be used for repairing their house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sokhorn Kath has enough money to pay off her loan early.

Thank you.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth I. is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is glad that she decided  to start her own metal shop a year ago. She enjoys running a successful business, and takes pride in meeting  the needs of her customers. She believes that this is a good time to expand, and has come to us for a loan to buy more gates and protectors to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more iron gates and protectors to sell

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is a widow with 3 children. She started silk production  15 years ago. She is currently living with her daughter and son-in-law. Her daughter is also making silk at home.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 which will be used buy silk materials and one new motorbike.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and a motorbike.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Heang Loeng has enough money to pay off her loan before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet was married in 1993. She has only one daughter who is studying in a primary school in her village. She currently sells groceries such as fruits, vegetables, meats and other food items from home. Her husband drives a motor taxi in Phnom Penh city. 
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 in order to buy stone pillars, lattice and zinc for repairing her house and purchasing more grocery items. By doing this, she can expand her business and will have the capacity to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing stone pillars, lattice and zinc for repairing her house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Thet Chay has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Lath

texts.en:
Lath is married since 1992 and has one son and two daughters. He is in business of driving remork (motor taxi with a carriage at the back). He started this business 12 years ago. His wife works in a garment factory. His two children study in primary school in the village.  

He is requesting a loan of $500 from MAXIMA in order to purchase lattice and zinc to repair his house. With his remork he can generate enough income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Buying lattice and  zinc to repair the house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Lath Prak has enough money to pay off his loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Say Mey

texts.en:
Say Mey was married in 1991 and has 2 children. She learned to weave silk in 1990 from her mother and then started silk production in 1991. Her husband is in the business of rice milling. He mills rice and charges fees from the villagers. He also assists his wife to weave silk when he is free from rice milling.         

Say Mey is requesting a loan of $300 from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread, and for fees she would have to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Say Mey Eng paid off her loan before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang was married in 1970 and has 5 children, 2 sons and 3 daughters. She makes her living by weaving silk. In addition, she also sells mangoes and steamed fish from home. She started this business in 1979. Her husband is a mason. Her 2 daughters assist her to weave silk at home. 

Lang is requesting a $300 loan from MAXIMA to buy mango stock which she can wholesale. She believes she can earn enough to support her family and repay the loan to MAXIMA. Furthermore, she can ensure all her children to go to school without any problems.

loans.use: Buying mangoes put in the stock for wholesale.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Lang Sok  has enough money to paid off her loan  early before contract. Now she is asking a nother loan for continueing her business.

Thank you.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter O. is a warm and faithful 33-year-old father who lives in Benin City, which is located in the Nigerian state of Edo. His company sells building materials, and he plans to use the loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Pham

texts.en:
Mrs. Pham T. C. is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and her daughter, aged, 17 in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Her son, 22 years old, is at Gym and Sports Teaching University in Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

As for Mrs C., contributing to social activities is something simple and natural. She was the vice-president of the women's union in her commune some years ago and now is a member of the Red Cross union. Doing many social activities doesn't mean that she ignores her own family and business. She has 5 pigpens with 50 breeding pigs. You may wonder how she can manage everything, and you may be surprised again when you know that she can keep everything clean and tidy. The answer is that she has a bio-gas plant, which is not only economical but also good for the environment. This time she wants to borrow $1,200.00 to buy 23 more breeding pigs and mash for them. She is determined to becomine a good example for the villagers. Such an admirable woman!

loans.use: She wants to buy 23 pigs and mash.

loans.name: Bibishoy

texts.en:
Bibishoj is 53. She is married and has 4 dependents. Two of her sons are in Russia and send money for the expenses of their families, who stay with Bibishoj. One of Bibishoy's son got married in Russia and brought his wife to Tajikistan. She stayed some time, bore a child and then left. Now her one-year-old son is with Bibishoj who is looking after the baby.

On the side Bibishoy is managing her business. She has a little shop located on the motorway near her house. Her husband helps her. Her shop is opened all the time for the customers. To increase the assortment of goods, Bibishoj got a loan from Microinvest. Now she hopes to get $1200 for the further extension of her assortment of goods and her business.

loans.use: Add more grocery products

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina has operated a women’s footwear kiosk for the past nine years in Melitopol, Ukraine. Hard working and sacrificial, Galina is the sole income provider for her family of three as well as her elderly parents.  Her outstanding work ethic combined with ongoing microfinance loans from Nadiya Ukraine has helped Galina to grow and sustain a profitable and successful business. Her loan repayments have always been timely and consistent. Currently, Galina is seeking a loan for $900 to increase her assortment of women’s footwear. With the additional profits, Galina hopes to open a second vending location for her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: For twelve years, Irina has operated a footwear sales kiosk in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has an outstanding reputation for consistently providing high quality footwear. A diligent worker and business owner, Irina’s husband has joined her in her work to help develop the business. Polite, respectful, and responsible, Irina has repaid all past loans through Nadiya Ukraine with a perfect credit history. Irina’s business is the sole source of her family’s income, supporting her daughter’s college tuition as well as her elderly parents. Currently, Irina is seeking a loan for $1000 to restock her footwear inventory. With her profits, she plans to expand her business and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Five years ago, Olga opened a small diner in the tourist area of Borislav, Ukraine. A widow and mother, Olga decided to use her experience and excellence in cooking and baking to support her small family. Olga’s diner is located in a picturesque area of Borislav and she enjoys a reputation for being the best cook in the area. Many tourists and residents of Borislav have become loyal customers of her diner.

Olga is personable and kind hearted. She offers not only excellent food, but outstanding service as well. She is a dedicated and hard working entrepreneur, often sacrificing her health to ensure the growth and productivity of her business. Currently, Olga is seeking a loan for $1000 to buy additional supplies and food items for her diner. With the profits, she plans to remodel her dinner and create more space for her fast growing business. In turn, she hopes to continue to serve loyal customers and attract new ones – offering all the opportunity to enjoy traditional Western Ukraine cuisine.

loans.use: Purchase food supplies

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
Dayanat (his sister is pictured ) is 28 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Djabrayil region. This single man is settled in Absheron region, Binegedi shosse.

In the beginning of his business he sold only clothes. Then he started to sell foodstuffs also. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs for improving his business. He has been in this business for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator and foodstuffs

loans.name: Umrijon

texts.en: Umrijon has been on a pension for a long time, but still works on a Dekhkan farm. Payment for her work is little, but every year during apricot harvest time, she is granted an area with apricot trees. She dries the apricots from the trees with her family (on photo). She also tries to buy more fresh apricots and dry them. She needs money in order to purchase these apricots. Every year she tries to dry more, because her family lives off the sales in the winter. A year ago she got her first loan from Microinvest. This loan helped to earn profit that was spent for her family. This year she plans to take a loan again in order to buy and dry apricots. She asks for $1000 for 12 months.

loans.use: to buy and dry apricot

loans.name: Istat

texts.en: Istat is 21 years old, but in spite of her young age she has been trading at the market already for 5 years. She is not married; after graduating from school she started to help her mother at the market. She sells an assortment of women’s clothes. After gaining experience in trading, her mother started to trust her, and today Istat goes to buy goods by herself. Two years ago she got her first loan in Microinvest. Istat is very accountable and punctual; she has many regular customers. Now is the summer season, and goods are selling quickly. She would like to get $1200 to increase the assortment and quantity of her goods for 12 months.

loans.use: to increase assortment and quantity of her goods

loans.name: Sakhib

texts.en:
Sakhib started this business 4 years ago. This man is the father of 2 children. He is 52 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Djabrayil region. He and his family are settled in the Absheron region, Binegedi shosse.

He sells agricultural produce. You can see in the picture his new shop. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs for his new shop.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en: Zarif is 29 years old. He is educated, married and has 2 children. His wife does not work and stays home to look after their children. He works on a farm in Dekhkan, where he has the opportunity to breed cattle. He also has several gobies (fish) and cows. He has 10 years work experience and he likes his job. On the photo, you can see his pride – a tribal ox. By local measure, it is a very big ox, and Zarif is going to continue to breed it. Now is the season for cultivating hay and raising cattle. Zarif would like to get a loan to breed cattle and gobies.

loans.use: To breed cattle and gobies

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en: Abdujalil is 37, he is married and has three children. Abdujalil has run his business reselling natural fabric for 7 years. At the beginning, he worked in local markets and now he rents a shop near the central market. In April of 2005, Abdujalil received his first loan of $100 for two months to expand his business. Step by step, participating in the Microinvest loan program he received a maximum amount of $900. With loans from Microinvest, Abdujalil has expanded his activity and assortment of products. Besides fabric, he started to sell more expensive goods, such as sweaters and jackets from Angora. The price for these kinds of goods is from $50 to $100 per item. Before Abdujalil was bringing his products from Istaravshan, which is 170 km from Isfara. Now he goes to Bishkek and Karosu in Kyrgyzstan. In the future Abdujalil is planning to go to Iran and Dubai to bring in products. In order to expand his business Abdujalil needs $1200 for 12 months.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en: U. Ibrohim is 33 years old. He has a wife and 2 children. He has worked with his brothers for many years. One brother sells sport clothes and shoes. Another sells spare parts of cars. They all help each other in their businesses. Ibrohim also has his own business – he sells electro meters and spare parts of electro meters. He specializes in electrical appliances and demand for his products is good. He also repairs electrical appliances.  In order to increase his sales, he decided a year ago to take out a loan, which helped to increase his sales many times. Now he is going to open a new business – selling clothes. He has rented a small shop for this purpose, and he now needs $1200 to start his business.

loans.use: to open new business – selling clothes

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica is the president of the borrower's group Asociación Comunal Chévere. Her group is one of the oldest groups in ProMujer, and it is made up of 18 women with a common affinity, each with the objective to grow their businesses and improve their quality of life.

The Las Chévere group is in its 16th credit cycle within ProMujer. That means that the women of this group have successfully paid back 16 groups loans with 6-month loan terms (as a maximum) for each of them. As a group, they are soliciting a "temporary credit" that will permit them to grow their businesses during this loan cycle. In Angelica's case, she is hoping to use this loan to prepare her restaurant, which is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto. She will use this loan to purchase provisions that will get her ready to receive clients during the August "fiestas patrias," when her business swells as her neighbors come out to honor the patron saint of her community.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica es socia y presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Chévere. Esta es una de las asociaciones más destacadas en Pro Mujer, esta compuesta por 18 mujeres de afinidad común, todas con el objetivo de prosperar en sus negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida. Las Chévere se encuentran en el décimo sexto ciclo de créditos en Pro Mujer, es decir que fueron financiadas en 16 oportunidades con créditos ya cancelados en un lapso de 6 meses cada uno como un plazo máximo. Como asociación, van en busca de un crédito de temporada que les permita abastecer sus negocios, como el caso de Angélica, que desea contar con dinero para preparar su restaurante, ubicado en la zona 16 de Julio y provisionarse de insumos y alimentos para recibir a la clientela que se dará cita de forma masiva en las actividades a desarrollarse en homenaje a las fiestas patrias en el mes de agosto.

loans.use: Angelica wants to buy ingredients and foods for her restaurant, in advance of civic celebrations.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Angel has a small store where he sells snacks and foods. He also makes lunches and delivers them to construction sites during the week. He has had this business for about five years after he lost his job where he worked as a supplies salesman.

Angel is optimistic about receiving his second loan from Kiva and Mifex. With the first he was able to make some physical improvements to his store after investing in a variety of products. He served as a great leader in his community and has inspired other micro entrepreneurs in his area to work with our program. He is seeking to use his second loan in order to plastics to sell. He is a very hard worker who runs his business from early in the morning until 10 PM.

Angel is 31 years old and does not have a family. Currently he is studying at a local university on the weekends in order to get his degree. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: Invest in plastic kitchen ware and home items

loans.name: Reyes Rojas

texts.es:
M. Y. Reyes Rojas was born August 29th, 1962 in Chocolá, San Pablo Jocopilas in the state of Suchitepequez. Her parents, Juan Reyes and Catalina Rojas also come from Chocolá. Mirian has five siblings. Three are married and two are single. She did not care for studying as a child, but when she was older and had to work she became involved with a small enterprise institution through which she learned embroidery. With her fellow students she travelled to Mazatenango and San Bernardino, where she met other women interested in learning embroidery. They organized sewing classes at M.'s home.
