Con tu ayuda Blanca y su hija podrán hacer crecer su negocio, en tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlas.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Y. Murod is 69 years old. His wife died and he has 1 child. For 20 years, he has been in the trading system. He has a small store where he has been selling cooling drinks, beer, cigarettes and other small stuff. The uniqueness of his business is that he trades night and day, he is always in his shop and sometimes even sleeps there. His shop is located on the highway and many people stop to buy water and to have a rest. His trade goes well and now he wants to purchase drinks. He asks for $1200 for 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar is married and has two children – a boy and a girl. Her husband is distant from them looking for money in other countries, in Russia for example, where he decided to open his own business – he started to trade food products. In the beginning, his business was not big and could be placed on a small counter. Munavvar in that time was looking after her small son. Gradually the son became older and she started to help her husband to trade. She came to Microinvest 4 years ago, when they started from a small amount of $60. This money they spent as current capital. The business grew and it was time to think about their expansion of trade. The spouses decided to rent a small store. Today her business is a store with an assortment of goods, from food products to industrial goods. All their family is involved in the business and the spouses can live to trade with their children. Now they want to take a loan out to purchase a freezer and to renew their current capital. They need $120 - 200 for a freezer and $1000 to purchase other goods. The term of loan is for 14 months.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and to renew current capital

loans.name: Maxuda

texts.en: Maxuda is married and has 1 child. She has a small shop in the center of the village where she lives. Trade in her shop goes well and profit is good. The profit from her business she spends on her family and she also saves some. Every year in July she buys fresh apricots and dries them. It brings additional profit to her family. The season lasts for 15-20 days and during this time she has time to dry all the apricots. She also hires additionally 10-12 workers and pays for their work. When she found out about Microinvest she decided to take a loan and expand her activity of apricot drying. Now it's July and she wants to get a new loan for apricot drying. She asks for $1200 for 10 months.

loans.use: for apricot drying

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en: Mumina is married and has three children. She lives in Kairakkum in her house with a garden. She and her husband don’t work anywhere, but her family is very industrious and that’s why upon moving from her village to the town they decided to buy livestock and look after it. Starting to work with Microinvest, she got her first loan 3,5 years ago and after adding some of her own money they bought young gobies and a cow. By fattening livestock and selling it her family significantly improved their social position. Additionally to this Mumina and her husband spent part of the profit on opening a small food store. Now they have two cows and one goby. She asks for $1200 to increase her current capital: $200 for purchase stern, $1000 to purchase 4 young gobies. The term of the loan is 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase stern and 4 young gobies

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is 35 years old; she is married and has 5 small children. She works as a farmer on Dekhkan farm. She is paid very little and it’s not enough for life. Her husband works in Russia and sends her some money. On the side, she buys fresh apricots and dries them with her family every year. At the end of July she keeps ready apricot and at the beginning of December sells it on the local market. She came to Microinvest a year ago and got her first loan. Now she wants to ripen apricots for the new season and she wants to get $1200 for 12 months, to buy more apricot in order to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy and dry apricot

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en: Safarboy’s family consists of 6 small children and his wife. He is 45 years old and works in the national tea-house “Shabboda”, where he cooks popular Tajik dish - plov. Many who come to Isfara come to his tea-house to eat plov during lunch time. His earned money is enough only to live, but not for something more. That’s why he decided simultaneously to breed cattle at home. His wife doesn’t work anywhere and helps him at it. Some months ago he got a loan in Microinvest to increase his current capital. He also plans to take a bigger amount to increase his live-stock. An amount of $1000 is enough for him for the first time.

loans.use: to increase live-stock

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en: Ikrom has been doing business already for some years. He is married and has 2 children. His business consists of two parts. He himself sells spare parts for cars on spare parts markets and his wife sells national tajik kerchiefs in a central market. Both businesses form Ikrom’s family income. In the morning, Ikrom helps his wife to spread her goods on the counter and goes to sell spare parts. In the afternoon they sell kerchiefs together. A year ago, Ikrom came to Microinvest. As his business is capital-intensive, the first amount he took was $850. The whole loan he spent on purchasing spare parts. It gave him an opportunity to increase his assortment and improve the quality. After the redemption of his first loan, he decided to take his loans further. Now he is going to expand his wife’s business and to purchase kerchiefs. He asks for this $1200 for 12 months.

loans.use: to expand his wife’s business

loans.name: Sabo

texts.en: T. Sabo has helped her parents to bake lepeshki (tajik bread) from childhood. It is not easy work and needs not only knowledge, but also patience. They prepare dough from late at night and at 3 in the morning its rolled and pawned in a stove. Her family helps her at this work. At 6-7 in the morning, the ready lepeshki are taken away to the market. In this way her family works every day. A year ago she got a loan from Microinvest and she spent it on purchasing raw materials and coal. It allowed her to get an additional profit. Now she wants to store more flour and coal. She asks for $1200 for 12 months to do this.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and coal

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: During the Soviet period, she was teaching Russian language and literature to Tajik children at school. But, her earned money from teaching was not enough to live. Eight years ago she started to trade in children's clothes. She brings goods from Istaravshan, which is located 150km away from Kanibadam and from neighboring Kokand city in Uzbekistan. A year ago, she got a $160 loan from Microinvest, which she spent on renewing her circulating assets. The assortment of her goods has improved and she has increased the number of her regular customers. The market in which she was trading before was moved to another place. That’s why she wants to expand her assortment, in order to attract customers in this new place as well, and also to equip her trading place. She needs $1000 for 12 months for this.

loans.use: To expand her assortment and to equip a trading place

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.en: Murtazo is a 30 year old young man. He is married (his wife is on the photo) and he has 3 small children. He has no constant work, which is why he decided to trade goods. He has chosen food products and cooling drinks. His shop is located on a car route, which links the district centre where he lives, Lohuti and the regional centre, Khujand. Trade here is very active and almost every day he goes to buy goods. In March of this year, he decided to take a loan in Microinvest to renew his small shop. Now he wants to get $1200 for 12 months to purchase cooling drinks, as some increase is possible in their price.

loans.use: To purchase cooling drinks

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.en: Sarvar S.  is 47 years old and she raises three children herself.  She has been engaged in trading for some years already. She sells children's clothes and footwear. Previously she traded at the markets and went to the villages. Now she has rented a department in the local shop because her business demanded more space.  Her first loan was used for increasing her assortment of goods. Now it’s the summer season and she would like to increase her assortment by adding the seasonal children's footwear and therefore  she would like to receive the loan.

loans.use: Add seasonal children's footwear

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Rano has a high education, but she had no permanent work. The work which is available in their location does not give the opportunity to earn money enough to support the family.

Rano started trading some years ago. At that time, her business was small and took little space. Today she has rented a place in the shop and her goods occupy some meters. Two years ago, Rano received her first loan from Microinvest. This loan gave her an opportunity to increase the assortment of her goods. Today she hopes to receive a new loan for further extension of her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rakhima (her husband is pictured) is a 27-year-old mother of 2 children. She and her family live in Baku city, Sabunchu region. Rakhima started this business  5 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of her business and to buy foodstuffs in order to increase her income to cover all family expenses.

loans.use: To expand the area of her business and to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en: Vusala is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Baku city, Surakhani region. She has her own store, where she sells foodstuffs. Vusala started this business 6 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $950 to  buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella is 51 years old and single, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Djabrayl region. She is settled in Bakiu City, Surakhany region.
She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel is a very hard working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband works only on certain seasons and on occasions he spent a long time without perceiving any income. In order to afford the expenses of her family and improve their quality of life, Maria started her own business seven years ago.

She sells cosmetics, fixes flower bouquets and seams. She learned these trades from her mother and decided to put them in practice to move on ahead.

Her daughter's help has been fundamental to the growth of her business. Now, Maria Isabel is requesting a loan for $250 which she will employ in the purchasing of merchandise in order to increase the diversity of products she offers and improve her sales. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 3 months. You can be an important part of the development of this business, and improve the quality of life of this family. They will be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria Isabel es una mujer entusiasta y muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene una hija, su esposo trabaja sólo por temporadas y en ocasiones pasaba mucho tiempo sin recibir un ingreso, para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida Maria inició su propio negocio desde hace siete años, en el que vende cosméticos, hace arreglos florales y costuras, ella aprendió de su madre estos oficio y decidió ponerlos en práctica para salir adelante con su familia.

La ayuda de su hija ha sido fundamental en el crecimiento del negocio, ahora Maria Isabel solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de los productos que ofrece y mejorar sus ventas, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is married and has five children. She used to work for an insurance company, but she spent all day away from her home and away from her children. In order to spend more time with her family without stopping to make an income, Maricela opted for starting her own business.

Since three years ago she sells fruits and vegetables. She adapted a space in her house for her business and now she is helped by her children in her store. Together they have managed to improve the service they provide to their clients and increase sales.

Currently, Maricela is requesting a loan for $250 which she will use to purchase merchandise and cover the demand of her clientèle. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 3 months. Be an important part of Maricela's achievements! She and her family need of your support and are appreciative of the trust and help you provide them with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maricela es casada y tiene cinco hijos, anteriormente ella trabajaba para una empresa aseguradora, pero todo el día la pasaba fuera de su hogar y lejos de sus hijos, para poder pasar más tiempo con su familia sin dejar de percibir un ingreso Maricela optó por iniciar su propio negocio, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de frutería, adaptó un espacio de su hogar para su negocio y ahora recibe la ayudad de sus hijos en la atención de su tienda, juntos han logrado mejorar el servicio que ofrecen a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

En estos momentos, Maricela solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Maricela, ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo y agradecen mucho la confianza y ayuda que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Ever since 10 years ago, Victoria started her own business. She offers her Hair Stylist services in order to provide for her expenses and that of her parents who are in their old age. She is young and entrepreneurial, with a great drive to move on ahead.

Fortunately, the good service she offers has helped her to maintain the business for such a long time. As she has taken courses to keep up to date, she has incorporated acrylic nails into her services. The demand for this service has increased quickly which has allowed her go grow as an entrepreneur.

In order to offer a quality service to her clientèle, Victoria is requesting a loan for $250 with which she will purchase the supplies required for her job. She is offering to pay back this quantity in 3 months. Today is the time to help. Victoria thanks the opportunity to grow and the support you provide her with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Desde hace 10 años Victoria inició su propio negocio donde ofrece sus servicios de estilista para poder cubrir sus gastos y los de sus padres que son de edad avanzada, ella es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación. Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a mantenerse durante tanto tiempo y al hacer cursos de actualización ahora también ha incorporado la aplicación de uñas de acrílico, la demanda por este servicio se ha incrementado rápidamente y esto le ha permitido crecer como microempresaria.

Para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, Victoria solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere en la elaboración de su trabajo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar, Victoria agradece mucho la oportunidad de superarse y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchasing Supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is an active and entrepreneurial woman. She is married with two children, aged 20 and 26. Ramon, her husband, works as a driver but the wages he makes are too low. Facing a lack of resources, Juana has been selling foods since her children were very young in order to make an extra income and cover for some of her house's expenses.

Since six years ago, she has specialized to the production solely of tamales. Fortunately, the good quality of her products has helped her to remain in business and increase her clientèle.

Now, she is planning to start offering her products to companies, for which she needs to increase her production. That is why she is requesting a loan for $200 which she will use in purchasing supplies for the production of her products. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and make your mind to help this family! Juana sincerely thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Juana es una mujer emprendedora y activa, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 20 y 26 años de edad, Ramón, su esposo, trabaja como chofer pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, ante la falta de recursos Juana se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas desde que sus hijos eran muy pequeños para poder obtener un ingreso y cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, desde hace seis años se dedica sólo a la elaboración y venta de tamales, afortunadamente la buena calidad de sus productos le ha ayudado a permanecer en el negocio e incrementar su número de clientes.

Ahora planea ofrecer sus productos en las empresas, para esto necesita incrementar su producción, por lo que ahora solicita un préstamo de $200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a ayudar a esta familia, Juana te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchasing Supplies

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha Alicia is hard working and very responsible. She has two children, aged 21 and 22. She lives with her common law who works as a construction worker. The wages he makes are too low and insufficient to afford all the houses expenses.

In order to help her family and improve their quality of life, Martha started selling used clothing 4 years ago. With the help of one of her brothers who works temporally in the U.S.. He finds the clothes and she sells them in her house.

Lately the have received a good response from their clientèle and have incorporated the sale of other products for the home. Hence, the business has grown.

Martha wishes to increase her sales and open a stand in flea markets. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for $250 which she will use in purchasing the required merchandise to increase the variety of her products and offer a good service to her clients. She is offering to pay back this amount in 3 months. With your help you can improve the quality of life of this family. Martha thanks the opportunity and the support you bring her.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Martha Alicia es muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene dos hijos de 21 y 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre, su pareja se desempeña como albañil y el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, para poder ayudar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida Martha inició con la venta de ropa usada desde hace cuatro años, con ayuda de uno de sus hermanos que trabaja temporalmente en Estados Unidos, él consigue la ropa y ella se dedica a venderla en su casa, últimamente han recibido buena respuesta de sus clientes y ha incorporado la venta de otros productos para el hogar con esto ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Martha deseas poder incrementar sus ventas y abrir un puesto en los mercados rodantes, por lo que ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, Martha agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Maria Josefina is married and has two children, who are six and twelve years old. With the birth of her last child, the costs of living increased and the salary of her husband was insufficient for all the expenses. So Maria decided to start her own business with cosmetic sales. In this way, she is able to contribute to improving her family's quality of life. The good services and the easy payment options that she offers have been very well recieved. Thanks to the recommendations of her clients, she now has lots of orders.

At this time, Maria hopes to see her business grow more than ever. The costs of raising her children have increased a lot now that they are studying, and since classes are starting soon, she needs to buy the school materials that they require. She is now requesting a loan of $200 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise to fill the orders that she already has. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Be a part of making this business grow and help Maria. She greatly appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Maria Josefina es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 12 años de edad, al nacer su último hijo, las necesidades del hogar se incrementaron y el salario de su esposo era insuficiente para todos los gastos, por lo que Maria decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, de esta manera es como ella puede contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el buen servicio que ofrece y las facilidades de pagos que les ofrece han sido muy bien aceptados, gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ahora tiene muchos más pedidos.

En estos momentos Maria desea ver crecer su negocio más que nunca, pues los gastos en su hogar se han incrementado mucho por los estudios de sus hijos, ya casi es inicio de clases y necesita comprarles el material que requieren. Ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que planea surtir pedidos que ya tiene, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, y ayuda Maria, ella agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to fill her orders for cosmetics

loans.name: Elia Yaneth

texts.es:
Elia is a very hard worker. She is separated from her husband and has five children that depend completely on her. Her children are one, five, eight, twelve, and fourteen years old. Previously she worked as an employee in an assembly plant, but her children were growing and the salary that she received was becoming more and more inadequate. So she decided to begin her own business four years ago. Now she makes the uniforms for various schools, and thanks to her efforts and the quality of service that she offers, she has succeeded in growing as a small entrepeneur.

In order to meet her demands, Elia is requesting a loan of $200 dollars that she will invest in the raw materials for making school uniforms. Now she greatly needs this capital because there is very little time before school classes start again. Elia promises to repay this loan in three months. With your help, she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. They greatly appreciate your trust and support. Decide today to help Elia.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Elia es muy trabajadora, ella esta separada y tiene cinco hijos que dependen solamente de ella, de 1, 5, 8, 12 y 14 años de edad. Anteriormente ella laboraba en una maquiladora pero sus hijos fueron creciendo y el salario que ella recibía fue haciéndose cada vez más insuficiente, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 4 años, ahora elabora los uniformes de varias escuelas y gracias a su esfuerzo y al servicio de calidad que ofrece ha logrado crecer como microempresaria.

Para poder cubrir su demanda, Elia está solicitando un préstamo de $200 dólares que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los uniformes escolares, ahora necesita mucho de este capital porque falta poco para el inicio de clases, Elia se compromete a regresar este crédito en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo, decídete a ayudar a Elia.

loans.use: To buy materials to sew school uniforms

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza lives in the town of Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has three children. In order to improve the quality of life for her family, four years ago she decided to begin her own business with the production and sales of tamales and chorizo, because the salary of her husband is small and insufficient for all the needs of living. Thanks to the quality of the products that she prepares and the demand from her clients, her business has been very good and has increased through the recommendations of her clients.

At this time, Esperanza is requesting a loan of $750 dollars that she will use to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her products. She promises to repay this loan in six months. Be a part of the growth of this business and help this family. Esperanza greatly appreciates the trust and support that you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León vive Esperanza, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, hace cuatro años ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de tamales y chorizo, ya que el salario de su esposo es poco e insuficiente para todas las necesidades de su hogar, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora, la demanda por ellos ha sido muy buena y se ha incrementado por las recomendaciones que hacen sus clientes.

En estos momentos Esperanza está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, Esperanza agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing her tamales and chorizo

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 49 years old, married, and has three children. For 25 years, he has been dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables. In pursuit of a better quality of life and to obtain the necessary resources for his family, he decided to begin his own business. Now he participates in various travelling markets around the town of Escobedo in Nuevo León, where he has gained a lot of clients. Fortunately, the good prices that he offers and the quality of his products have been fundamentals in the development of his business, and it has insured his livelihood for such a long time.

Manuel is requesting a loan of $925 dollars that he will use to purchase merchandise at wholesale, and in doing so, be able to continue offering affordable prices and remain his clients' preferred choice. He promises to repay this loan in six months. Manuel and his family greatly appreciate the trust and support that you offer them. Today is the time to help.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Manuel tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, ahora se instala en varios mercados ambulantes de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, donde ha logrado ganar muchos clientes. Afortunadamente los buenos precios que ofrece y la calidad de sus productos han sido fundamentales en el desarrollo de su negocio y le ha asegurado su permanencia durante tanto tiempo.

Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía al mayoreo, con esto podrá continuar ofreciendo precios accesibles y continuará con la preferencia de sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Manuel y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas, hoy es el momento de ayudar, decídete.

loans.use: To buy quality, affordable fruits and vegetables for his market stand

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a sewing business in her home. She helps her husband to cover their family expenses. She has applied to borrow $1200 from Al-Aman to purchase a new sewing machine and bring her sister to work with her in the same business. She is looking forward to a great future with her business, but at this time she is focused on helping her husband to improve the life of the family and their small kids.

Note: Personal characteristics of this borrower have been disguised (name changed, facial features masked) to protect their identity.

Disclaimer: This is a volatile region, and lending money in this area may present an increased risk. Lenders should take this into account when making their lending decision.

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Kafilat

texts.en: Kafila O. is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Adjamé, an active but small business zone of Abidjan. She has twelve years of work experience in selling cosmetic products. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more products for her business and generate more profit. Kafilat received her first loan from AE&I in May 2004 and has always repaid her loans without a problem. She strongly contributes to her family's revenue generation.

loans.use: Kafilat Oyenini will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine B. is a 52 year old dynamic woman. She is married and has five children. She has many years of work experience selling vegetables, fish and meat. She lives with her family in Adjame, a commercial township in north Abidjan. Her husband, a retired governmental agency employee, does not have enough resources to support the family making Francine a key contributor to her family's financial resources. She requests a loan to purchase more products in order to satisfy her customers' increasing demand.

loans.use: Francine will use the loan to purchase goods to sell at the market.

loans.name: Laide

texts.en: Laide A. is 32 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in Adjamé, a commercial township north of Abidjan. She has more than ten years of work experience in selling fashion products, especially body lotions, sprays etc. She is very dynamic and ambitious.  A. received her first from AE&I in October 2004 and has been a good performer so far. She requests the loan in order to develop her business and increase her revenue.

loans.use: Laide Aloyola will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Kie Bi

texts.en: Kie Bi G. T. is a dynamic 36 year old woman who has four children. She lives with her family in Abobo, the biggest township in north Abidjan. Kie Bi G. has sold fruits and legumes in Abobo's open market for more than 15 years. She is an ambitious woman who greatly contributes to the revenue generation of her family. She has sent all of her children to school and takes care of their education needs. She got her first loan from AE&I in January 2004 and has been a good performer so far. She wants to use the loan to purchase fruits and legumes in bulk and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: Kié Bi Gohi will use the loan to purchase goods for wholesale.

loans.name: Kouakou

texts.en: Kouakou K. is a 44 year old woman with three children. She lives in Anono, a township in the eastern suburb of Abidjan. She has sold grilled fish in Anono's open market since 1981. She is a dynamic woman. She is married and greatly contributes to her family's revenue generation. A portion of the profit from her business goes to pay school fees for her children, as they all go to school. She heard about AE&I in May 2004 from her friend and received her first loan two months later. She has been a good loan recipient.

loans.use: Kouakou Koffi will use the loan to purchase goods.

loans.name: Kouadio

texts.en: Kouadio A. is a 29 year old woman with two children. She lives in Abobo, a township north of Abidjan.  A. has been selling vegetables for many years and is good at her job. She got her first loan from AE&I in April 2005. She has performed very well in the repayment of all loans she has received from AE&I. She produces and sells palm bean in Abobo's open market. She is the main provider for her family. She is ambitious and a hard worker.

loans.use: Kouadio Amoin will use the loan to purchase goods.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi E. is a 36 year old woman. She lives with her three children in Abobo, a township north of Abidjan. She is a dynamic tradeswoman, selling aromas, various spices, and other products. She is the main provider for her family and in charge of paying school fees for her children. E. received her first loan from AE&I in February 2004 and has been a good performer so far. She wants to purchase goods in bulk and increase her profit in order to be able to pay school fees for her children in September.

loans.use: Koffi Edwige will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Lori

texts.en: Lori M. is a 55 year old dynamic craftswoman. She has been making pottery for more than 25 years. She is a well-known as a jar and pot maker in Abobo, a township north of Abidjan. She is a widow, taking care to her six children with revenues generated from her art. She is a motivated and ambitious woman. She wants to use the loan to increase her production of jars and thereby increase her revenue. She received her first loan from AE&I in December 2004 and has been a good performer so far.

loans.use: Lori Matomo will use the loan to increase her pottery production

loans.name: Maniga

texts.en: Maniga is 44 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Maniga lives with her family in Abobo, a township in the north of Abidjan. She sells fruits and legumes in the Abobo open market. She is a dynamic woman who strongly contributes to her family's revenue generation. She heard about AE&I in June 2004 and got her first loan one month later. She is a good performer. She will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk and improve her revenues. Her 4th child (a boy) will attend grammar school in September, and she wants to be ready to pay his school fees.

loans.use: Maniga Gondo will use loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en: Rachelle O. is a dynamic 32-year-old  woman. She has 2 children and lives with her family in Adjamé, a commercial township in the north of Abidjan. Rachelle has been a cosmetic products seller since she was 16. She benefited from her first loan from AE&I in October 2004 and has been a good performer since then. Her business is well managed and she wants to purchase fashion products to improve her margin and revenues. Rachelle is an ambitious and well organized woman.

loans.use: Rachelle Oyelekou will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Miss Van is 38 and her husband is 41 years old. They have 4 children between 17 and 8. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Mr Van suffers from cardiac disease and he often becomes insensible. Her first and second children stopped going to school so that they could work as day laborers. Her third and fourth children are in grade 7 and 4.

Miss Van makes dish soap at her house and then she sells it from door to door. This work helped Miss Van’s income increase by $1/person/month to an average income of $12/person/month. Now she wants to borrow $75 so that she can buy more material for making dish soap.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for dish soap

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Miss Thuy is 31 and her husband is 36 years old. They have a child who is 1 year of age. They have to support his mother. They have land for growing rice, which is 1500 square meters. Her husband works as a day laborer but the work is not stable. So her selling rice cakes at the small market is important to increase their income by about $1/person/month, which brings their average income to $10 per person/month. Now Miss Thuy wants to borrow $75 for selling rice cakes. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Selling rice cakes

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Miss Phuong is 38 and her husband is 41 years old. They have two children between 11 and 9 who are going to school. They only have 2000 square meters of land for growing rice. Mr Nam, her husband, works as a day laborer but he can’t find work easily. Phuong buys waste daily for recycling from door to door and then sells it to the local recycling company. The activity helped to increase their income by about $0.5/person/month to an average of $11.5/person/month. Phuong asks to borrow $50 so that she can buy a larger amount of waste for recycling and sell it to the company.

loans.use: Buy waste to recycle

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Miss Diep is 34 and her husband is 35 years old. They have 4 children between 10 and 2. Her first and second are going school in grades 3 and 1. They only have 2000 square meters for rice cultivation. Mr Minh, her husband, works as a day laborer but he can’t find work easily. So her selling soya from to door helped to increase her income by about $1.5/person/month to an average income of $10/person/month. Now she asks to borrow $75 for her soya selling business and she will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Selling soya

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Miss Hong is 39 and her husband is 42 years old. They have three children between 15 and 10 who are going to school. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Her husband works as a day laborer but he only works in the dry season. Miss Hong sells food and soft drinks at the local market. Their income has increased by $1.2/person/month; however, their average income is low at $8 per person/month. She needs a loan of $75 for her selling business. She is going to repay monthly.

loans.use: sells food

loans.name: Tot

texts.en:
Miss Tot is 38 and her husband is 43 years old. They have 3 children. Her first daughter stopped going to school and her second is in grade 5. They don’t have a house or any land for cultivation so they have to stay in a rented house.

Miss Tot sells sweet soup at the local market. Her husband buys waste material from door to door and then sells it to the local recycling company. They repaid a loan on time and from that loan increased their family income by about $2/person/month. Their average income is $11.5/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for their selling business.

loans.use: Sells sweet soup

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.en: Kouassi A. is a 31-year-old dynamic single mother. She lives in Abobo with her 7-year-old daughter. Kouassi attended a hairdressing training centre for 3 years until 2006 and her dream and life project is to open a beauty salon. She is dynamic and has started by offering hand hairdressing services in Abobo open market. She is seeking microcredit funds to purchase hair dressing equipment to improve her performance and increase her revenues. She heard from AE&I through her sister. She has benefited from a first loan from AE&I which was reimbursed without problem.

loans.use: Kouassi Amenan will use the loan to purchase hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Ngoran

texts.en: Ngoran A. is 29 years old. She has one boy and lives with her family in Abobo, a township in North Abidjan. She sells grilled and fresh fish in Abobo open market. She has been doing this business for more than 10 years. She strongly contributes to her family revenue as her partner lost his job last year. She expects to send her 6-year-old boy to primary school in September and would like to strengthen her financial resources by increasing the volume of her activities and improving profit. She joined AE&I Microcredit in March 2006 and has performed very well since then. She will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk and benefit from a lower purchase price.

loans.use: Ngoran Aya will use the funds to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Ahou

texts.en: Ahou B. is a dynamic young lady. She is 24 years old and she has managed her own cosmetics products store since May 2005 in Adjamé open market. She is a single woman and has no children. She lives in Adjame, a commercial township in North Abidjan. She has rapidly developed her business during the last 2 years. Ahou wants to take advantage of the holiday season to offer new fashion products to young ladies. She got her first loan from AE&I in February 2006 and has been a good performer since then.

loans.use: Ahou Brigitte will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta D. is a 19-year-old young lady who lives with her family in Adjame, a township in North Abidjan. She has been in the clothing business since 4 years ago when she stopped secondary school to manage her mother's clothing business. Her mother is sick and can no longer operate the business by herself, so she handed over the business successfully to her daughter. She now wants to expand the business. She benefited her first loan from AE&I on March 2006 and repaid it properly. She is dynamic and ambitious.

loans.use: Fanta Doumbia will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy E. K. is 34 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with his wife and their 4 children. Mr. Suy and his wife operate two small businesses--one washing motorbikes and cars, and another raising and selling pigs. Their combined income from these activities is about $6/day, which is just enough to send their children to school.

Mr. Suy E. K. will use this loan to purchase more pigs and feed for raising his animals. He knows he can increase his income if he raises more pigs, and the business also allows him to continue washing motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and feed

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Suy Eang Kou has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Mr. Oung H. is 58 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with his wife and their 5 children.  He and his wife work together fixing bicycles.  They earn about $5/day in their business.  Two of their children work at a garment factory, and the other 3 go to school and help the family by cooking meals.  Mr. Oung H. will use this loan to purchase more spare parts and tools for his bicycle repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase spare bicycle parts and some tools for his repair business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Oung Horn has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Ea

texts.en: Mrs. Ea T. is 21 years old and recently married.  She works in Siem Reap, near the temples of Angkor selling souvenirs to tourists.  She earns an average of $2/day in this business, although more during high tourist season.  Her husband, 23, is a construction foreman and earns $4/day.  The couple does not yet have any children.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Ea T. to purchase more souvenirs for selling.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to own a souvenir shop for tourists to visit, and also to sell wholesale items to other small sellers.

loans.use: To purchase souvenir products for her business, and to repair her home

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry P. is a 36-year-old housewife who takes care of her husband and 6 children in Siem Reap.  Her husband works as a construction foreman and earns about $5/day in this business.  Her six children are still students, although some of them work selling souvenirs around Angkor Wat after school.  Currently, Mrs. Ry P. pays motorbike taxis to take her husband and children to and from work and school.  She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike so she can take them each day, saving the family money in the long term.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport her family to and from work.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun H. is a 57-year-old housewife who lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 2 children.  Her husband is a mototaxi driver, and one of her children works at a garment factory.  Together, the family earns about $8/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to drive.  They can then use the old bike to rent out while her husband uses the new one for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her family's business

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sun Han and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is 56 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  Mrs. Chea is a housewife, and her husband is a carpenter who earns about $5/day.  One of her children works in construction and can earn about $4/day.  Mrs. Chea S. is worried because her family spends a lot of money on transportation every day, taking taxis to and from work and school.  She will use this loan to buy the family a used motorbike so they can transport themselves.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chea Sakhorn start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Mr. Cheam K. is 34 years old and lives in Prey Veng with his wife and their child.  He is looking to start a new business, buying and selling rice out of a very small store.  Currently, he is a motortaxi driver but he does not earn enough money at this job--only about $2/day.  His wife sells rice and earns about $3/day in profit.  This loan will be used by Mr. Cheam K. to buy an inventory of rice, and also to build a small store for him to buy and sell rice out of.  His wife will help in this business and they are confident that they can purchase rice in bulk from local farmers and sell it for a profit in the market.

loans.use: Building and investing in a new rice store

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. Recently her elder son married, and her daughter, after graduating from school, looks after the house and sometimes goes to help her mother. Rano started her business by trading female clothes and footwear, then she rented a department in a big supermarket and turned to a new assortment of goods – trading gift sets and bed-clothes. The profit from the trade allows her to cover family expenses.

Receiving a loan from Microinvest, she included kids' toys in her inventory. For the goods Rano goes to Kora-suw, which is located ten hours from her house. Rano plans to expand her business and therefore she hopes to receive a loan from KIVA investors.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Mrs. Vorng P. P. is 35 years old and works two jobs in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  First, she is a teacher and can earn only $2/day at this job.  She also works with her husband selling medicines and medical supplies to people in their village.  This gives them enough income to support their 3 young children.  Mrs. Vorng P. P. will use this loan to purchase more medicines for her store because the local people are demanding more and more of her products.  In the future, she and her husband want to open a bigger pharmacy with a variety of medicines and supplies.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her small pharmacy

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Mr. Cheam S. works as a tailor in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  He earns only about $1/day from his business, while his wife (pictured here) earns $2/day as a grocer.  Together, their earnings are just enough to support their 2 children, although they would like to start earning more.  Mr. Cheam S. has a good clientbase and would like to take this loan so he can purchase more cloth for his business.  As he attracts more and more clients, he dreams of one day of hiring two other employees and opening a bigger tailoring shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for his inventory

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Mrs. Yorng P. is 44 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children. She sells Khmer noodles to the people in her village, and earns about 3 USD a day in profits. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about 5 USD a day. This loan will be used for the purchase of a motorbike so she can stop paying daily fees for taxis. This way, she can take her children to school and her husband to work for a cheaper price per day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her husband to work

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Yorng Phout start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Sroam

texts.en: Mrs. Sroam P. works with her husband in Siem Reap Province fishing. She is 24 years old, and she and her husband currently have one child that they support. Her husband works mostly as a fisherman, but also works part time as a construction worker when the fishing is bad in the Tonle Sap Lake. This loan will be used to purchase a new fishing net and small wooden boat for Mrs. Sroam P..

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and boat

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sroam Prok and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Beoung

texts.en: Mrs. Beoung M. is 58 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 5 children.  Her husband is a fisherman, while she sells his catch along with others at the market.  Combined, they earn about $7/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a new net and also a boat to improve their fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing net for her fishing business

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Beoung Mouy start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom Y. is 58 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small grocery stand at home and earn just a meager sum each day. To make more income provide for the family’s expenses, two of her children work at the garment factory, one of whom is a construction foreman. The rest are all students. Currently, Prom Y. needs a motor-bike for one of her children to go to work, and she plans to use the leftover money from the loan to add more products for her inventory.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her children to go to work and another part of the loan is to add more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov Khum is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband make their living by purchasing mango from someone’s plantation and reselling them to the wholesalers and retailers at a market--together, they earn an average of $3 each day. This kind of income is barely enough to support her entire family, but she has a client base. Nov Khum needs a loan to to invest in her market stall by purchasing as many mango as she can afford to meet her clients’ needs. In the future, if she makes enough, she would like to purchase a car to help in her business.

loans.use: To purchase many mango for her market stall

payments.comment: Noc Sok has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Mrs. Soeu L. is 50 years old and lives with her 3 children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow and now she stays at home – cooking meals and looking after her children. To supplement the family, one of the children works very hard as a motor-taxi driver and makes around $3 each day, which is a big help for his family. Currently Soe L. is requesting the loan amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to operate his business. In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to own a small grocery store at home, so that she can make more profits for her household.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to operate a business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Soeu Lang start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa S. is 40 years old and a widow who lives with her 3 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. By the way, one of her children works at a small private company, and the rest are enrolled in school. In order to support her household and pay for her children's school fees, S. runs a small grocery booth at home and makes around $2/day of income. S. would like to continue increasing her profits by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs. She believes it will enable her to generate more income if she can add a variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en: Zaira is a dedicated entrepreneur who has faithfully run her little clothing sales kiosk for twelve years. Her business is located at the busy central market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has gained much experience over the years she has been in business. She currently makes around $300 in profit each month which is valuable income for her and her husband, Uriy. She has requested a loan of $600 to help her purchase necessary inventory. She has been a great client with Nadiya Ukaine in the past. We are grateful for this opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim N. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells rice and different kinds of Khmer foods to the retailers and makes on average $3-6 each day. Meanwhile, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and typically makes around $10/day in revenue. Currently, Soa Sokhom is requesting a loan to purchase some construction tools for her husband to operate his business, and the leftover money will be used to buy some utensils and equipments for her store.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband to operate a business and purchase more utensils and equipment for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in beverages and clothing

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es:
Rosa is 45 years old, cohabitates with her partner and has 4 children. He works as a bricklayer in construction and Rosa, in order to help with the maintenance of their house sells fruits, vegetables, and chicken parts at her home. On weekends she sells tortillas filled with beef, chicken, or vegetables. She belongs to the group “Moscoso 2” together with Ms. Irma Ozuna Navarro, who is in charge of home videogames. With this loan Ms. Rosa wants to setup a grocery store in her home to increase her income. On the other hand, Ms. Irma wants to setup a store in her home (she currently has only one TV to which a machine is connected to watch the videos) and purchase a projector that allows more children to be engaged in healthy and entertaining games.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene 45 años , vive en union libre con su pareja y tiene 4 hijos , el trabaja como ayudante de albañil en la construccion y rosa para ayudarlo en la mantencion de su hogar trabaja vendiendo verduras , frutas y pollos trozados en su casa y los fines de semana vende tortillas rellenas con carne , pollo o vegetales. Pertenece al grupo moscoso 2 , junto con doña irma ozuna navarro ( video juegos artesanales ). Con el prestamo doña rosa quiere coplocar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y asi aumentar sus ingresos. Por otro lado doña irma quiere poner un local en su casa ( ahora solo cuenta con un tv. Donde hace las conexiones con una maquina para ver ahí juegos de videos) y comprar un proyector que le permita mantener mas niños entretenidos en juegos de sana entretencion.

loans.use: Grocery and vegetable sales

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a rural taxi driver. She works selling clothes door to door in her community, which she buys at wholesale price at the Guatemalan border. She belongs to the group “Moscoso 2” together with Angelina Concepción Urbina who sells candy to schoolgirls and boys. With this loan Pascuala hopes to diminish the trips to the border and increase the quantity of clothes she purchases each time and therefore, increase her income. Angelina wants to establish a candy kiosk in a nearby high school located in her community.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Pascuala tiene 33 años , casada , tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja como taxista rural, ella vende ropa ofreciendo de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad, ella la compra en la frontera con guatemala al mayoreo. Pertenece al grupo moscoso 2. Junto con angelina concepcion urbina (vende dulces a los escolares ). Con el prestamo pascuala espera viajar a la frontera menos veces pero traer mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos. Angelina quiere poner un pequeño kiosco de dulces en una escuela secundaria cercana a su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing items

loans.name: Efraín

texts.en: Efraín has been repairing bicycles for twenty years. He works every day from 7am until 11pm helping customers fix their bikes, which for many people are their only mode of transportation. He has borrowed from Mifex before, applying the loan so that he could paint his shop and purchase bike components like sprockets, chains, and gears. He will use this loan to buy used bicycles that he can fix and resell. Efrain is 66 years old, and he lives alone. His wife passed away several years ago, and his four children are grown up. They visit frequently and help him run the shop from time to time. His wish is to continue serving more and more customers, helping them with their bike needs.

loans.use: Buy used bicycles he can repair

loans.name: Mar Ia  Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta is 44 years old and has been a widow for two years. She has 4 children. At home she sells novelties, toys, and office supplies to people in her community. With the loan, she wants to setup a small store, a bazaar, where she can sell her products. She belongs to the “Mocoso 2” group. The other members are Virginia Macal Urbina (clothing purchase and sale), and Graciela Ozuna Navarro (shoe sale by catalog). With the loan both want to invest in their businesses by purchasing merchandise to increase their sales and profits.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria antonieta tiene 44 años es viuda hace dos años , tiene 4 hijos. Tiene en su casa articulos de fantasias , juguetes y de oficina que vende a las personas de su comunidad con el prestamo quiere poner una tiendita como un bazar en donde vender sus productos. Pertenece al grupo moscoso 2, las otras integrantes del grupo son : virginia macal urbina ( compra y venta de ropa ), graciela ozuna navarro ( venta de zapatos por catalogo ). Con el prestamo ambas quieren invertir en sus negocios comprando mas mercaderia y aumentar las ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of office supplies and toys

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía is 23 years old, is married, has three children and her husband is a bricklayer working in construction. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells sugar, salt, pastas, oil and, candy. She is part of a solidarity group named “Montebello 2” together with Ms. Regina Santiz Gomez who is focused on raising pigs. With the loan, Lucía will supply her store with groceries and Regina will purchase maize to feed the animals and more piglets to increase the breed.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 23 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL DE UNA CONTRUCCION. ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE: AZUCAR, SAL, PASTAS, ACEITE, DULCES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UNGRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MONTEBELLO 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA REGINA SANTIZ GOMEZ QUE SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS. CON EL PRESTAMO LUCIA SURTIRA SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y REGINA COMPRARA MAIZ PARA LA ALIMENTACION DE LOS ANIMALES, TAMBIEN COMPRARA MAS PUERQUITOS PARA AUMENTAR LA CRIANZA.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 53 years old, married, has six children and her husband is a bricklayer. She is a merchant. She sells baked corn in the afternoons and on the weekends she sells traditional “antojitos” (little cravings) such as tacos, empanadas, and chalupas. She is part of a group named “Montebello 2” together with Cecilia Hernandez Giron, craftswoman, who embroiders napkins, blouses, and coarse cotton trousers. With the loan, Mercedes will invest in the improvement of her store where she sells her products because their preparation requires adequate space and cleanliness. Cecilia will purchase fabric and thread at wholesale prices. Both women will be able to increase their production and its sales.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

MERCEDES TIENE 53 AÑOS, CASADA, SEIS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL. ELLA ES COMERCIANTE, VENDE POR LAS TARDES ELOTES ASADOS Y LOS SABADOS Y DOMINGOS VENDE ANTOJITOS TRADICIONALES DE LA REGION COMO: TACOS, EMPANADAS, CHALUPAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO LLAMADO MONTEBELLO 2 QUE ESTA ADEMAS INTEGRADO POR CECILIA HERNANDEZ GIRON QUE ES ARTESANA, BORDA SERVILLETAS, BLUSAS, PANTALONES DE MANTA. CON EL PRESTAMO MERCEDES INVERTIRA EN EL MEJORAMIENTO DEL LOCAL DONDE VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS, YA QUE SE REQUIERE DE ESPACIO Y LIMPIEZA PARA PREPARARLOS; CECILIA COMPRARA TELA E HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI AMBAS PODRAN AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y LAS VENTAS DE LAS MISMAS.

loans.use: Sale of Traditional Foods

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma is 37 years old, she is married, has two children and her husband works as a sales agent in a pharmacy. Norma sells silver jewelry that she buys in Mexico City once a month and she sells it to acquaintances in her community and her family. She belongs to the group “Poderosas 1” together with Sandra Coronel H. (grocery store) and Gabriela P. H. (silver jewelry sales) . With this loan, Gabriela and Norma will travel to Mexico City to purchase more jewelry in order to increase their sales. Sandra will invest her part of the loan in supplying her store with merchandise and non-perishable food.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma tiene 37 años, está casada , tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como agente de ventas en una farmacia. Norma se dedica a la venta de joyerías de plata las que compra en la Ciudad de Mexico una vez al mes y las vende entre las personas conocidas de la comunidad y su familia. Pertenece al grupo Poderosas 1, junto con: Sandra Coronel H. (tienda de abarrotes) y Gabriela P. H. (venta de joyerias de plata). Con el prestamo, Gabriela y Norma viajaran a la Ciudad de Mexico a comprar mas joyerias para aumentar sus ventas y sandra invertira su parte del prestamo en abastecer su tienda con mercaderia y alimentos no perecibles.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a 70-year-old single woman who has a grocery store in her home. She also buys clothes at the border where it costs less, and sells it in her store. She belongs to the group “Poderosas 2” together with Maria Elena Alvarez Bautista (grocery store) and Maria Luisa Gomez V. (clothes sales in her home). With this loan they will purchase merchandise to supply the grocery stores as well as invest in the purchase of clothing items to have a larger variety to offer their clients.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Teresa tiene 70 años , es soltera , tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y tambien compra ropa en la frontera donde es mas economica y la vende en su local. Pertenece al grupo Poderosas dos y sus otras integrantes son : Maria Elena Alvarez Bautista (tienda de barrotes ) y Maria Luisa Gomez V. (vende ropa en su casa). Con el prestamo compraran mercaderia para abastecer las tiendas de abarrotes y ademas invertiran en la compra de ropa para poder tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes .

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga Lidia is 25 years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband has a serigraphy workshop at home. She sells clothes to her friends, relatives, and door to door. She purchases her merchandise on the border (Mesilla). She is part of the group ”Poderosas 2” together with Ms. Zoila Esperanza Muñoz (grocery store). With this loan, Olga Lidia will increase the amount of clothing items she purchases in order to make less trips to the border. Zoila will supply her grocery store with more food.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Lidia tiene 25 años , casada, tiene tres hijos. Su esposo tiene un taller de serigrafia en su casa y ella vende ropa entre sus amigas , familiares y de casa en casa. Su mercancia la compra en la frontera (Mesilla . Ella forma parte del grupo Poderosas 2 junto con Doña Zoila Esperanza Muñoz (tienda de abarrotes). Con el prestamo Olga Lidia aumentara la compra de ropa y asi tendra que realizar menos viajes a la frontera y Zoila abastecera su tienda de abarrotes con mas alimentos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
In the mornings, Juan shine shoes at the plaza Avaroa(Avaroa square). it is located in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. He works alone and has two children: one that is independent and the other of school age. His wife is a retailer. To supplement his income, during the weekends Juan works as an employee at a milk distribution agency.

He lives in the north zone of Achachicala and rents his dwellings. It is the fourth time that he asks for a loan from the IMPRO agency. His credit history with our institution qualifies him as a client #1, meaning he has fulfill the payments of his previous loans in good faith. The amount that he asks for will be used to buy materials needed for his shoe shine business like: creams, dyes, small brushes, rags, and to repair his shoe shine bench.

His past credit history and work allows him to access this loan. He has experience in this business which in turn gives him the income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Juan por las mañanas lustra calzados en la plaza Avaroa ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. El trabaja solo, tiene dos hijos uno que es independiente y el otro en edad escolar, su esposa es comerciante minorista. Para poder ayudarse en sus ingresos los fines de semana trabaja como empleado en una agencia de distribución de leche.

Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de norte de Achachicala y vive en alquiler (es decir que paga una renta mensual). Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de material que necesita para su negocio de “lustra botas”, como ser cremas, tintas, escobillas, paños y refaccionar su banca de lustrador.

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital for his shoe shine business.

loans.name: Escolastica Matilde

texts.es:
Escolastica is 47 years old, is married, and has 7 children. Her husband works as a driver in public transportation. She sells second hand clothes that she purchases by bundles from American companies. She then selects the clothing items she will sell in her home and from door to door. She belongs to the group “Poderosas 1” together with Ms. Guadalupe Hernandez Zambrano who sells perfumes and cosmetics. With the loan they will increase their purchase of merchandise in order to obtain a larger profit.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Escolastica tiene 47 años, casada , tiene 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de la locomocion colectiva. Ella se dedica a vender ropa usada que compra por fardos a empresas norteamericanas, posteriormente las selecciona y las vende en su casa y de puerta en puerta. Pertenece al grupo Poderosas 1 junto con Doña Guadalupe Hernandez Zambrano (vende perfumes y cosmeticos). Con el prestamo aumentaran las compras de sus mercaderias y asi obtendran mas ganacias.

loans.use: Purchase of second hand clothes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel sells api. Api is a hot beverage made out of corn which is very popular and common in La Paz. She also sells pastries and beignets at the Minibus #365 stop located in the Cotahuma zone in the city of La Paz. She works by herself everyday including the weekends.

The Api and the dough are prepared at home so in the mornings she can sell them directly from her stand.

She lives in the Miraflores zone. Isabel is 57 years old and is the mother of seven children. One of them takes care of her since the others are independent. It is the first time that she asks for a loan. The amount will be use for buying tables, benches and some pots for her stand.

Her work allows her to apply for this loan since she has more than 15 years of experience in this business. Her cash flow analysis shows enough income to cover her loan as well as her personal needs and that of her son.

Translated form Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Isabel vende api ( api es una bebida caliente hecha de maiz, muy comun en La Paz), con pasteles y buñuelos en la parada del Minibús # 365 ubicada en la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja sola todos los dias de la semana.

El Api y la masa son preparados en su casa para poder vender directamente por las mañanas en su puesto.

Vive en la zona de Miraflores, tiene 57 años y es madre de siete hijos de los cuales uno esta a su cargo ya que los demás son independientes. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mesas bancas y algunas ollas para su puesto de venta. Su trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia mas de 15 años en su negocio. El analisis de su flujo de caja muestra suficientes ingresos para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales y de su hijo.

loans.use: Working capital for her refreshments and pastries business.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is 44 years old, is married, and has 8 children. Her husband works as a bricklayer assistant in the construction field. She breeds chicken and then sells them among people in her community and in the city’s market as a traveling salesperson. She is part of the group “Montebello 4” together with Cristina Navarro H. (breeding of pigs). With the loan both women will purchase more animals and medication to avoid plagues and diseases.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela tiene 44 años , casada , tiene 8 hijos , su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil en la construccion . Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos los que posteriormente vende entre las personas de su comunidad y tambien en el mercado de la ciudad como vendedor ambulante. Forma parte del grupo Montebello 4 junto con Cristina Navarro H. (crianza de puercos). Con el prestamo ambas compraran mas animales y medicamentos para evitar plagas y enfermedades.

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 25 years old and has been separated from her husband for two years because of his abuse to her. She has two children and works by making little cakes filled with caramelized condensed milk which she sells as a traveling merchant. She belongs to the group “Montebello 4” together with Ms. Jacqueline Vasquez Arcos who sells shoes by catalog. With the loan, Margarita will purchase flour, eggs, corn starch, milk, and sugar while Jacqueline will expand her shoe business.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita tiene 25 años y hace dos años que se encuentra separada de su esposo por el maltrato que le daba . Se quedo con dos hijos, ella trabaja haciendo y vendiendo pastelitos rellenos con manjar y los vende de manera ambulante. Pertenece al grupo Montebello 4 junto con doña Jacqueline Vasquez Arcos (vende zapatos por catalogos). Con el prestamo Margarita comprara harina , huevos , leche, maizena, azucar y Jacqueline ampliara el negocio de los zapatos.

loans.use: Sales of cakes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
We have been in the grocery business for over 10 years. My husband and I work and this is our family income, since it is just the two of us. Thankfully, our children are adults. We don't want to be a burden to them, and that's why we are requesting a loan of $1200 to provide more merchandise and have more sales and more income.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Tenemos ya mas de 10 años en el negocio de los abarrotes en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo este es nuestro ingreso familiar ya que estamos solo los dos. Gracias a dios nuestro hijo ya son personas adultas. Y no queremos ser una lata para ellos, por eso estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para surtir más mercancía y así tener más ventas y más ingresos.

loans.use: Stock goods

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a single mother who sells cosmetics. She travels around the local community from the morning into the evening offering family, friends and acquaintances her products. This work provides the main source of income for her and her family. She has three daughters, two of whom go to school. When she goes out in the afternoon to sell, she must leave her younger kids in the care of her older daughter, which is worrisome for her. She has already borrowed from Mifex before. She uses the loans so she can buy her products wholesale for better prices. Her goal is to become a large-scale distributor of the cosmetics and open a store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase her goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sylvia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sylvia is an enthusiastic and very hard working woman. She is married and has two children. The low salary that her husband received did not cover the costs of living, and to obtain another income, Sylvia began her own business three years ago. She sells stationaries and school supplies. Due to living in a new town, she had the opportunity to start a successful business by satisfying the needs of her neighbors. In this manner, she has helped her husband meet the costs of living and supported her children's education.

In the stationary store, she receives help from her oldest son. Together they have been able to make the business grow and supply a greater variety of products. At this time, Sylvia needs a loan of $250 dollars that she will use to buy merchandise, so that she can offer better service to her clients and have a better variety in her shop. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Be a part of Sylvia's success. She and her family greatly appreciate the trust and support that you have invested in them. Your help is a huge blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Sylvia es una mujer entusiasta muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, el bajo salario que recibía su esposo no cubrían las necesidades de su hogar y para obtener un ingreso extra hace tres años Sylvia inició su propio negocio en el que vende papelería y artículos escolares, por ser una colonia nueva encontró la posibilidad de iniciar un negocio exitoso al satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos, de esta manera es como ella ha apoyado a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos.

En la papelería recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor, juntos han logrado hacer crecer el negocio y a surtir con una mayor variedad de productos, en estos momentos Sylvia necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener bien surtida su tienda, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte en los logros de Sylvia, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y el apoyo que has depositado en ellos, tu ayuda es de gran bendición.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and offer a greater variety of stationaries and school supplies

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Señora Maria de Jesús is a widow. Her children are already married and she lives alone.
