Due to her age, it has been very difficult for her to find a job, and to obtain the resources that she needs, one of her daughters suggested that she sell powdered milk. So she decided to begin her business two years ago. Now she receives help from one of her daughters and together they have succeeded in increasing the sales considerably. In the afternoons, Maria goes out to sell her products and give demonstrations, so that her clients will get to know her.

At this moment, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise to meet her clients' demands and increase her sales. She will repay this loan in three months. Help Maria improve her quality of life. She has confidence that people will help those who need it most. She appreciates the opportunity that your support provides for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria de Jesús es viuda, sus hijos ya están casados y vive sola, por su edad le ha sido muy difícil encontrar un empleo y para obtener los recursos que necesita una de sus hermanas le recomendó vender leche en polvo, y así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 2 años, ahora recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas y juntas han logrado incrementar las ventas considerablemente, por las tardes Maria sale a ofrecer sus productos y hace demostraciones para que sus clientes los conozcan.

En estos momentos Maria solicita un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a Maria a mejorar su calidad de vida, ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, y te agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to meet her clients' needs

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
In the town of Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, Mexico, lives Maria Martha. She is married and has two children. Ten years ago, her husband was left unemployed. To earn an income that would meet the basic needs of her family, Maria began her own business in food sales. Unfortunately, she suffered an accident that prevented her from working consistent hours. Her family has been very important in keeping this business alive, because her two sons and her husband have helped out, so that together they were able to keep the business going.

In order to give a new boost to their business and increase the sales, Maria is now requesting a loan of $925 dollars that she will use to purchase ingredients for the preparation of her products. She promises to repay this loan in six months. Your help is very valuable to this family, because this business represents their only source of income. Maria's children are studying and hope to finish their education. Thanks to you, they will achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, vive Maria Martha, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, hace 10 años su esposo quedó desempleado y para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia Maria inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, lamentablemente ella sufrió un accidente que no le permitió trabajar con constancia, pero la unión familiar ha sido muy importante para la permanencia de este negocio, porque ha recibido la ayuda de sus dos hijos y de su esposo y juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante.

Para poder darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda es de gran utilidad para esta familia, ya que este negocio representa su única fuente de ingresos, los hijos de Maria están estudiando y desean poder culminar sus estudios, gracias a ti lo lograran.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of the food.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is the oldest of her siblings and ever since she was very little, she worked with her father where she sold cakes and pastries. Her father passed away while she was young, and to obtain the necessary resources to care for her siblings and mother, she continued with the business on her own. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, she succeeded in improving her family's lives, which fills her with lots of pride. Now Maricela is married and has a little six-year old boy. He has become her biggest reason to continue working hard.

Now Maricela is requesting a loan of $475 dollars that she will use to purchase ingredients that are needed to improve and increase her products. She hopes to be able to meet the demand from clients and give her business a boost. She promises to pay back this loan in six months. The assistance is needed today, and Maricela greatly appreciates the opportunity to continue with her business and make it grow. Become a part of her success. Support Maricela!

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Maricela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es la mayor de sus hermanos y desde muy pequeña trabajó en el puesto que tenia su padre donde vendía tortas, su padre falleció siendo ella joven y para obtener los recursos necesarios para la manutención sus hermanos y madre continuó con el negocio ella sola, gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo logró sacar adelante a su familia lo que la llena de orgullo, ahora Maricela está casada y tiene un pequeño de 6 años de edad, él se ha convertido en su motivo más grande para continuar trabajando.

Ahora Maricela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio, ella se compromete retornar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Maricela agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, forma parte de su logros ¡Apóyala!

loans.use: To buy the necessary resources to grow her pastry business.

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es:
Juan Filiberto is from Pedro Escobedo in the state of Queretaro. He is the oldest out of 3 brothers. His father, who was always irresponsible, abandoned his family when Juan was very young and his brothers were very small. In order to provide for his mother and two younger brothers, Juan started his own business by selling seasonal fruit. With the motivation to improve his family's living conditions, he worked very hard and everyday he would go to the nearby communities to sell his products. Currently, Juan is married and has children of his own. He wants to provide for his children like a good father should, and he struggles each day to make sure his family is well-taken care of. His sales have increase due to his extensive experience.

In order to satisfy his customer demand and to cover a wider selling range, Juan is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he will use to purchase more fruit. He will repay this amount within 6 months. Help Juan with his growing business. Juan and his family greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Filiberto es originario de Pedro Ecobedo en el estado de Querétaro, él es el mayor de tres hermanos, su padre siempre fue irresponsable y abandonó a su familia, Juan era muy joven y sus hermanos pequeños, para poder sacar adelante a su madre y hermanos inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas de temporada, el deseo de mejorar las condiciones en las que vivía su familia lo impulsaban a trabajar arduamente, todos los días salía a las comunidades cercanas a ofrecer sus productos. Ahora Juan tiene su esposa e hijos y quiere poder darles lo mejor como padre, por lo que se esfuerza mucho hoy en día, la amplia experiencia que tiene en su negocio le ha ayudado mucho a incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar su zona de ventas, Juan solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Juan a dar el siguiente paso en su negocio, él y su familia agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal fruit

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is 40 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children who are 6, 8 & 10 years old. Unfortunately, one of her children is in poor health. In order to pay for the medical expenses, Maria decided to start her own business 3 years ago by selling soft drinks and candy products out of her home. Her husband's salary is not enough to cover all their expenses. This way she helps with the bills while she stays at home to take care of her children.

At this time, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which she will use to purchase more inventory so that she can offer a variety of different products to her clients, and to hopefully expand her business. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Become a part of the success of this business. Maria and her family greatly appreciate the support you can give them. Your help is a blessing to this family!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, de 6, 8 y 10 años de edad. Lamentablemente uno de sus hijos está delicado de salud y para poder cubrir los gastos médicos hace tres años inició su negocio con la venta de frituras, dulces y refrescos en su propio domicilio, ya que el salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo e insuficiente para todos las deudas, de esta manera es como Maria puede ayudar en la economía familiar sin descuidar a sus hijos y su hogar.

En estos momentos, Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece y hacer crecer su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte en logros de Maria, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que puedas brindarles, tu ayuda es de gran bendición para esta familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Iram

texts.es:
Iram is married, and he has 6 girls ranging from 5 to 19 years of age. Iram lost his job about 5 years ago, and it became very difficult for him to find another job. This brought a lot of financial difficulties to his family so he decided to start his own business. He put up a food stand in his carport where he sells hamburgers and hot dogs. Since he started his business, he has learned that he really enjoys selling, and his entrepreneurial spirit have helped him in making his business a success.

His daughters help him as well when they have free time. With the help of his family, he has been able to move ahead. At this time, Iram is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he wil use to buy cooking ingredients. He hopes to increase his food production to satisfy customer demand. He commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Iram improve his business and his family's living conditions. They greatly appreciate your support and trust!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Iram es casado y tiene seis hijas de entre 5 y 19 años de edad. Hace cinco años Iram quedó desempleado y le fue muy difícil conseguir otro trabajo, esto dio inicio a muchos problemas económicos en la familia por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio, en la cochera de su casa instaló un puesto para vender hamburguesas y hot dogs, una vez que inició su negocio descubrió su gusto por las ventas y su espíritu emprendedor que le han sido de gran ayuda para el desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio.

En sus ratos libres, sus hijas colaboran con él en su negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante, ahora Iram está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, con lo que espera incrementar su producción para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en este negocio y en la vida de Iram y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente el apoyo y confianza que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe started selling hamburgers about 3 years ago. She is married and has 2 small children. Maria is a resourceful and goal-oriented woman. She wants to set a good example for her children, and this is why she started her own business. By taking advantage of the area where she lives, she has set up a food stand in a major avenue(intersection) which has helped her increase her sales tremendously. She has also invested most of her profits back into her business. She has worked very hard all these years to make sure her children have a better life.

In order for her business to continue to grow, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which she will use to purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements to her food stand so that she can better serve her clients. She has agreed to repay this amount within 6 months. Help Maria with her growing business. She and her family appreciate your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace tres años Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, Maria es una mujer emprendedora y activa quiere ser un ejemplo para sus hijos por lo que inició su propio negocio, aprovechando la ubicación de su hogar instaló su puesto en una avenida principal de su localidad, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas rápidamente y crecer con su negocio, además de que ha reinvertido la mayor parte de sus utilidades en el negocio, el ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida la ha impulsado a trabajar arduamente durante todo este tiempo.

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que le permitan incrementar su producción además de realizar algunas modificaciones en su local con lo que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia is married, and she has 3 children. Her husband is retired and his pension is not enough to cover the family expenses. In need of extra income, Aurelia started her own business two years ago by selling ready-to-eat food out of her home. Due to her delicious cooking, she has been very successful and her business is booming. In order to expand her business, she now delivers to her clients which has turned out to be a good decision.

In order to satisfy customer demand, at this time she is requesting a loan in the amount of $275 USD which she will use to purchase cooking ingredients. She has agreed to repay this amount within 4 months. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Aurelia improve her business and her family's living conditions. They thank you for your trust and assistance!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es jubilado y la pensión que recibe es insuficiente para todos los gastos de su hogar, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Aurelia inició su propio negocio hace dos años con la venta de comidas, acondicionó un lugar en su casa para poder elaborar sus productos y gracias a sus conocimientos culinarios y buen sazón ha tenido éxito en su negocio incrementando sus ventas, para continuar creciendo ahora también ha ofrecido a sus clientes el servicio a domicilio, estrategia que le ha funcionado muy bien.

En estos momentos, para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Aurelia solicita un préstamo de $275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. En tus manos esta en bienestar de esta familia, se parte de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Aurelia, muchas gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is married and has 2 children, 8 & 12 years old. Her husband, Pablo, is a welder but his salary is not enough to cover the family's monthly expenses. Adela used to work at a maquiladora, but they laid her off. She used up her savings to start her own business two years ago. She sells stationery and rents computers for internet use.

In order to boost her sales and to provide better customer service, Adela is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD. She will use this loan to purchase computer accessories and stationery. She has agreed to repay this amount within 3 months. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Adela improve her business and her family's living conditions. They greatly appreciate your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Adela es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 8 y 12 años de edad, su esposo Pablo se desempeña como soldador pero con el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, anteriormente Adela trabajaba en una maquiladora pero por recorte de personal fue liquidada, con los ahorro que tenía decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años, en donde vende papelería y renta computadoras para el uso de Internet.

Para darle un impulso a su negocio y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, Adela solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de accesorios para las computadoras y papelería, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Adela a mejorar la vida de su familia, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & computer accessories

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela is 70 years old, she is a widow, and has two children. She works in the confection and embroidery of handmade blouses, tablecloths, and shawls. She also has a small grocery store at home. She belongs to the group “Cempasuchil 2”. With the loan she hopes to purchase plenty of fabric and thread for her crafts as well as purchase merchandise to supply her grocery store with a larger variety of products.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Micaela tiene 70 años ,es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la confeccion y bordado de blusas artesanales, manteles y chales. Ademas tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo “Cempasuchil 2”. Con el prestamo espera comprar mucha tela e hilo para sus artesanias y ademas comprara mercaderia para surtir un poco mas su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and fabric for handmade blouses, tablecloths, and shawls.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 48-year-old married mother of 10. Her husband harvests corn, while she dedicates herself to making decorative blouses for women in her neighborhood and for visiting tourists. With the loan, she hopes to purchase silk thread wholesale and cloth in larger quantities so she can increase her production and, in turn, her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA TIENE 48 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENE 10 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA BORDANDO BLUSAS PARA MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TURISTAS QUE VISITAN SU LOCALIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2 . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR HILO DE SEDA AL POR MAYOR Y EN GRANDES CANTIDADES TELA PARA DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE ARTESANIAS Y POR LO TANTO SUS INGRESOS .

loans.use: Purchase thread and cloth in larger quantities

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 33 years old and marries. She makes decorative blouses, pants and skirts that she later embroiders and sells in the city market. With the loan, she hopes to purchase more cloth, a sewing machine to make her garments, and also thread for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARGARITA , TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA, TRABAJA COMO ARTESANA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS, PANTALONES Y FALDAS LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE BORDA Y VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2.CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA , UNA MEJOR MAQUINA DE COSER PARA HACER SUS PPRENDAS Y TAMBIEN HILOS PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth, a sewing machine to make her decorative garments, and also thread for her embroideries

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a 32-year-old married mother of two. Her husband works in the fields, while she makes decorative embroidered blouses that are popular in her region. She sells them to women in her neighborhood and also to vendors who later sell them to tourists. With the loan, she hopes to invest in looms, special cloths and thread for embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MANUELA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA, 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO. ELLA TRABAJA EN ARTESANIAS BORDA BLUSAS TIPICAS DE LA REGION Y LA VENDE A LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TAMBIEN EN LA CIUDAD CON PERSONAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE COMERCIALIZAN SUS PRODUCTOS EN OTRAS CIUDADES TURISTICAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN TELARES, MANTA E HILO DE BORDAR.

loans.use: Purchase looms, cloth and thread

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 33-year-old married mother of four. Her husband works in the fields, while she makes decorative embroidered blouses, which she later sells to women in her neighborhood or visiting tourists who like her work. With the loan, she hopes to purchase cloth and thread to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA, 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA BORDANDO BLUSAS ,LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD O A TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA Y QUE GUSTAN MUCHO DE SUS BORDADOS . .PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA E HILO PARA SUS PRENDAS.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a 28-year-old married mother of three. Her husband works in the country harvesting corn, while she makes decorative embroidered cushions, wraps and tablecloths that she later sells in popular areas for tourists, who buy a lot of embroideries. With the loan, she hopes to invest in cloth and thread to increase her production and, in turn, her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

LUISA TIENE 28 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN EL CULTIVO DEL MAIZ. ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR COJINES,CHALES , MANTELES QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE EN LOS LUGARES DONDE HAY MAS TURISTAS QUIENES COMPRAN MUCHO SUS BORDADOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 1, CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN TELA DE MANTA E HILOS PARA TENER LA POSIBILIDAD DE AUMENTAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread

loans.name: Maria Dulce

texts.es:
Maria Dulce is a 20-year-old married mother of three. Her husband works in the fields, while she makes decorative blouses and skirts that she later sells to women in her neighborhood. She also runs a small convenience store out of her home. With her loan, she hopes to purchase thread for embroideries and also supplies and non-perishable foods to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA DULCE , TIENE 20 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA ES ARTESANA CONFECCIONA BLUSAS Y FALDAS LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD, TAMBIEN TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 1.CON SU PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS HILOS PARA BORDAR Y TAMBIEN MERCADERIA Y ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA SU SURTIR A SU PEQUEÑO LOCAL.

loans.use: Purchase thread and non-perishable foods

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a 53-year-old married mother of eight. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn, while she makes blouses and pants on orders from people near her neighborhood. With the loan, she plans to improve her workplace, purchase fabric and thread, and a better sewing machine that will help produce more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MANUELA TIENE 53 AÑOS , CASADA, 8 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN EL CULTIVO DEL MAIZ,ELLA TRABAJA COMO MODISTA HACIENDO BLUSAS, PANTALONES A PEDIDO DE LAS PERSONAS QUE VIVEN CERCA DE SU SECTOR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 1 . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA MEJORAR EL LUGAR DONDE HACE SUS TRABAJOS, COMPRAR TELA E HILOS Y UNA MEJOR MAQUINA QUE LE AYUDE A HACER MAYOR CANTIDAD DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR.

loans.use: Improve her workplace, purchase fabric and thread, and a better sewing machine that will help produce more garments

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a 23-year-old mother of two and separated from her husband after he mistreated her. She makes embroidered blouses, wraps, tablecloths and shirts that she sells to tourists who visit her neighborhood. With the loan she hopes to increase her production by purchasing more cloth and thread for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

VICTORIA TIENE 23 AÑOS , SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO POR EL MALTRATO QUE RECIBIO MIENTRAS DURÓ SU MATRIMONIO, TIENE 2 HIJOS, SE DEDICA A BORDAR BLUSAS, CHALES, MANTELES, CAMISAS LAS CUALES VENDE ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 1. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA AGRANDAR LA PRODUCCION DE SUS ARTESANIAS COMPRANDO MAS TELAS E HILOS PARA BORDAR

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en:
Micaela is 28 years old, married, with four children. Her husband works as a farmer. She embroiders traditional skirts that are used by the women in her community. Her best customers are indigenous women from her neighborhood. She belongs to the group "Liquidambar 13". With the a loan, she wants to buy more fabric to increase the production of skirts in order to start selling them to tourists that visit the city close to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MICAELA TIENE 28 AÑOS, CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR FALDAS TIPICAS USADAS POR LAS MUJERES DE LAS COMUNIDADES, ES POR ESO QUE SUS MEJORES CLIENTES SON LAS INDIGENAS DE SU CENTRO.PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE FALDAS PARA BAJAR A VENDER A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 22 years old and single. She makes blouses and subsequently embroiders them, that she sells in nearby communities and to tourists that visit her city. She belongs to the group "Liquidambar 13". She wants to invest the loan in materials needed to make her blouses and in thread for embroidering. This way, she can produce higher quantities and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CRISTINA TIENE 22 AÑOS, SOLTERA, ELLA TRABAJA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS LAS QUE LUEGO BORDA Y VENDE EN LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS Y A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13. ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN MATERIAL PARA CONFECCIONAR SUS BLUSAS Y EN HILOS DE BORDAR PARA PRODUCIR EN MAYOR CANTIDAD Y OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS .

loans.use: To buy supplies for making clothes

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 20 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. She handcrafts traditional skirt called "Naguas". These are used by the women in her community. With the loan, she will buy thread and it will allow her to go out and sell her merchandise near the crafts market of the city of San Cristobal. She belongs to the group "Liquidambar 13".

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CLAUDIA TIENE 20 AÑOS, CASADA, 3 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO, ELLA TRABAJA ARTESANALMENTE CONFECCIONANDO FALDAS TIPICAS DE LA ZONA LLAMADAS “NAGUAS “ QUE UTILIZAN LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD.CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y GENERO PARA PRODUCIR MAYOR CANTIDAD DE FALDAS Y PODER SALIR A VENDER TAMBIEN EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL.PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13.

loans.use: Sales of handcrafted clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old, married with 10 children. Her works as a farm hand in the harvest of corn. She embroiders skirts and blouses, clothing that is generally used by the women of nearby communities. She wants to use the loan to buy cloth and thread for embroidering so she can make formal clothing and increase her income. She is part of the group "Liquidambar 13".

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA TIENE 49 AÑOS , CASADA , 10 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR FALDAS , BLUSAS Y FALDAS , ROPA QUE GENERALMENTE UTILIZAN LAS MUJERES DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS. QUIERE CON EL PRESTAMO PODER COMPRAR TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR ELLA LAS PRENDAS DE VESTIR Y TAMBIEN MAS HILO DE BORDAR Y DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS..PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is 32 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She makes additional clothing and embroiders them. In addition, she makes embroidered pillows which she then sells to a person who resells them in the largest tourist towns of the region.

With the loan, she wants to buy more thread and cloth and, additionally, she wants to start a business from her home selling fruits and vegetables. She belongs to the group "Espina 5".

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA 5 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO. ELLA HACE ROPA TIPICA DE LA ZONA Y LAS BORDA , ADEMAS HACE COJINES BORDADOS Y POSTERIORMENTE SE LAS ENTREGA A UNA PERSONA QUE SE LAS COMPRA Y LAS REVENDE EN LAS CIUDADES DE MAYOR TURISMO DE LA ZONA. ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS HILO Y TELA Y ADEMAS PONER UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA PARA VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ESPINA 5.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 22 years old, single, and works making textiles like shawls, pillows, and blouses. Afterwards, she embroiders them and sells them in the handicrafts market in the city of San Cristobal. With her income she helps with household expenses of her parents. She belongs to the group "Espina 5". She will invest a loan in the purchase of the rolls of thread, which is cheaper. This way she will be able to increase the profit on her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA TIENE 22 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y TRABAJA CONFECCIONANDO ARTESANIAS TALES COMO CHALES, COJINES, BLUSAS Y LUEGO LAS BORDA PARA VENDERLAS EN EL MERCADO DE ARTESANIAS UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL. CON SUS INGRESOS AYUDA AL MANTENIMIENTO DEL HOGAR DE SUS PADRES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ESPINA 5. CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE HILOS POR ROLLOS QUE SON MAS ECONOMICOS Y ASI OBTENER MAS GANACIAS CON SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: To buy thread

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. She makes napkins and table cloths, which she subsequently embroiders and sells in the city of San Cristobal, at two hours traveling from her home. She belongs to the group "Espina 5". With the loan, she wants to buy thread and cloth to increase her production and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

ANTONIA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE SERVILLETAS, MANTELES Y LUEGO LOS BORDA PARA VENDERLOS EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL A DOS HORAS DE SU CASA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO ESPINA 5. ESPERA CON SU PRESTAMO COMPRAR HILOS , TELA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y GANAR MAS.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand pastry business to a small location

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This money will be invested in the maintenance and repair of his location and in the purchase of tools and materials which will help him in his daily work.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Mr. Gonzales is married and the father of 2 school-age girls. He learned the trade of shoemaking from his grandfather. Presently he is requesting this loan to buy leather and rubber, which he will use to repair and make shoes. He will also invest part of the loan to buy other basic materials for his operations, such as thread, industrial needles, shoemaker's glue, etc. With this loan he hopes to fill the orders of his clients and increase his income to give his family a better quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. G. es casado y padre de 2 niñas en edad escolar, el oficio de zapatero lo aprendió de su abuelo, en la actualidad solicita el crédito para comprar cuero y hule, los cuales utilizará para reparar y hacer zapatos. Además invertirá otra parte para comprar otros materiles básicos para realizar sus operaciones como hilo, agujas industriales, pega de zapatero, etc. Con el crédito espera cubrir con los encargos de sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: This loan will be invested in the purchase of leather and rubber for shoe repair.

payments.comment: During our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Gonzales was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance owed and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Mr. Apolinar is the owner of a fruit stand. He is married and the father of 3 school-age children. He and his wife have been selling fruits and vegetables for over 5 years, and he is requesting this loan to construct a wall to provide better security for his location, and also to make some minor repairs to the roof, since on rainy days he has lost some of his merchandise due to leaks. He told us that this loan will help him offer a better quality of life to his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. apolinar es dueño de un local de venta de frutas, es casado y padre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, junto a su esposa vende frutas y verduras desde hace más de cinco años y está solicitando el crédito para construir un muro y darle mayor seguridad a su local, además para hacerle unas reparaciones menores al techo ya que en los días de lluvia se la ha hechado a perder parte de su mercadería debido a las goteras. Nos comentó también que parte del dinero lo invertirá en el pago a sus proveedores. Espera que el crédito le ayude a brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus familiares.

loans.use: The loan will be used to enclose and make other repairs to his location, and to pay his suppliers.

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Castro was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Mr. S. is a married man and the father of 4 children, two of whom are attending the university. He has over 15 years of experience in radiator repair. He is requesting this loan to invest in the maintenance and repair of his location, with the objective of making it look better to attract more customers. He also told us he will invest part of it in tools and materials which will help with his daily work (pipe, aluminum, glue, etc.)

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. S. es un hombre casado y padre de 4 hijos, dos de los cuales está asistiendo a la universidad, tiene más de quince años de experiencia en la reparación de radiadores y está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento y reparación de su local, con el objetivo de darle un amejor presentación y atraer más clientes. Nos comentó también que invertirá una parte en herraminetas y materiales que le faciliten sus labores diarias (soplete, aluminio, pega, etc.)

loans.use: This loan will be invested in the repair and maintenance of his location, and in the purchase of tools and materials which will help him in his daily work.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Selva was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance of the loan, and hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
It has been over 8 years since Mr. Eddy opened the doors of his vegetable stand. He is married and the father of one school-age boy. He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables and fruits to supply his business, and to pay his suppliers, who have offered discounts for prompt payment. He hopes this loan will help him make his business grow and give a better quality of life to his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. Eddy tiene más de 8 años de haber abierto las puertas de su local de venta de verduras, es casado y padre de un niño en edad escolar, está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras y otras frutas para abastecer su negocio y para pagar a sus proveedores quienes le han ofrecido descuentos por pronto pago. Espera que el crédito lo ayude a hacer crecer su negocio y a darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus familiares.

loans.use: This loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fruits to supply his business, and also to pay his suppliers.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Martinez was the actual recipient of the loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance of the loan and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Sujeidi

texts.es:
Mrs. Gonzales is married and the mother of one boy just two years old. She is the owner of a vegetable stand, and she is requesting this loan to stock it with new products so she can attract more customers and increase her income. She hopes this loan will help her make her business and her income grow.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La Sra. G. es casada y madre de un niño de apenas dos años de edad, es dueña de un kiosko de verduras y está solicitando el crédito para abastecerlo con nuevos productos para así atraer más clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. Espera que el crédito la ayude a hacer crecer su negocio y sus ingresos.

loans.use: This loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fruits to stock her stand.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Sujeidi Gonzalez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mr. Hun H. is 27 years old, and lives in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is talented and has experienced several years in electrical supplies, so he now operates an electrical store in his area, where he can typically makes around 5 USD a day in revenue. Currently, Hun H. has managed to increase the number of his clients, but he is not able to meet the high demand, which is why he needs the loan to help him provide for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical supplies for his invetory.

payments.comment: Congratulations! Hun Hoeun paid back his loan early!

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Mr. Chun C. is 41 years old, and lives with his wife (pictured here because C. was unavailable), and his mother in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He and his wife together, have experienced for ages in making baskets, and reselling them to retailers in the area. They have three children, all of who are enrolled school. Currently this couple needs more tools and bamboos to increase the number of their baskets due to a great demand of their clients.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and bamboos to operate a business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chun Cheata start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband (pictured here because Soa T. was unavailable), and their 7 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a recycler and typically makes about 3 USD per day in income, while her husband is a welder, and can makes up to 10 USD each day, which is a big help for their family’s savings. Currently, her husband needs more tools, and a loan would allow him to service a larger number of clients and customers.

loans.use: To purchase welding tools for her husband to facilitate his business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Soa Thy has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin S. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her children and cook meals for the entire family. Meanwhile, her husband is the one who responsible for the family’s expenses by working at a private company as a driver, which allows him to contribute about 5 USD each day. In addition, one of her children is a mechanic, which also is a help to the family’s savings.

Currently, Chin S. is requesting for a loan amount of 700 USD to purchase more mechanical tools for her son to fulfill his clients’ needs. He expects to earn more this year.

loans.use: To purchase more machanical tools for her son to operate business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov K. T. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, all of who are students, in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works at a private company and makes around 2 USD a day. Meanwhile, her husband is a Tuk Tuk driver and earns a moderate 5 USD each day.

Mrs. Nov K. T. hopes the loan will help to purchase a Tuk Tuk (a passenger cart attached with a motor-bike) for her husband to generate more income, which is potential for the family.

loans.use: To purhcase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to operate a business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand bead and clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her bead and clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her bead and clothing sales business

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan H. is a 41 year old widow, and lives with her one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement the family’s expenses, she has two sources of income. First, she and her son grow a variety of crops on her farm and sell them to the retailers at a market. Second, she purchases seeds such as beans and sesame from the wholesalers and then resells them to people in her local area.

With the business activity, she typically makes around 5 USD per day in revenue. Recently, Yan H. would like to meet her expanded clients’ base, and needs a loan to purchase sesame seeds and beans to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more sesame seeds and bean to satisfy her clients.

payments.comment: Mrs. Yan Hun has successfully expanded her seed business and has been able to repay her loan early!

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In S. M. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, together, make their living by purchasing rubber from someone’s plantation and they then reselling it to the retailers.

This business brings them around $5 in revenue each day. Recently, this couple has an idea to grow rubber trees themselves, so that they no longer depend on the grove owners. To do this, In S. M. needs a loan to purchase more rubber trees to grow on her own plantation.

loans.use: To purchase some rubber trees to grow on her plantation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her food kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros S. N. is 30 years old, and the mother of 1 child. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is self-employed as a garment worker and makes around $1.5 each day, while her husband is both a motor-taxi driver and a farmer, and usually makes around $5/day in revenue. In order to maximize her rice crops and the  variety of vegetables, this couple currently needs a plot of land, allowing them to strengthen cultivation and increase profit.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow rice crop and a variety of vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her milk sales business

loans.name: Lux

texts.en: Mrs. Lux T. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband are talented and have almost 10 years of experience in producing Khmer fresh noodle fiber, which is extremely popular food for Cambodian citizens. From this business activity, this couple can typically make up to $20/day in revenue. Recently, Lux T. determined that she needs a motorcycle to transport her products to the wholesalers at the market. She is grateful and appreciative of the loan from Credit MFI and Kiva.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to transport her products to the wholesalers at a market.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Lux Thavy has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun M. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Srun M. makes her living by selling vegetables at a busy market where she generates on average about $2.5 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and can make approximately $2/day. Srun M. is currently asking for the loan amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business. With the help of a loan, her family can find more sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business.

payments.comment: Srun Maly has paid back her loan early! Thank you for helping her to increase her income and improve life for her family.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement the family's income, Yorn S. raises pigs and some domestic animals on her small piece of land, while her husband is self-employed as a taxi driver and can make up to $7 each day. Recently, Yorn S. has managed to increase the number of her pigs, which will enable her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To add more pigs to her group of livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand the stock of his general merchandise shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business to include clothing sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her cafe business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Convert his vegetable stand into a grocery shop/stall

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro I. S. lives in Canutillo with his wife Mariledas. Pedro owns the Peluquería Pepe, a barber shop that he built with a previous loan from Esperanza. With this loan, Pedro will renovate and better equip his shop, improving its structure and interior and purchasing tools and materials. Pedro and Mariledas's four children: Rosangelica (11), Pedro Juan (8), Pedro Miguel (7), and Vladimir (6) attend school locally. Like most Dominican boys his age, Pedro Juan dreams of playing baseball professionally. Rosangelica has a dream of her own: she aspires to be an architect.

Note: Pedro is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1000 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Pedro pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Renovate and equip shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C. H. owns a sandwich store in Ulloa, where she also sells commodities ranging from salt to straws. She will use her loan to buy stock for her store, which offers necessities like bread, matches, and eggs as well as little luxuries like candy and chips. Two of Cecilia's ten children still live with her: Elsa (25) and Louis (14) help their mother with the store when not studying. Elsa is studying to become a teacher.

Note: Cecilia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1125 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Cecilia pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Stock and expansion

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe N. H. bottles gasoline and oil at his open-air shop in Ulloa. A mechanic by trade, he will use his loan to expand his wares to include headlights, cables, and spark plugs, odds and ends essential to the art of motorcycle maintenance. Felipe lives with his wife Juli and their five children: Ulysseys (10), Elisa (7), Juli (3), Caterin (2), and Cali (1). Felipe has a bashful smile and says his family is too humble for big dreams. But, he says, he's been impressed by what Esperanza's program has done for entrepreneurs in the community. With a new loan from Esperanza, Felipe says he can grow his own small business to better provide for his family.

Note: Felipe is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Felipe pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion by purchasing headlights, cables and spark plugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional cows to expand cattle sale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 5 cows to be resold when they are fattened

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina C. owns a colorful shop in Quisqueya where she sells such commodities as colored candles, bread, chips, sweets, cherries, gum, spices, matches, and chocolate cake by the slice. Delfina's husband ran his own business selling lottery tickets, but after he died, Delfina was left without a source of income. A friend told her about microfinance, and Delfina opened her shop with her first loan from Esperanza. With this loan, Delfina will grow her business, stocking her store and buying a freezer. She has no children, but lives with her younger sister Ana and brother Rafael. Delfina's niece Francia (27) and her two daughters Angela Maria (11) and Carla (6) live with Delfina as well.

Note: Delfina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1200 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Stock up on household items and food; invest in a freezer

loans.name: Ciprian

texts.en:
Ciprian R. C. owns the Cafeteria Puro Robles, a sandwich store in Quisqueya where he sells food products like chips, bread, and natural juice drinks, as well as essentials like cups, napkins, ice, and lamp oil for when the power goes out during the night. He will use this loan to stock his store and pay for his freezer. Ciprian says that since he's opened his store, life has improved for him and his wife, Milagros Montilla, and their two children Yendri (8) and Yender (7). With another loan, he can grow his store into a successful small business.

Note: Ciprian is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1200 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Cipirian pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Stock store and pay for a freezer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth Pena M. and her husband Jose Pimentel sell everything from mops to fresh fruit in their store in Quisqueya. It is well stocked with toilet paper, napkins, bread, vegetable oil, brooms, and canned foods. They have three children: Genia (20), Jose Manuel (18), and Jose Antonio (14). With this loan, Ruth wants to expand their business to sell shoes and bedsheets. She hopes such an expansion will increase their business and allow her and her husband to ease their children's transitions into adulthood.

Note: Ruth is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Ruth pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion; purchase shoes & bedsheets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa G. O. owns the Cafeteria Leisy, a brightly-painted sandwich shop in Quisqueya. She does a lunchtime business in sandwiches, bananas, potatoes, and other fresh fruits and vegetables. With this loan, she will buy a blender to make fruit juice and also expand her business to sell cooking gas and charcoal. Rosa says that her business has taught her an important lesson: anyone can be successful, so long as they use their head. Rosa's entrepreneurship helps her and her husband Ramon support their four children: Beatriz (12), Beolen (10), Raibol (5), and Marileiza (2).

Note: Rosa is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1200 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Rosa pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Purchase a blender, fruit, cooking gas & charcoal

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Señora Mariette dedicates her self to selling food at night. She has an employee who works for her during the day. Her work site and her home are next to each other in the town of San Antonio within the city of La Paz. Mariette has three children. Two of them are in school, and the other child is just three years old. This is the fourth time that Mariette has requested a loan with IMPRO. Her history with our organization qualifies her as a top client. The amount requested will be used to purchase rice, vermicelli, vegetables, and furniture so that she can make her business more stable and open up a pension (a pension is the name of an agreement where the client pays monthly for their daily lunches). Her prior credit and work should allow her to attain this loan, because she has experience in her business, which will now be managed even more securely, and the increased income will allow her to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mariette se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches; tiene una empleada a quien le cancela por día trabajado. Su puesto y domicilio se encuentran ubicados en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. Martiette tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y uno es de tres años. Es la Cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de arroz, fideo, verduras, y muebles para poder continuar con su negocio en forma mas estable y abrir una pensión (pensión es el nombre que se da a lugares de comida donde la gente – los clientes – tienen un almuerzo diario seguro por un monto pagado mensualmente). Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual será manejado más establemente y le dará más ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy rice, pasta, vegetables, and furniture for her business

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Justo began his general store with savings from a harvest and with some of his son's savings. The store is well located and there is not a lot of competition where he lives. Despite not having been in business for long, his clientele has increased with time.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan to buy more merchandise because he needs to expand his field of work and increase his client base. Furthermore, he is convinced that his with more merchandise, he will see an increase in his income and have a prosperous business.

Personal Information

Mr. Justo is 55 years old and his children work because they are all grown now. His business is for his later years and those of his wife because he can no longer do physical labor. His house is made of cement and he also has the support of his wife who also helps sell products from home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Justo empezó su negocio de venta de víveres con un ahorro de una cosecha que y con unos ahorros de su hijo. La tienda tiene buena ubicación y no hay mucha competencia por donde el vive y a pesar de que no tiene mucho tiempo de haberla comenzado su clientela ha mejorado con el tiempo

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería pues necesita ampliar su campo de trabajo e incrementar su cartera de clientes. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero.

Información Personal

Justo tiene 55 años de edad y sus hijos trabajan pues todos son mayores el negocio de Justo servirá para la vejez de el y se su esposa pues el ya no puede hacer trabajos forzados su casa es de cemento y cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda en casa vendiendo también los productos.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es:
Business Description

Noris began her business 2 years ago with money that she earned from sales in a previous job. She provides personal attention to her clients from her home and among friends. She sells a variety of clothes, cosmetics, and jewelry. Noris maintains her business by providing a variety of high quality products to clients.

Use of the Loan

Noris needs this loan to invest in diversifying her products, such as clothing for children, women and men, and to buy a display case to better showcase her necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and rings. In this way, she can better serve her clients.

Personal Information

Noris is 32 years old and has 5 children, 4 of whom are in school. Her husband works as a construction laborer, but his earnings are not enough to sustain the household. For this reason, Noris began her business. She lives in a home made of wood and cane with a dirt floor. She hopes to grow and improve her business and the quality of life for her family.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Noris inicio su negocio hace 2 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener en base a las ventas de su anterior trabajo. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal en su domicilio y amistades. Su negocio es ofrecer Ropa variada, bisutería y cosméticos. Noris se mantiene con su negocio gracias a la buena calidad y variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Uso del Préstamo

Noris necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos y variados productos como ropa para niños, damas, caballeros y una vitrina para poder exhibir de mejor manera sus collares, aretes, pulseras, aros. Mejorando de esta manera el servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Noris tiene 32 años tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción lo poco que gana no alcanza para el sostenimiento del hogar. Motivo que fue el impulso para que Noris iniciara su negocio. Su vivienda es de madera y caña con el piso de tierra .Sus aspiraciones es crecer y mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: purchase more varied clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new cart

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works as a mechanic in an automotive repair shop. She breeds animals like pigs, rabbits, and chickens, which she subsequently sells to people in her community. She is part of the group "Metze 1". With the loan, she wants to buy more animals, food, and medicines to prevent illnesses between the animals.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

FILOMENA, TIENE 41 AÑOS , CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO MECANICO EN UN TALLER AUTOMOTRIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES COMO : PUERCOS , CONEJOS Y POLLOS LOS QUE DESPUES VENDE ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LLAMADO MEZTE 1. QUIERE CON SU PRESTAMO COMPRAR UNA MAYOR CANTIDAD DE ANIMALES ,ALIMENTOS Y MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR ENFERMEDADES ENTRE ELLOS .

loans.use: breeding and selling of animals.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. She breeds chickens to sell in her neighborhood. She plans to invest the loan to buy more animals, medicins, and also to help her husband buy wood to craft furniture. This way, she wants to get ahead as a family, selling to people close to home. She makes part of the group "Metze 1", together with Mrs. Margarita Adalberta Gomez (who breeds and sells rabbits); the latter wants to start a small grocery store from her home with her part of the loan.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA EUGENIA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO. ELLA TRABAJA EN LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS PARA LA VENTA EN SU COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS ANIMALES , MEDICAMENTOS Y TAMBIEN APOYAR A SU ESPOSO COMPRANDO MADERA PARA LA CONFECCION DE MUEBLES ARTESANALES Y DE ESTA FORMA SURGIR COMO FAMILIA AL VENDERLOS A LAS PERSONAS QUE VIVEN CERCA DE SU CASA..FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MEZTE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARGARITA ADALBERTA GOMEZ ( CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CONEJOS ) ELLA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA COLOCAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: breeding and selling chicken

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farm hand harvesting corn. She has a grocery store in her home and she wants to invest her part of the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, like rice, tea, sugar, salt, pasta, etc. She is part of the group "Metze 1", together with Mrs. Gloria Petra V. Estrada, who buy corn wholesale and sells it retail to people in her community. She wants to invest her part of the loan to be able to buy more corn.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA CECILIA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA , 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ . ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA PODER INVERTIRLO EN COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO ( ARROZ, TE , AZUCAR, SAL , PASTAS , ETC ) . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MEZTE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA GLORIA PETRA V. ESTRADA QUE SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE MAIZ EN GRANDES CANTIDADES Y LO VENDE AL MENUDEO CON LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD.CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA AUMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MAIZ.

loans.use: grocery store

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Business Description

Pastora has ten year of business experience. She was a client of the cosmetic distribution business. She secured the necessary capital start her own business selling cosmetics. She has been working four years on her own and has developed a loyal clientele. She also sells colas and other soft drinks out of her home. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until late into the night.

Use of the Loan

She will use the loan to to take advantage of bulk purchase discounts. And she will also replenish her soft drink inventory.

Personal Information

Pastora is 49 years old. She is a single mother to a 28 year old son who is a merchant marine. A year ago, her house burned down and destroyed all of her belongings. This unfortunate event did not destroy her drive. On the contrary, it motivated her to get ahead and with her son's help, she has been able to rebuild her home. The home is constructed of various materials. She hopes to be able to complete the construction of the home and to better secure it.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Pastora tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el comercio. Ella era cliente de esta empresa que distribuye cosméticos. Por iniciativa propia busca un capital prestado con el que se inicio como vendedora de este producto. Trabajando ya 4 años con capital propio y una cartera buena de clientes. Ella en casa posee venta de bebidas y colas. Trabaja todos los días de semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta altas horas de la noche.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de productos para aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen al comprar al por mayor. Otra parte surtir también su negocio de bebidas que tiene en su casa.

Información Personal

Pastora tiene 49 años. Es madre soltera y un solo hijo de 28 años . El cual es marino mercante. Hace un año ella sufrió la quema de su casa. Se le destruyeron todos los bienes que poseía. Momento duro para ella que no la desmotivo. Al contrario le dio ánimos para salir adelante y con la ayuda de su hijo ha logrado restaurar su casita. Es de construcción mixta . Su deseo es poder terminar de construirla. Y también darle seguridad.

loans.use: Comprar productos al por mayor

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadelupe is 56 years old, married, with 11 children. Her husband is a farmer. She breeds pigs that she afterwards sells to the people in her community, or in the market place of the nearest town. She is part of the group "Metze 1", together with Mrs. Mauricia Lopez Diaz (breeding and selling chickens). With the loan, they both want to increase the amount of animals they own and to buy feed for breeding and medicines to prevent illnesses.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

GUADALUPE, TIENE 56 AÑOS , CASADA , 11 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO . ELL. SE DEDICA A L. CRIANZA D. PUERCOS Y POSTERIORMENTE LOS VEND. ENTRE L. GENTE D. SU COMUNIDAD O LOS SALE A VENDER AL MERCADO D. L. CIUDAD MAS CERCANA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO MEZTE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MAURICIA LOPEZ DIAZ ( CRIANZA Y VENTA D. POLLOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN AMBAS AUMENTAR L. CANTIDAD D. ANIMALES QUE POSEEN Y COMPRAR ALIMENTOS PARA L. ENGORDA Y MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR ENFERMEDADES .

loans.use: breeding and selling pigs

loans.name: Trinidad Del Rosario

texts.es:
Trinidad del Rosario is 29 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in the fields and she has a small grocery store in her house, where people from the neighborhood come to buy. She is part of the loan group “Mezte 2”, along with Maria del Carmen Pérez Gómez (blouse embroidery) and Dominga Díaz Jimenez (grocery store). With their portions of the loan, Dominga and Trinidad plan to buy merchandise with which to stock their stores, and María will buy embroidery threads.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

TRINIDAD DEL ROSARIO , TIENE 29 AÑOS , CASADA ,3 HIJOS . SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO Y ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA EN DONDE COMPRAN LAS GENTES DE SU ALREDEDOR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MEZTE 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN PEREZ GOMEZ ( BORDADO DE BLUSAS ) Y DOÑA DOMINGA DIAZ JIMENEZ ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) . CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO DOMINGA Y TRINIDAD ESPERAN COMPRAR MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SUS TIENDAS Y MARIA COMPRARA TELAS E HILO DE BORDAR.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Business Description

Teresa has been in business for 12 years. Four years ago, with her own capital and savings, she modified her house to accomodate a grocery shop. This business has gone very well for her, and she has provided good service to her clients. She works every day from 6am to 11pm. She is also starting to sell lunch from her house.

Use of the Loan

She will use the loan to buy merchadise for her business. It will also help her with the lunch business. She will buy fruits and vegetable in bulk.

Personal Information

Teresa is 58 years old. She has 6 children, all adults. They help her with whatever she needs and they are always looking out for her. Her husband sells slippers as an outdoor vendor. Little by little, loans have allowed her to finish construction on her house. With this loan, she hopes to continue work on it.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Teresa tiene una experiencia de 12 años en la actividad del comercio. Hace 4 años con capital propio y dinero ahorrado adecuo su casita y puso venta de víveres. Le ha ido muy bien con esta actividad dando buen servicio a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. También esta iniciando con la venta de almuerzos en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres para su negocio. Y también para elaborar los almuerzos. Comprara legumbres y frutas al por mayor.

Información Personal

Teresa tiene 58 años. Seis hijos los cuales ya son adultos. Le ayudan en lo que necesita y siempre están pendientes de ella. Su esposo trabaja de manera ambulante vendiendo zapatillas. Poco a poco con los créditos que le han otorgado han podido terminar su casita. Esperan con esta inversión poder seguir adecuándola.

loans.use: Comprar viveres para su tienda y para elaborar almuerzos

loans.name: Natividad Regina

texts.es:
Natividad is 20 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in the fields cultivating corn. She has a small grocery store in her house and in the afternoons she embroiders cotton blouses and napkins. She sells them to people in her community who later sell the items in the city of San Cristobal de las Casas. She belongs to the loan group “Mezte 2”. The other members of the group are Maura P. G. (grocery store) and María Eva G. G. (grocery store). With the loan, they plan to invest in merchandise at whole-sale prices. They will then divide up what they buy and use it to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

NATIVIDAD TIENE 20 AÑOS CASADA 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJ EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DE MAIZ. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y POR LAS TARDES SE DEDICA A BORDAR BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS DE MANTA LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE A PERSONAS DENTRO DE SU COMUNIDAD LAS QUE LUEGO COMERCIAN LAS PRENDAS EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MEZTE 2. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MAURA P. G. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) MARIA EVA G. G. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) .. CON EL PRESTAMO TODAS ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PARA LUEGO REPARTIRSE ENTRE ELLAS PARA ABASTECER SUS TIENDITAS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for small grocery store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.es:
Business Description

Elsie has liked business since childhood. With hard work and sacrifice, and the fruit of her labor in various activities, she gathered the money to start her own business. She first modified her home to accomodate her business. Then, various people gave her merchandise and that is how she began. She works every day of the week, from 7am untill 11pm. She also has a shop space in the city center that she currently rents out.

Use of the Loan

She will use this loan to buy housewares since she has pending orders for these products. She will also invest in natural products to sell. This is a new line of sales. She is always well received by those who meet her.

Personal Information

Elsie was widowed 7 years ago. The has three grown children who live with her. When she needs to go out, her children tend to the business. She hopes that the investment in her business will increase her income and beautify her shop.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Elsie desde joven le gusto la actividad del comercio. Con esfuerzo y sacrificio, fruto de su trabajo en varias actividades reunió dinero con el que monto su negocio. Primero adecuo su domicilio para poner su local. Luego varias personas le dieron mercadería y de esta manera se inicio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Además posee un local en el centro de la ciudad que lo tiene al momento arrendado.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de artículos para el hogar ya que tiene pedidos de estos productos. Y también otra parte invertirá en productos naturales para la venta. Esta actividad recién la esta iniciando. Tiene buena acogida de parte de sus conocidos.

Información Personal

Elsie es viuda hace 7 años. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y viven con ella. Cuando tiene que salir sus hijos se encargan de atenderle el negocio. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor presentación a su local.

loans.use: Invertir en articulos para el hogar

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Business Description

Ena has been selling food for 8 years now. She began by working for another person. After that, her children helped her start her own place. Four years later, she reached her goal with all of their help. Ena works every day from 8am until 3pm. On top of that, she sells snacks in the afternoon to satisfy the demand of her clients who place orders with her. She is a great cook, which is why clients prefer her products. In addition, she runs a business selling chickens with her son.

Use of the Loan

She will use this loan to buy kitchen utensils because the ones she has now are very worn. She also wants to buy supplies in bulk, so that she can take advantage of bulk purchase discounts.

Personal Information

Ena is a single mother. She is 52 years old and has 4 grown children. She has been able to finish construction on her house thanks to her work and some bank loans. Her customers appreciate her great service.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ena tiene ya 8 años vendiendo comida. Se inicio trabajando para otra persona. Luego de esto sus hijos le ayudaron para que ella pueda poner su propio local. Hace 4 años realizo su sueño. Recibiendo la ayuda de todos ellos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3pm. Además por las tardes vende meriendas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que le han solicitado que lo haga. Tiene una buena sazón y ese es el motivo de la preferencia de los clientes hacia ella. Además ella posee otro negocio de venta de pollos que lo maneja junto a su hijo.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de utensilios de cocina ya que los que posee están bastante gastados. Y también para comprar víveres al por mayor lo que dejara descuentos por su compra.

Información Personal
