Ena es madre soltera. Tiene 52 años y 4 hijos los cuales ya son adultos. Ha podido gracias a su trabajo y los créditos que le han otorgado los bancos poder terminar de construir su casita. Su servicio hacia los clientes la hacen que estén agradecidos por su atención.

loans.use: Compra de utensilos de cocina

loans.name: María Zeneida

texts.es:
Mrs. S. has three children who go to school every day. She has a shop where she sells tender corn and fruit. She is asking for a loan to make minor repairs to the roof and to refurbish the shop, which is in bad condition. She thinks the improvements will attract more clients to her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. S. es soltera y madre de 3 hijos que asisten diariamente a la escuela, es propietaria de un establecimiento en el cual vende elotes asados y otras frutas, está solicitando el crédito para realizar algunas reparaciones menores en el techo y para remodelar el piso, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado y quiere darle una mejor presentación a su local para atraer más clientes.

loans.use: To repair her shop

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were not able to verify that Ms. Zeneida Solis was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying in full the balance.  Thank you very much and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Altagrazia

texts.en:
Altagracia P. is a 54 year old mother of two and wife to Pedro Leonaldo. She is hoping to expand her business with this loan and to be able to buy a new refrigerator/freezer in order to store more products. She currently sells purified water in individual pouches and in larger containers, ice, ice cream, and frozen juice popsicles. She would like to eventually be able to move her business into an actual market type setting and out of her home.

NOTE: Altagracia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $875 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Nieve

texts.en:
Nieve R. S. is a 44 year old mother of 3 (son pictured) and wife to Francisco. She currently owns a small general store from which she sells different types of food and beverages to the people in her neighborhood. With this loan she is hoping to be able to expand her business to carry more types of food including vegetables and fresh fruit. She wishes to expand in order to improve the quality of life for her family and to be able to better serve those in her neighborhood.

NOTE: Nieve is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $875 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy more wares for her store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. V., despite her young age, has become an expert in the manufacture of rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries popular in Nicaragua). She is originally from Somoto, a village to the north of Managua, famous for making the best rosquillas in the country. She would use the loan to buy raw materials (flour, corn, sugar, and so on). She hopes that the loan will help her improve her economic outlook and better her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. V. es una empresaria jóven que a su corta edad es ya toda una especialista en elaborar rosquillas, es originaria de somoto, un pueblo al norte de managua que se ha caracterizado por ser la ciudad donde se elaboran las mejores rosquillas del país. Esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en materiales que necesita para elaborar sus productos (harina, maíz, azúcar, etc.). Espera que el crédito la ayude a mejorar su condición económica y a sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her pastries

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were not able to verify that Ms. Valle was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia O.'s beauty shop started out as a small stand with a single window, but with a previous loan from Esperanza she was able to buy a storefront for Lidia's Beauty Salon and Boutique. Lidia will use this new loan to furnish and equip her salon, which will provide cosmetic services and also draw customers to her boutique. Though single and without children, Lidia is supporting two family members with her growing business.  As soon as Lidia pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Expansion and equipment

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Mrs. M. has two children in primary school. She relies on her husband's salary, but she wants to augment it and has used her savings to start up a tamale business. She would use the loan to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and other raw materials used in the manufacture of her delicious tamales. She makes two kinds: plain tamales and tamales with various fillings; the latter are her best sellers.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. M. es madre de dos niños que están estudiando la primaria, aunque cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, ha invertido parte de sus ahorros en montar una empresa productora de tamales para incrementar los ingresos familiares, está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, azúcar, leña y otros materiales que le permitan elaborar sus "deliciosos" tamales, nos cuenta que elabora dos tipos de tamales, los simples y los rellenos, siendo estos últimos los más vendidos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tamales.

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were not able to verify that Ms. Mendieta Lopez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon R. started out selling snacks out of a cart he would push through the streets of Quisqueya.  With a loan from Esperanza, he was able to open up a permanent storefront where he sells essential foodstuffs like bread, rice, and meats, as well as everyday conveniences like pens and candies.  Ramon is a smart businessman with almost $100 in savings.  However, Ramon's savings are not enough to grow his business.  He will use this new loan to buy a freezer to expand his offerings to include ice, juices, and soft drinks. As soon as Ramon pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en: When Balbina E.'s husband died, she was left without a source of income with which to support her family.  A microloan from Esperanza enabled her to open the Tienda Fantasia and earn money selling paint, dishes, and other household commodities to families in her neighborhood.  Now able to make a living independently, Balbina will use this new loan to expand her stock of items in order to grow her business to provide a solid foundation for her family's future.

loans.use: Expansion of product offerings

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Mrs. J. has more than twenty years of experience making and selling tamales, both plain and filled. She is married and has four children. One daughter helps out in the business, and the other children work at various jobs. She would use the loan to make several improvements in her place of business that would attract clients. She wants to add a counter where she could serve and sell her goods, thereby increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. J. tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de tamales simples y rellenos. Es casada y madre de 4 hijos, una de sus hijas la ayuda en su negocio y los otros tres han estudiado y trabajan en diferentes empresas. Está solicitando el crédito para hacer algunas mejoras en su local, lo cual le permitirá tener una mejor presentación para sus clientes. Piensa que a corto plazo puede construir en su terreno un pequeño bar donde vender sus productos y otros productos que le hagan incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To remodel her tamale shop and buy raw materials

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Ms. Jara was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Mr. S. is married and has two children. In his shop he makes garage doors, doors, playground structures, security bars, and so on. He would use the loan to buy iron, soldering materials, and other raw materials to meet client demands. Through this loan, he hopes to increase client orders and improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. S. es casado y padre de dos niños, además es propietario de un taller de soldadura en el cual confecciona portones, puertas, juguetes infantiles para instalar en parques, verjas de seguridad, etc. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de hierro, soldadura y otros materiales que le ayuden a cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Espera tener un incremento considerable en sus ingresos después del crédito y espera también que le permita mejorar las condiciones económicas de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy iron and other raw materials

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Sanchez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance owed.  We hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is married and has two daughters who go to primary school. She has a blacksmith shop where she makes machetes, hatchets, hammers, stirrups, etc., which she sells to various hardware stores and other markets in Managua. She would use the loan to buy the iron from which she fashions her products. She believes this increased production would generate greater profits and better her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. S. es casada y madre de dos niñas que asisten a la escuela primaria, es propietaria además de un taller de metalúrgia que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes herramientas como machetes, hachas, martillos, estribos, etc. que vende en diferentes ferreterías y mercados de Managua. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de hierro, material con el cual elabora sus productos. Piensa que este incremento en la producción le permitirá elevar sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy iron and other raw materials

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Ms. Saballos was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance and encourage you to continue supporting Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements in his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Aka

texts.en: Mrs. Aka A. is married. She is 48 years old and is a mother of 13 children. She has been selling fish for 30 years. Her husband retired a few years ago from his school master position. A. lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of the city of Abidjan. She is currently the main financial supporter for her family. She wants to extend her activity and meet customers’ daily orders which are increasing.

loans.use: To purchase stock of frozen fish in bulk.

loans.name: Yaho

texts.en: Yaho K. A. is a 46 year old woman. She is married and has 9 children. Her husband is a retired mechanic worker. She has never been to school. She sells food-stuffs in order to be independent. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She started her career as a dressmaker, but due to some pain in her eyes, she was forced to stop. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods and increase her margin.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Assafa

texts.en: Assafa A. is a meat seller. He is 35 and he lives in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan with his wife and their 4 children. He’s been selling meat for more than 16 years. Now he is seeking a loan in order to buy 2 cows. His ambition is to be a meat wholesaler. Assafa A., who heard about AE&I from his sister, joined AE&I microcredit program in March 2005 and has been a good performer since then.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte T. B. is a single woman with no children.  She has 12 years of work experience in selling ladies’ fashion and cosmetic products. She was a student before starting her business, but because of financial problems she didn’t complete her education (business administration). She wants to purchase goods in bulk. She is lives with her 2 sisters in a small apartment in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She is very ambitious and would like to open a big store. She used to buy her goods in Accra, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Nguessan Maxime

texts.en:
Nguessan N. Maxim is a 30 year old man. He lives with his common-law spouse and their boy in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Nguesan sells ladies’ fashion and beauty lotions. He heard about AE&I in May 2006 from his sister and joined the AE&I microcredit program in July 2006.

He is a good performer and will use the loan to open a bigger store selling clothes and cosmetic products. He was a warehouse keeper before starting with ladies’ fashion. He lost his job 7 years ago and has 7 years of work experience in the fashion trade.

loans.use: To expand his ladies' fashion store

loans.name: Kert

texts.en: Mrs Kert N. is 49 years old and a widow. She lives in Siem Reap with her 3 children and works as a grocer, earning around 5 dollars per day. She needs a motorcycle to help her carry her products to her grocery. In the future, she would like to expand the variety of products available at her grocery store to meet her clients' demands.  The picture shows Mrs Kert N. (wearing the brown skirt) with her sister.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for the transportation of products she sells.

payments.comment: Kert Nak has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Ey

texts.en: Mrs. Ey L. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home and cooks meals for the entire family. Her husband works as a driver for a private company and also runs a small booth in his area charging vehicle batteries.  With these two jobs he contributes approximately $4.5 each day towards covering the family's expenses. Two of the couple’s children are welders, while the other two are still at school. Currently, her husband needs to repair his car and leftover money from the loan will be used to purchase some tools for his business. In the future, he would like to make enough money to expand his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To repair a car and purchase tools for his business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Ey Lai has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr Nut S. is 26. He lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with his father who is a taxi driver earning around 3 dollars per day. Mr Nut S. is an electrician and earns 5 dollars a day. He wants to purchase a motorcycle for his father to operate a business.  In the future, Mr Nut S. would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his father who want to operate a business

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your loan makes his business grow very fast and now he is able to pay off the loan very early. He would like to say thanks for all the lenders that have supported his business and provided him an opportunity to raise his standard of living.

loans.name: Koa

texts.en:
Mrs Koa M. is 42 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She sells rice, khmer food and soft drinks and earns around 7 dollars a day. Her husband works for a private tourist company and earns 2 dollars a day. They have 2 children. 
She wants to purchase a motorcycle so that she can transport her stock more easily. In the future, she would like to increase the number of products she is able to offers her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Koa Mom start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Mrs Nou S. is 36 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She works at a hotel. Her husband is a construction foreman. They have 3 children and between them earn 6 dollars a day.  The loan would allow them to repair their house and be protected from leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her house

payments.comment: Congratulations to Nou Sotheary for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean S. Y., is 42 years old and the mother of one child.  She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living selling vegetables at a market and makes on average $2.5/day. Her husband is self-employed as a taxi driver. 
Currently, Yean S. Y. wants to expand her business by adding different kinds of vegetables to her stall to meet her clients’ demands. She is confident that she can increase her profits as a result of this business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to meet her clients' demands

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn M. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns around 2.5 dollars a day. Her husband is a construction foreman and also makes wine. He earns 5 dollars a day. They have 3 children who are students.  She wants to purchase tools to expand her husband's wine business. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase tools to make more wine

payments.comment: Congratulations to Porn Moa for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Prean

texts.en:
Mrs Prean T. is 34. She lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She makes mats for a living and earns 3 dollars per day.  Her husband works for a private company and earns 5 dollars per day. They have two children. 
They want to repair their house in order to be protected from the leaking in rainy season.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to be protected from the leaking during rainy season

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mrs Chek C. is 24 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She earns 3 dollars a day selling fish. Her husband is 27 and earns 7 dollars per day as an electrician and a farmer. They have 3 children.  With their loan, they want to purchase cows to expand their business. In the future, they would like to purchase another stand in the market.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs Suon S. M. is 40 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She is a house wife. Her husband is a construction worker and a motor taxi driver. He earns 4 dollars a day. They have 4 children. They need a loan to purchase a motorcycle in order to run a business.  The picture shows Mrs Suon S. M. and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to run a business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Suon Srey Mom for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Mrs. Khen T., 53, is a mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, together, put all their effort toward working very hard on a farm growing rice and a variety of fresh vegetables. Early every morning, the couple’s children collect the produce and sell it at a market which enables them to make on average about $3.65 each day. Currently, this couple is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm. You are the one who will determine their success and play an important role in their business’s growth.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Khen Torn has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Hoeun K. is 35 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. Together with his wife, he buys and sells pigs and cows in a market. They earn about US$ 2.50 a day. They have 5 children. 
They want to purchase pigs and cows to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and cows

loans.name: Chery

texts.en:
Mr. Chery S. is 26 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. He and his wife rent out traditional Khmer instruments to people who are celebrating a wedding ceremony.  They earn about 2 dollars a day.They have one child. 
They want to expand their business by purchasing instruments such as speakers, a microphone and a VCD to rent out.

loans.use: To purchase some instruments to expand their business.

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Mrs Pork P. is 29 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She works in a hotel and earns 4 dollars a day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns 4 dollars a day. Mrs Pork P. wants to purchase a passenger cart to allow her  husband to work as a tuk tuk.

loans.use: To purchase a passenger cart for her husband's motorcycle so that he can work as a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Meav

texts.en:
Mrs. Meav T. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she purchases bananas from someone’s plantation (i.e., wholesale) and resells them to people in the area where her husband is self-employed as a horse cart driver, driving a passenger cart drawn by a horse. Together, they make on average about $6/day.

Two of their children are working and the other three attend school. It is important to mention that one of their children is talented and would like to follow in his father’s footsteps. He intends to generate more income for their household by driving a horse-cart like his father. This is why Meave T. is requesting a loan to purchase another horse cart for her son to drive.

loans.use: `To purchase a horse-cart ( a passenger cart drawn by a horse) for her son to drive

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad O. is 57 years old and has a high education. His specialization is mathematics. Muhammad is married and has 4 children. He is a Director in a college in the town of Yavan.  He started breeding livestock last year, but he learned the skills of this business in childhood. With the loan amount of $1000 he is going to buy a dairy cow and bull-calf for breeding.  He is going to produce milk products, such as butter, curd, cream, and chaka and sell them in a town market. This loan helps him to increase and diversify the range of fresh dairy products in a market where till now there has been a lack of dairy products. Also this business gives his children an opportunity to taste fresh dairy products every day. The breeding of the bull-calf will provide the main income for the family because the salary from his state job is very low.

loans.use: Buying dairy cow and bull-calf

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 25 years old. She is married and is the mother of four children. She is doing carpet weaving. She learned to weave carpets in Pakistan because she moved there and then to Iran for some years during the war. She could manage to support her family as the sole wage-earner when she lived in Pakistan and Iran. After peace came to Afghanistan, she came to Kabul and started her business. Now she has less capital and wants to get a loan to expand her business and purchase more materials to support her family economically.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has a small mini-market in the Kirkuk market. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to get $1000 to purchase more goods for his shop and develop his shop. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: Mrs. Hou B. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a diligent woman, who has two different sources of income. First, she makes her living by operating a grocery store. Second, she runs a tailoring business. From these two business activities, she typically makes around $8 each day, while her husband assists in generating more income by working as a teacher. Hou B. needs a sewing machine and thread bought in bulk for her tailoring business; that is why she is asking for the loan to help her.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread in bulk for her tailoring business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Hou Beb start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He has a bakery in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase a new bakery machine and hire two jobless people. Also he wants to paint the shop and purchase new equipment for the bakery. He wants to develop his bakery and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new oven

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang S. N. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a merchant who purchases fertilizer in bulk from the wholesalers and resells it to the people in her area. Her husband  is a workman and can only make a meager sum for his household. In order to maximize her income, Mrs. S. N. is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer in bulk for her inventory

payments.comment: Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off her loan a head of time. She would like to say thank to all lenders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy extra plastic plates and cups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs Yeang N. is 21. Her husband is a carpenter who earns 2 dollars a day. They have two children who are in school.  In order to expand the carpentry business, they need more tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools to expand her husband's carpentry business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Yeang Neang has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay secondary school fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an extra battery charger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build two rental houses.

loans.name: Vung

texts.en:
Mr Vung P. is a widower of 46. He is a construction foreman and earns US$ 2.50 a day. He has 5 children. Three of them are still students. 
Mr. Vung P. needs tools such as an electric saw to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Mrs. Eam N. is 28 years old and is a widow who lives with her mother and her child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother who works very hard to support the entire family. She makes her living by selling different kinds of tires in her area and typically makes around $5/day. Recently, Eam N. can no longer satisfy all her clients' needs, but she is not able to increase her inventory, which is why she needs the loan to help her.

loans.use: To purchase more tires in order to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Eam Ny who was able to repay this loan early!

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mr Lay T. is 40 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. He is a farmer and a fortune teller. His wife sells vegetables. They earn 5 dollars a day. They have one child. In the future, they would like to expand their business by growing a wide variety of crops. But, in order to increase their business, they need more land and more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase  land in order to grow crops and to purchase vegetables for sale

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Lay Thun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Mar

texts.en:
Mrs. Mar C. L. is 43 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a grocer and her husband is a security guard. They have 5 children, three of whom are still in school. They earn 4 dollars a day. Mrs. Mar C. L. wants to increase her grocery so she has to buy a grocery store.
In the future, she would like to expand her business by providing a wide range of products.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery store to operate a business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Mar Chun Lim has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you make it possible for entrepreneurs around the world to access loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Puo

texts.en:
Mrs. Puo S. C. is 27. She lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their children. They own a grocery store and they earn $7.50 a day. They want to expand their business, that's why they need to purchase more products. 
They want to increase their business to meet the needs of their clients.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Puo Seav Chea start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Farzhana

texts.en: Farzhana lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is not married, and she lives with her father. Her father is old, and she is supporting him. She is bead worker. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to buy extra materials for her craft and to find more clients. She wants to make a good income to help her father and also make a good future for herself. She is happy now.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Currently H.,age 48, lives with her spouse and 3 children. Unlike other woman farmers who plant and practice animal husbandry, she took advantage of Investment Fund and opened a dress-making shop. Six years later, her place of business is a familiar address among female populace in her area. Her husband and children do the farming thus lending her invaluable support so she can devote most of her time to the business she loves. Her business is prospering, and responding to market demand, she plans to make a loan of US$575.00 to buy additional clothing material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Mai Doan, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị H. năm nay 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Không giống như những người phụ nữ nông thôn chỉ quen với trồng trọt và chăn nuôi, chị H. vay vốn từ Quỹ đầu tư vào cửa hàng may. Sau 6 năm vay vốn giờ đây cửa hàng may của chị H. là địa chỉ quen thuộc của chị em phụ nữ trong thôn. Chồng và các con chị hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc đồng áng để chị có thể dành thời gian cho công việc mình yêu thích. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi, chị H. đang đề nghị được vay thêm 575USD để mua vải may quần áo đáp ứng nhu cầu của thị trường.

loans.use: buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem V. is 47 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She makes mortars and pestles with her husband. They have 5 children,  three of whom are still students. They earn two USD per day. They need to purchase rocks, stones and other tools to expand their business and increase their profit.

More information from our field partner, CREDIT:

"Originally, this is a photo of her husband because V. Sem was unavailable when we visited. Another point,  this couple can generate around $2 each; two of their children typically earn $4/day from working at the garment factory, and one of whom is a mechanic who makes up to $3/day, while other two attend school. I’m writing to make more details about this family’s revenue. And the picture taken is at their house."

loans.use: To purchase rock, stones and other tools to expand her business

loans.name: Najeeba

texts.en: Najeeba lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is divorced and lives with her brother. She wants to work to make a good future for herself. She is skilled at embroidery. She has experience in this craft. She wants to take a group loan to buy embroidery materials to expand her business. She wants to make a good life for herself and also for her brother. She is happy, and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs N. is an active woman. She is socially very involved in her community. Currently she is the leader of the women group in her village. She's also a member of the committee of a charity organization. Mrs N. also takes good care of her household. In her yard, she's raising 6 pigs, a few dozen of hens, 2 oxes. She's also tending her 1 acre of rice field, 5 acres of bananas trees. Her husband, Lương Văn Đạt, is also working very hard to help her out in spite of his health problem. They're also brewing wine for the villagers. Their 2 children are grown up and live on their own so they are not a burden for their parents. At the age of 47, healthy and hard working in her nature, Mrs N. is seeking a loan to expand her pig raising family business and better exploit her land. She requests 575 USD to buy more pigs, hens and food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Là một phụ nữ năng động, chị N. tham gia hầu như mọi công tác xã hội tại địa phương. Hiện tại chị đang kiêm nhiệm nhiều chức vụ: chi hội trưởng phụ nữ thôn, ban chấp hành xã, cán bộ cụm của Quỹ Tình thương. Không chỉ giỏi việc nước chị N. còn đảm việc nhà. Chị hiện đang nuôi 6 con lợn, vài chục con gà, 2 con bò. Bên cạnh đó diện tích đất canh tác của gia đình bao gồm 1 mẫu ruộng, 5 mẫu đất trồng chuối. Chồng chị, Anh Lương Văn Đạt, mặc dù sức khỏe không được tốt cũng rất tích cực giúp vợ trong công việc gia đình. Ngoài ra anh chị còn nấu rượu để cung cấp cho người làng. Hai con của anh chị đã trưởng thành ra ở riêng nên gánh nặng kinh tế với gia đình hầu như không có. Nhưng ở độ tuổi 47, vẫn còn sức khỏe cộng với tính cần cù chịu khó của người phụ nữ Việt Nam chị vẫn tích cực chăn nuôi sản xuất phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chị N. đang làm đơn xin vay 575 USD để có thêm vốn mua thức ăn, phát triển đàn lợn, gà của gia đình.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, chickens

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs Kung Shret is 18. She lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia and sells fish. Her husband rents out instruments for wedding ceremonies. They have 3 children. One of them is still a student. They earn 7 dollars a day and they want to increase their business by purchasing tools and equipment that they will rent out for wedding ceremonies.

loans.use: To purchase equipment that she will rent out for wedding ceremonies

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
It's so beautiful when one steps into the orange field of Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh, a 44 years old married woman. Over 4 acres of land filled with beautiful green orange trees in full bloom. There's a fish pond in the middle of the field. The sheer beauty of the scenery would make you forget about the heat of the summer. Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh and her husband, Mr Vũ Văn Thanh, had been working very hard on their land for the last 4 months. Their 15 years old daughter had also been helping them out after school. The revenue from selling the oranges is about 62 USD a month. Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy gardening tools and manure which would help her expand her orange business and bringing more revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Thật tuyệt vời khi bước vào vườn cam nhà chị Lê Thị Tĩnh, 44 tuổi. Trên 4 sào đất phủ một màu xanh ngắt của những cây cam với những cành cây trĩu quả. Giữa vườn cây là một ao cá, khung cảnh có thể làm cho bạn cảm thấy bớt nóng hơn dưới cái nắng mùa hè. Để đạt được thành quả này chị Tĩnh và chồng chị, anh Vũ Văn Thanh đã làm việc chăm chỉ trong suốt 4 tháng qua. Cô con gái 15 tuổi ngoài những giờ đi học cũng tích cực giúp đỡ bố mẹ chăm sóc vườn cây. Vườn cam này mang lại cho anh chị thu nhập bình quân hơn 1 triệu/ tháng. Hiện tại chị đang muốn vay thêm 450 USD để mua phân bón và dụng cụ lao động để cải tạo vườn cam tăng doanh thu.

loans.use: buy manure and gardening tools

loans.name: Louch

texts.en: Mrs. Louch S. N. is 44 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia with her husband and their 4 children. Two of the children are still students. She makes and sells fried bananas. Her husband is a construction foreman. She wants to purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works far from their house. In the future, she would like to build a big store to increase their profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle as transport for her husband

payments.comment: Louch Sok Neang paid back the Kiva loan early! Congratulations!

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khin D. is 41 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns 5 dollars a day. Her husband is a merchant; he purchases and sells cows. They have 5 children. Three of them are still students.
Mrs Khin D. wants to purchase a van in order to carry her goods. In the future, they would like to purchase more cows to increase their profits.

loans.use: To purchase a van in order to carry her goods

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Khin Dara has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Khavasmoh

texts.en: R. Khavasmoh is 42 years old. She has a high education – her specialization is law. She is married and has 4 children. After she graduated, Khavasmoh was hired for a job at a pension fund. During her professional career she   was promoted several times. But nowadays salary in regular employment is very low and Khavasmoh decided to start her own business. At the end of 2006 her colleague who had a sale-point in a market offered to go with her to a town for goods. Together they bought cheap kids' clothes.  After trading she had a good income which was higher than her salary, and she decided to leave her job and start trading. Thereafter she rented a sale-point in a “Tijorat” market. It has been 7 months since she started trading. With the loan amount, she is going to buy cheap kids' clothes. This loan helps her to increase the range of goods. Considering the fact that Yavan district habitants are poor, they now have the opportunity to buy cheap kids' clothes.

loans.use: To increase the range of kids' clothes

loans.name: Hoe Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Hoe Thi T., 43 years old, and her husband Uyen Van Nguyen are owners of a store front that husk rice. They currently live in Hung Yen province which is in the northern region of Vietnam. With three school-aged children, they are the primary labor workers in the family. Along with their family savings, they plan to use the loan amount of USD$1200 to purchase more rice to husk, thereby increasing their productivity and potential earnings.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phung Pham, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hòe, 43 tuổi và anh Nguyễn Văn Uyên là chủ nhân của của một cửa hàng xay xát gạo. Họ đang sống tại Hưng Yên, một tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam. Với 3 con còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học, hai anh chị là lao động chính trong gia đình. Đây là một công việc rất vất vả khi với một khối lượng gạo rất lớn chỉ có hai người lao động. Do trên địa phương cũng có một số cửa hàng làm dịch vụ này nên anh chị cũng cần có một số vốn tương đối để tăng tính hiệu quả khi thu mua thóc gạo. Cộng với số vốn sẵn có của gia đình, anh chị muốn vay 1200 USD từ Quỹ Tình thương để dùng cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: buy rice to husk and sell it

loans.name: Bil

texts.en: Mrs. Bil P. is 41. She lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She makes wine and raises pigs. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. They earn 4 dollars a day. They have 2 children and one of them works with his parents. They want to increase their business by purchasing pig feed and rice used to make wine. In the future, they would like to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and rice used to make wine

payments.comment:
Congratulation to Mrs. Sek Mey!!!!!!!!

Now She is able to pay off her loan very early. On behalf of Mrs Sek Mey, we would like to say greatly thank to all the lenders who always support and help to our poor entrepreneurs. your loan can make different. 

we will provide the Journal update of Sek Mey family as soon as we could so that you will understand what different your loan make on her and her family. 

Many Thanks again

loans.name: Anh Hoang

texts.vi:
Ms. Hoang Anh N. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Luong Bang, in the province of Hung Yen in Vietnam. Her two children are grown and are currently working. With a clear plan of how she is going to use the loan, Ms. N. will use a part of the loan to purchase rice and use the remaining portion to expand her current business in pork pies and sausages. She plans to use her current pork pie and sausage business to help repay the loan amount weekly. She hopes the investment in the purchase of rice will realize returns of which she will use for future business investments. Ms. N. is requesting a total loan amount of USD$1200. She plans to use USD$1050 toward the purchase of rice to husk, and use the remaining USD$150 to expand her pork pie and sausage business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phung Pham, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Hoàng Anh năm nay 47 tuổi sống cùng chồng và hai con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên, Việt Nam. Hai con chị đều đã trưởng thành và có việc làm. Có kế hoạch rõ ràng khi đầu tư đồng vốn, chị Nguyễn Hoàng Anh để một phần vốn vay thu mua thóc gạo, phần còn lại chị dùng kinh doanh giò chả. Với cơ chế hiện nay của Quỹ tình thương, cửa hàng giò chả giúp chị thực hiện công việc hoàn trả hàng tuần một cách dễ dàng. Trong khi đó, thu nhập từ kho thóc sẽ mang lại cho chị những khoản thu nhập lớn hơn dùng cho những mục đích khác. Chị đang làm dự án xin vay 1200 USD từ Quỹ Tình thương trong đó 1050 USD sẽ được dùng cho việc thu mua thóc còn 150 USD sẽ được dùng cho việc mua nguyên liệu làm giò.

loans.use: buy rice to husk, buy pork to make pork pies and sausages

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
With two small children and a husband who is still studying, Mrs. Nguyen thi C., 36 years old, has to take care of everything in the family by herself. She is a typically hard-working Vietnamese woman. Selling sugar-cane juice, inflating tyres, carrying big and heavy bamboos, etc should be men’s jobs, but she is always willing to accept these jobs to pay for the bills when her husband is away from home. She has been earning $130 per month for two years. She is planning to borrow $325 to buy and sell more bamboos when local people’s demand for bamboos increases.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Hai con còn nhỏ, chồng đi học, một mình chị Nguyễn Thị Chắt, 36 tuổi, đảm nhận mọi công việc trong gia đình. Chị Chắt là điển hình của người phụ nữ Việt Nam chịu thương chịu khó. Bán nước mía, bơm xe cho khách hàng, khuân những cây tre to và nặng khi có người mua, công việc thật sự nên dành cho những người đàn ông nhưng chị sẵn sàng gánh vác để trang trải những khoản chi phí gia đình trong lúc chồng đi vắng. Những việc nói trên mang lại cho chị khoản thu nhập 2 triệu đồng/ tháng và chị đã làm công việc này 2 năm nay. Chị đang có ý định vay 325 USD để mua thêm nứa khi nhu cầu tre nứa của người dân trong vùng đang nâng cao

loans.use: buy bamboo to retail

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Although having 5 perches of rice-field and 5 perches of orchard, Mrs. Doan Thi T., who is 33 years old, still decides to open a grocery store. In order to do so, she would like to borrow money from TYM Fund. Her husband, Ngo Dinh Thoa, a security officer, also gives her a lot of support. According to him, TYM Fund does not only lend people money but also teaches them how to use the money wisely and helps them increase social knowledge. Having been a TYM member for 10 years, he knows that what he believes is right. Now total income of both T. and Thoa is $130 per month, which is a big improvement compared to theirs before joininng TYM. Their sons, one is 15 and the other is 12 years old, also help their mother with the store during their free time. She is looking forward to borrow $575 to expand the store and increase the number of goods sold everyday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Mặc dù làm 5 sào ruộng, 5 sào cây ăn quả và một ao cá, chị Đoàn Thị Thịnh, 33 tuổi, vẫn quyết định mở thêm một cửa hàng tạp hóa. Để có tiền mua hàng chị tham gia vay vốn Quỹ tình thương. Chổng chị, anh Ngô Đình Thoa, một cán bộ an ninh thôn, cũng rất ủng hộ vợ trong việc này. Theo anh tham gia Quỹ không những được vay vốn mà còn được học cách sử dụng vốn, nâng cao kiến thức về mặt xã hội. 10 năm tham gia Quỹ cũng đã chứng tỏ những điều anh suy nghĩ là đúng. Thu nhập của hai anh chị hiện nay là 2 triệu đồng/ tháng, tăng lên so với trước khi vào Quỹ. Hai con trai anh chị, 15 và 12 tuổi ngoài giờ học cũng giúp đỡ mẹ trông hàng. Hiện chị đang làm dự án vay 575 USD để tăng số lượng hàng bán ra mỗi ngày.

loans.use: Buy more goods to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Uljanoy

texts.en:
Uljanoy M. is 50 years old, and she has a secondary level education. She is married and has 6 children. She was a housewife and took care of her children. She was in a difficult life situation when her husband had to leave the country for earnings. She did not have any income or ability to feed her family, and nobody helped her.

She saw her neighbor, a women who worked in a market and sold various goods, earn income. After that Uljanoy also decided to work in a market and do business. She started her business with small-wares goods. She saw that this kind of business brought her a good income, and she started to change the range of goods. It has been 6 years since she started her business. With the loan amount of $1175, she is going to buy fashionable kids' clothes and footwear. This loan helps to increase her range of goods. To buy such goods, the habitants of Yavan district had to go far from their district - nearly 100 km outside. So now they have the opportunity save money that they would spend on transportation expenditures. The client is going pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Buy and sell kids' and teenagers' clothes and footwear

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and married. She has three children; one aged 5 years in Pre-Primary, the second aged 3.8 years in Pre-Primary, and the third is 9 months old.

Juliet has experience in business management and she has been running a shop of construction materials for the last two years.The prices have been rising very fast which has affected the volume of the stock.

She wants to borrow US $1200 to increase her stock. Her current operational costs are high due to small stock in the shop. When she buys in bulk the unit cost goes down which make her enjoy discount from the wholesalers.The increase in stock is likely to increase the business profitability. She wants to increase the stock and also stock a variety of items to retain customers and attract ones. She plans to pay back the loan within 6 months.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying more stock

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Seven years ago Angelica opened a small clothing kiosk in the market of Nikolaev, Ukraine. With the assistance of microfinance loans through Nadezhda, Ukraine, Angelica successfully expanded her business, opening two stores and transitioning from casual clothing to formal wear. A skilled businesswoman, Angelica is known throughout Nikolaev for her reasonable prices, reliable home delivery, and individualized customer service. Angelica has requested a loan of $500 to purchase additional inventory for the upcoming prom season in Ukraine. With the additional profits, she plans to continue developing her business and supporting her daughter’s university education.

loans.use: Angelica would like to purchase additional inventory for her women's formal wear store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Ten years ago, Margarita opened a children’s clothing and footwear kiosk in the central market of Khoost, Ukraine. Prior to that time, she had to work abroad in order to support her family. She opened her business with the hope of supporting her family locally. Her investment skills and integrity, combined with the assistance of microfinance loans through Nadiya Ukraine, have helped her to successfully and consistently grow her business. Margarita is a focused and generous entrepreneur. She regularly uses her business expertise to advise and assist other entrepreneurs at the central market in Khoost. Currently, Margarita is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase inventory in bulk. With the additional profits, Margarita plans to work toward opening a department store in the local city mall. Additionally, Margarita plans to use extra profits to make home improvements and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Margarita would like to purchase additional inventory to improve her children's clothing and footwear store.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana has been operating a footwear kiosk in the Melitopol, Ukraine market for over seven years. An experienced businesswoman and veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, Tatyana has successfully utilized and repaid several loans that have helped her to develop a successful and sustainable business. With the profits from her business, Tatyana supports her family and her elderly parents. She is hardworking and reliable, having repaid all past loans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan for $500 to re-supply her inventory. With the profits, Tatyana plans to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to purchase additional inventory for her footwear kiosk.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en: Vitalyi owns and operates a computer center in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. A skilled computer expert and savvy entrepreneur, Vitalyi provides quality computer services with no direct competition. Lively and hard-working, Vitalyi opened his computer center two years ago to support his wife and son. Over that time, Vitalyi has received and successfully repaid three loans through Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, Vitalyi is seeking a loan of $800 to purchase some new computers. With the additional profits, Vitalyi plans to expand his business and eventually purchase newer, high-tech computers.

loans.use: Vitalyi would like to purchase new computers for his computer services center.

loans.name: Yaroslava

texts.en: Eight years ago, Yaroslava left her job with the Ukrainian government to start her own business in women’s footwear and clothing. She opened her business in a favourable area of downtown Tyachevo, Ukraine, and carefully designed unique discount and product guarantee systems to build a loyal clientele base. She retains these systems today, consistently drawing in new clients. With rich experience, integrity, and a strong aptitude for business, Yaroslava has built a profitable and highly reputable business. A veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, Yaroslava has served both as an inspiration to other business owners and as a source of referral for new entrepreneurs. With her profits, she has consistently supported her family and elderly parents. Currently, Yaroslava is seeking a loan of $800 to purchase bulk inventory for her business. By purchasing inventory in bulk, Yaroslava will be able to reduce her business expenses and increase her profits. With the additional profits, Yaroslava hopes to open a second store and further expand her successful business.

loans.use: Yaroslava would like to purchase additional inventory for her women's footwear and clothing store.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila owns and operates a very successful business in a small market where she sells sausages, mayonnaise, butter and different types of cheeses. There are several large supermarkets around the market where Ludmila works but she has many close relationships and has built up a good repertoire of loyal customers. Ludmila is a wonderful person. She is funny, has a wonderful sense of humor and is very personable and reliable. She has a 6 year old son. Her husband, Dimitry, works along side of her in the business.

Ludmila has requested a loan to purchase a small freezer for her market location which will allow her to store more produce for a longer period of time. She would also like to purchase a larger inventory of products. Such products are needed almost daily and Ludmila is very excited at the prospect of offering such a good and fresh assortment. She currently makes about $400 to $500 a month and has $800 to $1,000 invested in products. She has been and is a very dependable person in her loan payments with Nadiya Ukraine.

loans.use: Ludmila would like to purchase a freezer and inventory for her dairy and sausage market.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya V. is a single, divorced mother of one daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and runs a business selling spices, plastic dishes and various home and kitchen gadgets. This is actually her second business. In her original store she sells different teas but decided to broaden her investments with a second store. The two stores are located right next to each other making it convenient for her to efficiently run both stores herself.

Natalya has been in the same location for 13 years and has an extensive background in managerial work. She is a very lively woman, friendly, out-going, dependable and is a great entrepreneur. Natalya’s goal is to eventually open another store in a different location which would greatly enhance her sales and income. She just recently became a grandmother (which she is thrilled about) and has had her daughter and family move in with her. Her desire is to see her business develop and prosper so that she can help both families. She makes about $400 to $500 a month and has around $800 to $1,000 invested in her products. She has requested a $1000 loan in order to purchase more inventories. In all the years she has been associated with Nadiya Ukraine she has never been late with a loan payment.

loans.use: Natalya would like to purchase additional inventory for her kitchen and home supply store.

loans.name: Nicolai

texts.en:
Nicolai has a small business selling shoes at the Angolenko Market in Zaporozhye. Nicolai is a very friendly and out-going person. He has a vibrant personality and is always happy no matter his circumstances. He is married and has a 7 year old son whom he would like to see get a good and solid education. Nicolai and his wife have been in business for 8 years. They operate one of the few businesses in their marketplace that also sells warm winter and work boots. He makes a good profit during the winter for this very reason.

For the warmer season, Nicolai would like to increase his stock of seasonal shoes such as flip-flops, sport and casual shoes and has requested a loan to purchase inventory. Recently, all the kiosks in the marketplace were remodeled and the entrepreneurs had to pay their rent up front. Most of the money for this came from the family’s working capital so Nicolai needs a cash infusion to be able to update his stock of shoes. He makes about $300 to $400 per month and has $2,000 invested in his products. During his time with Nadiya Ukraine he has never been late with his loan payments.

loans.use: Nicolai would like to purchase additional inventory for his shoe store.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Ms Abigail has owned her hamburger and fast food business for more than two years. The business is the family's income. Abigail is a single mother of two children, both of which are in school. She asks for a loan of 1,200 dollars to purchase a car, allowing her to make her business purchases, transport the goods home, and deliver them to residences.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Abigail tiene ya más de 2 años con el negocio de hamburguesas y comida rápida. Este negocio es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando. Ella necesita un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para comprar un carro y poder salir a realizar sus comprar del negocio y así transportar su mercancías hasta su casa .y hacer entregas a domicilia.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Ms Felicidad lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest child on Avenida Buenos Aires in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. She is 50 years old, and since a young age she has sold food at the door of her residence (by contract) to chauffeurs (taxi and bus drivers) and construction workers. Her clients make an agreement with her to prepare food every day.

With her savings, Felicidad was able to construct a small shop in her house. She asks for a loan to furnish her business (to purchase tables and chairs) since she now has the possibility of opening an eatery, which would mean a more stable clientele and an increase in income.

Felicidad's past history with Impro certifies her as a very good client and one who can access new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Felicidad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija menor en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su domicilio atendiendo a los chóferes (taxi and bus drivers) y albañiles por contrato, es decir que sus clientes tienen un acuerdo con ella para que les prepare comida todos los días.

Con sus ahorros, Felicidad pudo construir una pequeña tienda en su casa y el crédito que ahora solicita es para amoblar su negocio (comprar mesas y sillas) ya que ahora tiene la posibilidad de abrir una pensión, lo cual implicaría una clientela mas estable y mejoras en sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase furnishings for her expanding business

payments.comment: Client wants to pay off the loan in advance. She will be applying for a new loan very soon.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty lives in her in-laws' house on Avenida Buenos Aires in the Lomas zone of the city of Paz with her husband and her son. She is 29 years old, and since marriage she has sold lubricants, sharing the workshop space with her father-in-law, who is a mechanic. The workshop is small but is growing little by little.

Betty asks for a loan to purchase more variety of product. This business is her only form of income, and she does not want to lose her clientele, especially since at the moment her husband attends school and she is the only one working.

Her previous history with Impro certifies her as a very good client and as someone who can access new credit. This is the third loan solicited by Betty, and the previous two were payed off by the stipulated dates of payment in the respective contracts.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty vive en la casa de sus suegros en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de la Paz con su esposo y su hijo pequeño. Ella tiene 29 años de edad y desde que se caso se dedica a la venta de lubricantes compartiendo el taller con su suegro que es mecánico. El taller todavía es pequeño pero va creciendo poco a poco.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar mas producto y mas variado y no perder clientela ya que es su único ingreso de subsistencia por el momento ya que su esposo estudia y ella es la que trabaja

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y los dos anteriores fueron cancelados de acuerdo a las fechas de pago estipuladas en los respectivos contratos.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of product and build capital

payments.comment: Betty wants to pay off the loan eralier. She is going to apply for a new loan .

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives in an anticretico rental property with her husband and children on Jose Saravia street in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. Maria is 44 years old, and she sells fireworks (used for various social events).

Since Maria works with very little capital, she approached Impro to ask for a loan and hence increased her capital and was able to supply her clients with a greater variety of products. More importantly, she did not lose her clients, especially since the income from this business maintains her family.

Maria does not have a past history with Impro. However, her desire to improve her situation qualifies her as the type of client who is working hard to improve his/her way of life, and this is part of the socio-economic evaluation that Impro uses to help their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria vive en anticretico con su esposo e hijos en la calle José Saravia de la ciudad de de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Maria tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de juegos pirotécnicos (son fuegos artificiales usados para diferentes eventos sociales).

Maria trabaja con muy poco capital por lo cual vino a Impro para solicitar un crédito y así aumentar su capital y poder surtir con mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y no perderlos ya que ella con este ingreso mantiene a su familia

No tiene antecedente histórico con Impro pero su deseo de superación la califica como el tipo de cliente que se esta esforzando por mejorar su nivel de vida y esto es parte de la evaluación socio-económica que IMPRO usa para ayudar a nuestros clientes.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products and build capital

payments.comment: Early pay off.  Maria is going to apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva lives in an anticretico rental property with her husband and children on Avenida Buenos Aires in the San Martin zone of the city of La Paz. She is 51 years old, and since a young age has worked in the production of specialty sweets for sahumerios. (Sahumerio is a traditional ceremony passed down by Eva's ancestors, the Incas, where one sets a small bonfire to honor Mother Nature and to ask her blessings.) Eva works with the chifleras (people who sell products to honor la Pachamama [Mother Earth]). Eva does not work alone. Her sister-in-law helps with the production of the sweets and recieves a salary for her work, which shows that Eva's business generates employment.

Eva asks for a loan to increase her merchandise, and also to be able to work in a more comfortable environment with suitable tools.

Eva's past history with Impro qualifies her as a very good client. This will be her third loan, and the previous two were paid off entirely, consequently allowing her access to new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva vive en anticretico con su esposo e hijos en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 51 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedico a la elaboración de dulces especiales para sahumerios (sahumerio es un acto tradicional que viene de nuestros antepasados los Incas y que consiste en prender una pequeña fogata para honrar a la Madre Tierra y pedirle sus bendiciones). Ella trabaja con las chifleras que son personas que venden productos para sahumar a la Pachamama (madre de la tierra). Este trabajo no lo realiza ella sola; su cuñada (hermana de su esposo) le ayuda en la elaboración de los dulces y recibe un salario por dicha ayuda, lo cual indica que Eva genera empleo en su negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería y también poder hacerlo en un ambiente más cómodo con herramientas adecuadas

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente; este será el tercer crédito que solicita y los dos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad y consiguientemente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and build capital

payments.comment:
Early payoff.
Eva is applying for a new loan today

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Ms Marisa lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and child on Avenida Buenos Aires in the Las Lomas zone. Ms Marisa sells clothes. To attract customers she travels to Desaguadero (on the Peruvian border) and returns with athletic wear, sweaters, pants, etc., displaying them on the Tumusla street, which is a market during the mornings.

Ms Marisa asks for a loan to further increase her capital, and to later establish a fixed selling place. Right now, she only sells from to door-to-door.

This is Marisa's third solicited loan with Impro. Her past history shows that she has paid off her previous loans completely, and this certifies her as a very good client and one who has access to new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Marisa vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposo y su niño en la av. Buenos Aires de la zona de las lomas; su actividad es la venta de ropa. Para tal efecto ella realiza viajes a Desaguadero (punto fronterizo con el Perú) y trae ropa deportiva, chompas, pantalones, etc. y va acomodando en la calle Tumusla que es un lugar de venta por las mañanas.

El crédito que solicita es para seguir aumentando su capital y luego poner un puesto de venta fijo ya que ahora solamente ambula por la calle.

Este es el tercer crédito que solicita con IMPRO. Su antecedente histórico muestra que los créditos anteriores han sido pagados completamente y esto la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To increase capital

payments.comment: Early pay off.  Marissa will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Ms Lucia A. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz with her husband, Mr Juan Calle, and her two children, 18 and 14 years of age. Ms Lucia A. worked as a housekeeper. However, her age impeded her from making the necessary effort required of her. Now she weaves rugs for a local, small company. Her husband is an independent construction worker, performing various renovations in the city.

With the previous two loans, they built a concrete flagstone over a room, and the present loan's objective would be to build a room for their children on this flagstone.

Ms Lucia A.'s past history with Impro certifies her as a preferencial client with access to new credit. The previous two loans are paid for completely.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposo, el señor Juan Calle y sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años. La sra. Lucia A. trabajaba como lavandera en casas particulares, pero su edad ya no le permite realizar el esfuerzo que ese trabajo requiere, por lo que ahora realiza el tejido de alfombras para una microempresa de la zona; su esposo es trabajador independiente en la construcción realizando refacciones varias en nuestra ciudad.

Con los dos anteriores créditos realizados en nuestra institución, construyeron una losa de hormigón armado sobre una habitación y el objetivo del presente crédito es para construir una habitación para sus hijos sobre dicha losa.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, los califican como clientes preferenciales y pueden acceder un nuevo crédito. Los dos créditos anteriores están completamente pagados.

loans.use: Construction of children's room

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old. He is a graduate of Information Technology. He is a young entrepreneur who wants to offer quality catering services to people who work in offices. He started this business in Mbale town, Eastern Uganda.

His business involves offering catering services to people who don’t want to waste working hours going out to look for food. There are no such catering services in Mbale. The business is viable and he is the first to come up with such an idea in Mbale town, where there is a ready market. He plans to supply food to commercial banks in Mbale, Post Office staff and non-government organizations. He expects to make sales of $30 per day.

He wants a loan of US $700 to buy utensils to be used in his business. He plans to create employment opportunities for four people.

loans.use: To buy catering utensils

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 30 years old with two children.The first born is 6 years old and in Pre-Primary and the second born is 2 years old. He graduated with a diploma in electronical mechanics from Kyambogo University.

When he graduated he started a workshop that repairs radios, televisions, DVDs and video decks. He hired a cheap kiosk in Wandegeya, which is a Kampala suburb.The government of Uganda is preparing to host the Commonwealth Heads of State (CHOGM) in November, which has made the government clean the city. It came up with a plan of demolishing all the illegal structures in Kampala City.

Benson wants a loan to rent a better place to re-locate his business. He also want to renovate it so that he offers mechanical services but also sells new and reconditioned radios, televisions, DVDs and video decks.

He wants a loan of US $ 1200 to pay for rent in the new location which he plans to pay back in 6 months.

loans.use: To rent  new premises for expansion

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 49 years old and married with 6 children. Thirteen years ago she and her husband opened a grocery store, which provided the necessary income to maintain the family and pay off their children's studies. In order to increase their income, Blanca's husband purchased two carts to facilitate door-to-door sales. He used one to sell fruits in the morning and the other to sell ice cream during the afternoons.

With great sacrifice, they realized that their everyday sales resulted in a very good income. Now they desire to increase their stock through Ms Blanca's decision to ask for a loan of 800 dollars to purchase a greater variety of canned goods, dairy products, flour, olive oil, and vegetables. These will help her meet demands since she is the only grocer in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca tiene 49 años, está casada y tiene 6 hijos. Hace 13 años abrió junto con su marido una despensa que les provee del ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y solventar los estudios D. sus hijos. Para poder aumentar sus ingresos su marido compro dos carritos para realizar ventas D. forma ambulante, uno lo utiliza para vender frutas por las mañanas y por las tarD. utiliza otro carrito para salir a vender helados.

Con bastante sacrificio ellos realizan sus ventas todos los días y esto les acarrea buenos ingresos. Hoy día desean aumentar su stock D. mercaderías para el almacén, por lo que Doña Blanca ha decidido solicitar un crédito D. $ 800 que los destinará para compra al por mayor D. productos enlatados, lácteos, harina, aceite y verduras; con esto ella podrá abastecer su demanda pues es el único almacén en la zona.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, dairy products, flour, olive oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Since 1997 Mr Julian has owned a carwash in a well-known service station in the city. He starts work every day at 7am, assisting 2 others who work at his carwash. Throughout the day Mr Julian's business recieves many vehicles seeking his excellent work. Over time, he has aquired many clients, largely consisting of companies who send their full supply of vehicles to Mr Julian's carwash.

Several months ago Mr Julian's daughter was taken in for an emergency surgery, forcing Mr Julian to use some savings that were set aside for the purchase of an industrial vacuum. He owns only one, and this particular one cannot keep up with all the work. For this reason Mr Julian asks for a loan of 100 dollars to purchase a new industrial vacuum which will help him to speed up his work and keep up with his clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde 1997 Don Julián es dueño de un lavadero para autos que alquila en una conocida estación de servicios de la ciudad. Todos los días empieza su labor a las 7 de la mañana ayudado de 2 personales que trabajan también en su lavadero; en el transcurso del día reciben muchos vehículos que solicitan de su excelente labor. Con el tiempo han adquirido muchos clientes, en su mayoría empresas que envían su flota de vehículos para que Don Julián los lave.

Hace unos meses su hija menor tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente de urgencia, lo que lo obligo a utilizar unos ahorros que estaban destinados para la compra de una aspiradora industrial, pues él posee solo una y la que tiene no da abasto para todo el trabajo. Es por eso que Don Julián hoy solicita un crédito de $ 100 con lo que comprara una nueva aspiradora industrial que lo ayudara a agilizar su trabajo y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial vacuum

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.es:
Ladislaa is a woman with a strong entrepeneurial spirit. She is divorced, solely raising her child, who will be attending his second year of Veterinary school. At 47 years of age she works out of her small workshop where she performs all types of sewing and prepares garments for sale. Her excellent skill has brought on greater demand, which has led to a notable increase in work. Nowadays she works on larger quantities for companies and schools. With her sister's help, they manage to meet specific solicitations for jackets, uniforms, and athletic wear.

Since it is winter, people have solicited Ladislaa for jackets, and Ladislaa in turn asks for a loan to aquire fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons in great quantities so that she can begin working. She asks for a loan of 200 dollars, which she pledges to pay off on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Ladislaa es una mujer con un fuerte espíritu emprendedor. Ella es una mujer separada que crio sola a su hijo, que ya va al segundo año de la carrera de Veterinaria. Con sus 47 años de edad ella enfrenta la vida en su pequeño taller en donde realiza todo tipo de costuras y prendas para la venta. Gracias a su excelente labor, la demanda de su trabajo ha ido incrementandose notablemente. Hoy día ella realiza trabajos en grandes cantidades para empresas y colegios, ayudada de su hermana, reciben pedidos de camperas, uniformes y buzos (ropa deportiva para colegios).

Como estamos en invierno, ella ha recibo pedidos de camperas y solicita un crédito para adquirir telas, hilos, cierres y botones en grandes cantidades para poder empezar su labor, ella solicita $ 200 que se compromete a devolverlos puntualmente.

loans.use: To purchase zippers, buttons, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 43 years old, and at 18 years of age he started working at his uncle's upholstery business as his uncle's assistant. After several years of apprenticeship, Miguel began perfecting his skill and saving money to be able to open his own business.
