Today, Miguel, along with his brother, owns one of the most renowned upholstery businesses in his city. He has all types of upholstery for cars, chairs, armchairs, and couches.

Several months ago Miguel decided to participate in a bidding by a public firm dedicated to the construction of economy housing for those with limited resources. Miguel won the bid to make 100 chair, armchair, and couch upholsteries. In order to follow through on this work, Miguel needs to purchase fabric, foam, glue, and staples in large quantities. So that he may begin this project, Miguel asks for a loan of 500 dollars to aquire these necessary elements.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 43 años y empezó a los 18 años en el rubro de la tapicería, trabajando como ayudante de su tío en su negocio. Tras varios años de aprendizaje fue perfeccionándose y ahorrando dinero para poder independizarse y abrir su propio negocio.

Hoy día Miguel es dueño junto con su hermano de una de las tapicerías más renombradas de su ciudad, realiza todo tipo de tapizados para vehículos, sillas, sillones y sofá.

Hace unos meses él decidió participar a un llamado de licitación de una empresa pública que se dedica a la construcción de viviendas económicas para gente de escasos recursos; Miguel ganó la licitación para realizar 100 tapizados de sillas, sillones y sofá por lo que para poder cumplir con el trabajo requerido necesita comprar telas, espuma, pegamento y grapas en grandes cantidades. Miguel solicita un crédito de $ 500 para poder adquirir los elementos que necesita para poder empezar su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, foam, and glue in large quantity

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto Diaz is 33 years old. He attended school up until the third year of his secondary education (high school). The terrible economic situation forced him to abandon his village and to move to the ciy in search of work to help him sustain his family.

He started working in a shoe store, and within some time started saving. Several years later, Roberto was able to open his own shoe store and establish a great clientele. Roberto enjoys his shoe store business. However, beyond his dedication to the shoe store and in the hope of increasing his income, Roberto decided to work in a tire shop. His business is situated on one of the country's principal routes. There are no other tire shops in this area.

Today, Roberto envisions expanding his business, selling new and used tires. He asks for a loan to purchase new and used tires for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Roberto D. es un hombre joven de tan solo 33 años; curso sus estudios hasta el tercer año de la secundaria, luego la mala situación económica lo obligo a abandonar su pueblo y mudarse a la ciudad para buscar un trabajo que le ayude a su familia con el sustento.

Empezó trabajando en una zapatería y de a poco fue ahorrando; varios años después Roberto pudo independizarse y montar su propia zapatería donde tiene muy buena clientela. A Roberto le va bien con su zapatería, pero además de dedicarse a la zapatería y en miras de aumentar sus ingresos, Roberto, decidió hacer también trabajos de gomería, ya que su negocio está situado sobre una de las rutas principales del país y en la zona no existen otras gomerías.

Hoy Roberto tiene deseos de seguir expandiendo su negocio y vender cubiertas nuevas y usadas en su negocio para lo que solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de cubiertas nuevas y usadas para venderlas.

loans.use: To purchase new and used tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise, such as clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. was born in Guayaquil, Ecuador. This 40-year-old single mother of three opened her restaurant 10 years ago. Her clients are all regulars from her neighborhood, and they all enjoy the tasty food she offers day-in and day-out. Gloria works from 6am serving breakfast to the morning crowd until 4 pm when she serves lunch.

Gloria was able to use a previous loan from Mifex in order to buy a new refrigerator with a glass door for her business. This improved the appearance of her restaurant and also allowed her to increase the sale of beverages. She hopes to receive a second loan in order to buy more food to prepare for her clients. She also plans on supporting two of her daughters who want to begin making and selling jewelry.

loans.use: Buy more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mrs Man S. is 21 and lives in Prey Veng in Cambodia. She sells vegetables and herbs at a market. She earns 15 dollars a day. Her husband is a farmer and a taxi driver. They do not have children. 
Mrs Man S. would like to purchase a car in order to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to do the same.

loans.use: To purchase a car to expand her business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Man Sokna for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio has worked for 2 years in computer scanning, printing, and design production. He started this job after gaining experience working in a cybercafe. He also studies graphic design at the university, which has helped him gain a great understanding of this subject. He works everyday and does not have a fixed schedule.

Julio asks for loan to purchase a scanner and reams of paper for larger quantity printing since there is a great demand from his university colleagues, also allowing him to attend to all his clients.

Julio is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his parents, helping with the some of the household expenses. Since a very young age, he started working and helping around the house. He is studying at the university, but he also contributes to the betterment of his family's life through the income generated at his business. He counts on his older brother's and parent's support. He hopes that with the loan his business can grow and improve his income, allowing him and his family a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio lleva 2 años dedicado a la realización de trabajos en computación como escaneo, digitación, impresiones y elaboración de diseños. El inicio esta actividad porque trabajó en un cyber café y allí adquirió más experiencia sobre el negocio. El además estudia en la universidad diseño gráfico lo que le ha permitido tener mayor conocimiento en esta área. El no tiene un horario fijo para su trabajo ya que lo realizada todos los días.

Julio desea su crédito para comprar un scanner y resmas de hojas para realizar mayor impresiones ya que tiene gran demanda de trabajos que realizar sobre todo de su compañeros de la universidad, lo que le permitirá atender a todos sus clientes.

Julio tiene 23 años, es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres, el ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar. Desde muy adolescente empezó a trabajar y ayudar con lo necesario en su hogar. El esta estudiando en la Universidad hasta el medio día y con el ingreso que le genera su negocio también esta ayudando a mejorar la vivienda de sus padres. El cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano mayor y la de sus padres. El desea con nuestro crédito hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta manera ir mejorando sus ingresos que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para el y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a scanner and paper for a popular scanning and printing business

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mrs Choun S. is 35 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a teacher and earns a dollar per day. Her husband is a construction foreman and he recruits workers to help him in his work and earns five dollars a day.  They have 2 children. They are requesting a loan to pay wages of their workers.

loans.use: To pay wages of workers

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chuon Sophar has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Mrs Pin S. is 33. She lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She has one child. Her husband works in a garment factory and earns five dollars a day.  They need money to purchase cement and bricks to repair their house.

loans.use: To repair home

payments.comment: Congratulations to Pin Sokim for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Dal Jan

texts.en:
Dal Jan lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all of the members of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to help her family because her husband is jobless, and her son is in university. She is the only one who supports her family. 
She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines. She wants to expand her business and make a good monthly income to solve all her problems. She is happy.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Mr Lucas started his supply business in his own house some nine years ago. Due to familial difficulties over the course of six years, his shop deteriorated. He was able to find a new location where he aquired property and built a new house and a new shop. Right now, his business prospers due to this strategic and centralized location.

Mr Lucas asks for a loan to purchase more merchandise for his clients living on the outskirts of the city who regularly stop in his shop on their travels to and from the city in search of work. He believes that with more merchandise his profits will increase and his business will prosper.

Mr Lucas is 49 years old and has one child who is in school. His wife helps him with the business. His house is made of cement, and he is certain that with the business' prosperity he will be able to provide the stability for which his family has been looking.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Lucas empezó su negocio de venta de víveres en su propia casa hace unos nueve años pero después de seis por dificultades familiares su tienda decayó ahora el encontró un nuevo sector donde pudo adquirir un terreno y hacer una casa y de nuevo implanto su tienda en ese sector. Actualmente su negocio ha prosperado mucho por que esta ubicado en un sitio estratégico y céntrico.

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería ya que ahora los clientes de pueblos aledaños salen en busca de trabajo a la ciudad y necesariamente pasan por su despensa y así llevan su producto. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero

El Sr. Lucas tiene 49 años de edad y tiene un hijo que estudia, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio su casa de cemento y Él tiene certeza de que con la prosperidad de su negocio va a poder darle a su familia la estabilidad que tanto ha buscado

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Mr Fredy sells household goods by means of payment installments or loans. He started this business with some savings from his previous job. Right now, his wife helps him with the business since many of these goods are delivered to people living in the Ecuadorian Sierra and he is constantly traveling.

He asks for a loan to purchase more goods and, thus, be able to attend to more customers. He has considered creating a small shop in his house so that his wife can also sell the products from home.

Mr Fredy is 35 years old with 4 children, three of which are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Fredy se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar que los entrega de contado o a crédito. El comenzó su negocio con unos ahorros de su antiguo trabajo. Actualmente su esposa le ayuda en el negocio por que el entrega estos artículos en la Sierra de Ecuador por lo que viaja constantemente

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas artículos y así poder atender a mas clientes que han solicitado dichos artículos. Además el tiene pensado poner un pequeño local en su casa para que su esposa también venda los productos desde su casa

El Sr. Fredy tiene 35 años y 4 hijos de los cuales estudian tres su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Mr Tito works in the manufacture and sale of bricks. He started this business three years ago when, after getting married, his mother-in-law motivated him to start a business. She had a very good understanding of work. Right now, they manufacture many bricks, which they deliver to construction warehouses on the outskirts of the city.

He asks for a loan to purchase more quality material, like sawdust and firewood, to burn the blocks of clay. Mr Tito is convinced that with the increase in production his business will produce greater profits and, thus, prosper.

Mr Tito is 31 years old with 2 children. He hopes his business prospers so that he can secure an education for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Tito se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos de. Dicho negocio lo comenzó hace tres años cuando se caso y su suegra le motivo a que comenzara el negocio pues ella tenia bastante conocimiento del trabajo. Actualmente ellos fabrican muchos ladrillos que entregan a depósitos vendedores de materiales de construcción los alrededores de la ciudad.

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas materia prima como aserrín y leña que sirve para quemar los bloques de barro. Además el esta convencido que con el aumento de producción de su negocio sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero.

Don Tito tiene 31 años y dos hijos que aun no estudian su casa es de caña u tiene estabilidad familias. El aspira que su negocio progrese para asi asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: To purchase quality material to produce bricks

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Ms Rosalia lives near a brick factory. She started her business with the help of her sister and father, who learned from their predecessors. Right now, Rosalia helps her children, who also work in the brick business.

She asks for a loan to purchase high-quality material necessary for the production of bricks. She hopes to store these until the winter when the rain season begins and makes it difficult for production. She also hopes to attract more customers by improving her business' advertisements.

Ms Rosalia is 50 years old and has 4 children, two of which are in school. With the advancement of her business, Rosalia hopes that in the near future she can finish the construction of her cement house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosalía tiene cerca de su casa una fábrica de ladrillos. Ella comenzó el negocio con la ayuda de su hermana y papa que aprendieron el trabajo de sus antepasados quienes se dedicaban a este negocio desde siempre. Actualmente a Rosalía le ayudan sus hijas quienes también hacen ladrillos

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas materia prima pues necesita hacer ladrillos para tener guardado para el invierno que por las lluvias le resulta difícil hacer además espera poder mejorar los anuncios que tiene y así llamar mas clientes

La Sra. Rosalía tiene 50 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian, su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar. Ella aspira que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podrá en un futuro cercano terminar su casa que esta empezando a construir de cemento

loans.use: To purchase high-quality material for the production of bricks

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer started her business 5 years ago with the little capital she obtained from her previous job. Every day she attends to each customer personally, working from 6am-10pm. Her management experience and the quality of products she offers to her customers helps her maintain her business. She sells supplies, pharmaceutical products, and faux jewelry.

Jennifer asks for a loan to invest in the aquisition of new and various products and to finish renovating her shop so that she can better display the products and, thus, improve her services and public attention.

Jennifer is 30 years old and single. Since a young age she worked various jobs and obtained a lot of experience. She had to close her first business, an eatery, because it was a rental establishment. This motivated her, along with her parents, to start a supply store, selling medicines and jewelry, too. The business occupies part of the house, which is under construction. Her goal is to improve her business and profits to continue the construction of her house and to be an example for her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Jennifer inicio su negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener en base a las ventas de su anterior trabajo. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm. Su negocio se mantiene gracias a la experiencia obtenida en el manejo y calidad de productos que Jennifer ofrece a sus clientes. Ella vende viveres, productos farmacéuticos y bisuteria.

Jennifer necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos y variados productos así como también terminar de adecuar su local para poder exhibir de mejor manera los productos que ofrece a su clientela mejorando de esta manera el servicio y atención al publico.

Jennifer tiene 30 años es soltera no tiene hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar siendo empleada en distintos lugares donde adquirió experiencia. Siendo su primer negocio un comedor el cual tuvo que cerrar por que el local era de alquiler. Razón que la motivo para que junto a sus padres decidiera iniciar su propio negocio de venta de víveres, medicinas y bisutería. Ocupando parte de su casa. Su vivienda esta en construcción. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir ayudando en su hogar y ser ejemplo para sus hermanos.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Mrs. Veng D. is 37 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has five children and makes her living by selling porridge to the people in her neighbourhood and she earns five dollars a day doing this. Her husband works in a small private company and earns up to  three dollars per day. Currently, Veng D. needs a motor-bike for her husband, so that he will no longer spend much money on his public transportion each day.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of five hundred dollars.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her husband, so that he will no longer spend much on his earnings on public transport each day.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Veng Dany start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N. is 42 years old widow and lives with her daughter in  Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a landlord and can typically earn around three dollars per day from her different rooms. Due to an increased demand from her tenants, Em N. is recently asking for a loan to build more rooms. She is therefore requesting a loan.

loans.use: To build more rooms to earn rental income

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Mrs. Em Nareth has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap, KIVA partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin was married in 1969 and has 2 children, 1 son and 1 daughter. He started a romork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) transportation business more than 22 years ago. His wife, Mrs. Am Morn, sells groceries at home. Their 2 children are working in a hotel in Phnom Penh. 
The couple is asking for a loan of US$600 from MAXIMA in order to repair their house and purchase more grocery items for sale. Their business is able to make enough money to support the family - therefore, they will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: House repair and purchase of more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov has been married since 1988 and has 6 children - 4 sons and 2 daughters. She started  a firewood-selling business in 2005. Her husband, on the other hand, is in the business of transporting merchandise for villagers and sometimes makes contracts for construction in the village. Their children are still studying in the local school.  
Pov has borrowed from MAXIMA twice in the past and is currently asking for a loan of US$1,000. She will use this loan to buy a motorbike and to purchase firewood for wholesale and retail in the village. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and of firewood for wholesale and retail

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Pov El has paid off her loan early before contract and now she is requesting another loan forcontinue her business.

Thank you.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. She has two children, and both of them are in school. She is a very active women. She has an office. She works with her husband in the office. This is her first loan from AL-Aman. She wants to borrow $1200 to purchase a new computer and printer. She wants to keep working with her husband and enhance her family's standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new computer and scanner

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya was married in 1976 and has 4 children, 1 son and 3 daughters. She has been making her living by weaving silk since 1979, which she learned from her neighbor. Ya's husband is a fisherman and a farmer. Her 2 daughters also weave silk products at home.   
She is asking for a loan of US$150 from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread and to set up one more loom for her daughter, so that she can weave silk after school. Ya will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of silk material and sewing thread and setting up of an additional  loom

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Ya Phang has pay off her loan early before contract. Now she asked new loan for expanding her farming business.

Thank you so much.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch T. is a widow with one child. She is 47 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To make a living condition, Uch T. rents the different rooms of her house to the garment workers in her area, from which she earns five dollar a day. Recently, Uch T. has faced an increased demand for rooms and therefore is requesting a loan of five hundred dollars to build more.

loans.use: To build more rooms to earn more rental income

payments.comment: Congratulations to Uch Tha for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy is a widow and has  6 daughters. She never obtained formal schooling and has been growing flowers for more than 25 years. She is currently not only planting flowers herself, but also contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers. One of her daughters, Miss. Hun Sopheap, is assisting her in selling flowers. 
Mrs. Phy has borrowed loans from MAXIMA before, and is now asking for a loan of US$600. The loan will be used for contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers and for purchasing a motorbike. Mrs. Phy will be capable of repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Contracting flower and longan farms from other farmers and purchase of a motorbike

payments.comment:
Dear lender,
 Mrs. Phy Chheun has enough money to pay off her loan before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Mr. Sear has been married since 1984 and has 2 sons and a daughter. He has been in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) for more than 10 years. He drives workers from the village to the garment factory site. His wife makes cloths at home for sale in the local market. Neither Sear not his wife have  finished primary school. They are working very hard in order to support their children's education. Also one of their children is currently working at the garment factory. The other 2 children are studying.  
Mr. Sear needs to borrow US$500 from MAXIMA to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi. With his business, he can generate sufficient income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor taxi carriage

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mr. Samon has been married since 1994 and has 3 children - a son and 2 daughters. He is a teacher in a state and a private high-school in his community. He has been a teacher for more than 20 years. Mr. Samon's wife, Mrs. BAN Sok Chamroeurn, is a farmer. She plants vegetables and raises pigs, and has been in this business for more than 10 years. So far, the couple has been able to afford education for all of their children. 
Mr. Samon is asking for a loan of US$500 from MAXIMA to purchase more piglets for raising and to repair the shed for pigs. Based on the income of the family, the couple will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of more piglets for raising and repair of the shed for pigs

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Samon Nhem has enough money to pay off his loan. Thank you very much.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. He has a small bakery in Kirkuk. He is working hard to earn more money for his family. He has a big family, and his father and mother live with him. This is his first loan from AL-Aman, and he wants to use it to purchase a new oven for his bakery.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new oven for the bakery

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Soeurn has been married since 1992 and has 6 children - a son and 5 daughters. He works as a motorbike-repairer, and has been in this business for more than 20 years. Mr. Soeurn owns a small motorbike-repair shop, while his wife does farming in the village. Mr. Soeurn has obtained primary education. His 3 daughters are currently garment factory workers, since the couple can afford to send only 3 of their 6 children to school. 
Mr. Soeurn is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike and materials for motorbike repair. The family can generate enough income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and motorbike-repairing materials

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mr. Von has been married since 2000 and has 2 children - a son and a daughter. He is a motorbike-repairer and has been in this business for about 3 years. Mr. Von owns a small motorbike-repair shop. His wife currently works in a garment factory. 
He is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase motorbike-repairing materials and to repair his house. With the income from Mr. Von's motorbike-repairing business and with his wife's salary, the couple will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike-repairing materials and repair of a house

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Von Tak has enough money to pay off his loan. Thank you.

loans.name: Houk

texts.en:
Mrs Houk T. is 46 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns two dollars a day. Her husband earns two dollars a day from guarding a temple. They have five children. Three of them are still students. 
They need money to repair their house which leaks during the rainy season.  She is therefore requesting a loan of six hundred dollars.

loans.use: To repair her house

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Houk Thar and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mr. Sochea has been married since 1979, and has 2 sons and a daughter. He has been in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) for more than 15 years. He drives workers from the village to a garment factory site. His wife raises pigs and cows. Neither Mr. Sochea nor his wife have finished primary school, and all of their children are currently working at the garment factory.  
Mr. Sochea needs to borrow US$500 from MAXIMA to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi and to buy a cow. With his remork and his wife's animal-raising business, Mr. Sochea will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor-taxi carriage and a baby cow

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Sochea Touch has enough money to pay off his loan early.

Thank you.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: Mrs. Uy K. is 38 years old, a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a small booth at home selling groceries to the people in her neighbourhood and makes an average five dollars a day. Her husband works at the local airport and earns about four dollars a day in revenue. Uy K. needs the loan to purchase more inventory to expand her business and more fully meet her clients’ needs.  She will use the leftover from the loan to fix her house which leaks during the rainy season. She and her family greatly appreciate your support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her business.  Also, to repair her home.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Uy Kan start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nghoy

texts.en:
Mrs Nghoy S. is 24 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She sells beef soup in her area. Her husband is a construction foreman. They earn nine dollars a day. They have one young child.  
Mrs Nghoy would like to purchase a motorcycle in order to transport the ingredients of the soup she makes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport ingredients.

loans.name: Plek

texts.en: Mrs Plek N. is 44 and lives in Siem Reap. Her husband is a carver and earns 2.5 dollars a day. They have 8 children. Six of them are still students. Mrs Plek N. wants to purchase a motorcycle for her husband because his work is very far from their house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband whose work is very far from their home

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Plek Neav start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mrs Mit S. is 39 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman. He earns four dollars a day. They have four children who are still students. 
Mrs Mit S. wants to purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works very far from their home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works far from their home

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Mit Samoun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Boung

texts.en:
Mrs Boung P. is 21 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman and earns fivedollars a day. They have three children who are still students. 
Mrs Boung P. wants to expand her husband's business. She is requesting a loan to buy a small boat and some fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat and fishing nets.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Boung Phov start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs Chea T. is 43 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She sells fish and her husband (who appears in this photo) works in an organization. They earn 15 dollars a day. They have four children who are still students.

Mrs Chea T. would like to buy a motorbike to transport the fish she sells.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport the food she sells

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: Tojiniso has been selling different kinds of fabric for ten years. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is her business partner, and he is responsible for trips to the wholesale market. Their little shop is located in the big central Panjshanbe market. They sell different kinds of cotton fabrics. The turnover of their business is fast. They have one seller. In the future Tojiniso and her husband plan to rent two places for trade from Avganbazaar, which located in the district of Khujand. Additionally they want to employ two sellers for those trade places.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 37-year-old single mother of five children, Melanie (17), Elmuruiz (15), Jennifer (12), Almando (10), and Camillo (7). She currently does not own a store of her own, but sells frozen fresh squeezed juices and small baked goods out of a cooler that she carries around with her. With this money she is hoping to buy a new juicer, a bigger cooler, and then the fresh fruit and other materials to make the food she sells. She would eventually like to be able to have her own store and be able to sell more, since she is her children's sole provider.

Note: Paula is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and each will be accountable to the others for repaying their share of this loan. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and materials

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala lives in her own home with her husband and two children, on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. She is 46 years old, and she sells fruit. Because she does not earn enough to live on from the fruit sales alone, she set up a small grocery store in her home in November of 2006 with the help of a loan granted by IMPRO. She was given a second loan in March of this year, and was able to expand her store a bit, adding a larger variety of products. The loan that she is requesting now is to expand her store even more, since the demand for her products has increased so much that she needs more working capital. With this new growth in her business, she believes that she can earn a better income and stop traveling to buy fruit – something that she sees as dangerous. Her history with IMPRO shows her to be a good client, and could give her

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Pascuala vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; ella tiene 46 años de edad, su actividad es la venta de fruta, pero como el ingreso no es suficiente para su subsistencia, ella instalo en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en Noviembre de 2006 con la ayuda de un crédito concedido por IMPRO. En Marzo del presente año se le concedió un segundo crédito y ahora la tienda es un poco más grande, con mayor variedad de productos. El crédito que ahora solicita es para ampliar mucho mas la tienda pues la demanda por sus productos ha crecido de tal manera que necesita más capital de trabajo. Con esta ampliación de su negocio ella estima que podrá tener mejores ingresos y ya no viajar para traer fruta ya que esto le parece peligroso. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder un

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eustacia

texts.en:
Eustacia is a 39-year-old single mother of three daughters and one son. She currently has a small structure from which she cooks and sells all different types of fried foods, including chicken, beef, dumplings, etc. However, she really wants to be able to buy supplies in order to fix up her shop. She would like to be able to have a concrete floor, a new roof, a new lamp to allow her to see better once the sun goes down, and a new burner because her current one has a small leak and is not very reliable. Eustacia has a strong desire to improve the quality of life for her children and herself and is highly motivated to expand her business in order to do this.

Note: Eustacia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $850 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to the others for repaying their share of this loan. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To buy equipment to fix up her shop

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Mr Arauz is married, and is the father of two children who are studing at the university. He is an artist who works creating large cement statuary, which he sells in various stores in Managua. His products have been received very well by his clientel. He is asking for this loan to purchase materials, including cement, sand, lime, files, and new tools such as chisels, hammers, and other products that will allow him to fill his clients’ orders. He believes that this loan will allow him to increase sales in improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. A. es casado y padre de dos hijos que están cursando la universidad, es un artista que trabaja elaborando grandes estatuas de cemento, las cuales vende en diferentes empresas de Managua, sus obras cuentan con mucha aceptación por parte de sus clientes. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mteriales como cemento, arena, cal, lijas y nuevas herramientas como cincel, martillo y otros productos que le permitan cumplir con los encargos de los clientes. Piensa que el crédito le permitirá incremetar sus ventas y por ende mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: He will use this loan to purchase material used to create his sculptures.

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Arauz was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo F. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs. Rosa Alvarez and he son. Mr F. works as a driver for a taxi company in our city, and he wife sells produce in the market in their neighborhood. He is requesting this loan to remodel their bathroom, which has unfinished interior walls and lacks a sink and shower, and to upgrade the cement and molding of the patio of their home. These improvements are important for the family’s health, and they qualify for line of credit for housing and improvement of living conditions. This is the first time that Mr. F. has requested credit through IMPRO, and a socioeconomic study has found him qualified to meet this credit obligation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Pablo Fernández vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, la sra. Rosa Álvarez y su hijo. El sr. Pablo Fernández trabaja como chofer empleado de una empresa de taxis de nuestra ciudad y su esposa se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado de su zona. El crédito que solicita es para la refacción del baño que en la actualidad no cuenta con lavamanos, ducha ni revoque interior, más el vaciado de cemento y acondicionamiento del patio en su vivienda. Estas mejoras son importantes para la salud de la familia y caen bajo nuestra línea de crédito de vivienda y mejoramiento del habitat. Esta es la primera ocasión que el sr. Pablo Fernández solicita un crédito en impro y el estudio socioeconómico lo califica para poder acceder y honrar su obligación crediticia.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in tools for his business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina C. S. owns a bustling general store in Fao where she sells commodities including bread, cheese, eggs, lollipops, flip-flops, combs, hair ties, nail files, and diapers. Paulina will use this loan to expand her offerings by stocking new essential items such as rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, and sugar. The growth of Paulina's store will help her support her three children: Adelinas (13), Marinalde (11), and Miguelangel (6). Adelinas wants to work as a secretary when she's older; her more capricious sister Marinalde wants to be a model. For now, Miguelangel is content to be six years old. He spends most of his time tooling around Fao on his bicycle.

Note: Paulina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Paulina pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Blanca Verónica

texts.es:
Blanca is a young mother who is very concerned with giving the best to her family. She is married and her children are 2 and 7 years old respectively. Her husband doesn't make very much money as a worker; in order to help him pay the bills Blanca began to sell jewelry. A little later she also began to sell shoes, a business in which she has managed to gain more customers and thus make more money. This is thanks to her enthusiasm and her friendly personality.

In order to cover the orders that have been place, she is currently seeking a loan of $200. She will use it to buy merchandise; she's committed to repaying the loan within 3 months. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Blanca and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una madre joven que se preocupa por darle lo mejor a su familia, ella es casada y sus hijos tienen 2 y 7 años de edad, su esposo gana muy poco en su trabajo como almacenista y para ayudarlo con los gastos Blanca inició con las ventas de joyería poco después incorporó la venta de calzado, donde ha conseguido mejores ganancias, gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con las persona, ha incrementado su número de clientes y sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y decídete a mejorar la vida de Blanca y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are married and one of whom, a 17-year-old, still lives with her. For the past 20 years, Rebeca has been selling toys, clothes and dietary supplements she bought in the United States. Since her husband was injured in an accident, she has had to be in charge of providing for her family. To do so she has specialized in clothing sales. Fortunately, she's been able to increase her sales and is now assisted by her daughter, three employees, and four people who help her on the weekends and holidays.

At the moment, Rebeca is requesting a loan of $1200, which she will use to purchase merchandise, with which she hopes to meet the needs of her current customers and to continue to grow. She is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Rebeca is very thankful for your support and the opportunity that it provides her to keep expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rebeca es una persona trabajadora y entusiasta, ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro ya están casados y su hija más pequeña, de 17 años de edad, aún vive con ella. Desde hace 20 años Rebeca se dedica a las ventas de juguetes, ropa y suplementos alimenticios que compraba en Estados Unidos, a raíz de que su esposo sufrió un accidente ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de todos los gastos del hogar y especializó sus ventas en ropa, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para atender su negocio, además de tres empleados y cuatro personas que le ayudan los fines de semana y en fechas especiales cuando sus ventas son mayores.

En estos momentos Rebeca solicita un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con la que espera poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Rebeca agradece mucho tu apoyo la oportunidad que le brindas de continuar creciendo como microempresaria.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is from Rocheachi, Chihuahua. He is married and has three children. For the past six years, he has been making and selling "pinole," a corn-based beverage. He learned this trade from his ancestors. Fortunately, he has been able to make his business grow by distributing his product in nearby areas and in Mexico City. His closely-knit family has encouraged him to develop his business, and he relies on the help of his wife and three children, who weigh, measure and label the product.

In order to continue expanding his sales, Antonio needs to increase his production. He is asking for a loan of $475 to purchase raw materials. He is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Antonio and his family. Don't hesitate! Decide to help them. Thank you.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es originario de la localidad de Rocheachi, en Chihuahua. Es casado y tiene tres hijos, desde hace seis años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pinole, que es una bebida a base de maíz, este oficio lo aprendió de sus antepasados, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio distribuyendo su producto en varias localidades cercanas y en el Distrito Federal. La unión familiar ha sido un impulso importante para el desarrollo de este negocio, porque recibe la ayuda de su esposa y sus tres hijos, pesando, midiendo y etiquetando el producto.

Para continuar ampliando su área de ventas Antonio necesita incrementar su producción y solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares para la compra de materia prima, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Antonio y su familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is married and has six children. Only the youngest --- who are 7, 15, and 17 years old respectively --- depend economically on their parents. Alicia and her husband are from Veracruz, but they migrated to Nuevo Leon 25 years ago in search of better opportunities. Due to high unemployment, her husband began helping one of his aunts, who sold plants and toys. Thanks to the experience he obtained, he was able to start his own business later. His revenues, however, could not cover all of his family's needs. Consequently, Alicia began to sell these same products in other markets.

Right now, Alicia seeks a loan of $750. She will use this to buy merchandise, with which she hopes to increase her sales by offering her customers a wider variety of products. She offers to repay this sum in 6 months. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Alicia and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia es casada y tiene seis hijos, solo los más pequeños de 7, 15 y 17 años de edad dependen económicamente de ellos, Alicia y su esposo son originarios de Veracruz, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia se mudaron a Nuevo León desde hace 25 años, ante la falta de un empleo su esposo comenzó ayudándole a una de sus tías que se dedicaba a vender plantas y juguetes, gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo pudo iniciar su propio negocio, pero el ingreso que obtenía era insuficiente para todas las necesidades de su familia, así que Alicia también empezó a trabajar vendiendo los mismos productos en otros mercados.

En estos momentos Alicia solicita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas al ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar el bienestar de Alicia y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.es:
Cesar is married and has three daughters, who are 4 years old, 7 years old, and 7 months old respectively. Formerly, Cesar worked in an electronics factory but his salary was too low to cover household expenses. The need to increase his income motivated him to start his own grocery store three years ago. The store is located in his home.

To improve his service, Cesar requests a loan of $375, which he will use to purchase merchandise so that his store is better stocked and his customers are more satisfied. He is committed to repaying this loan in 6 moths. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Cesar and his family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar es casado y tiene tres hermosas hijas, de 4 y 7 años de edad y la más pequeña de sólo 7 meses. Anteriormente Cesar trabajaba en una empresa de electrónica pero su sueldo era muy bajo y no le alcanzaba a cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, la necesidad de obtener mejor ingreso lo motivo a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace tres años, instalándose en su propio domicilio.

Para mejorar su servicio, Cesar solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, y ayuda a Cesar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. sells fresh produce at her shop in Fao, where her vegetables like green peppers, string beans, and cabbage are sold alonside local coconuts. Maria will use her loan to expand her business model by selling charcoal as well as rice and cooking oil. All of Maria's nine children are studying either in public school or for a profession. Rafael (21), Emania (18), Yela (16), Quetrina (13), Mari (13), Chelene (11), Vitali (6), Ingrid (5), and Jose (8) live with Maria and her husband Felix. This loan will help her grow her business to support her large family. These loans help a lot, Maria says. With another microloan, her business can grow and prosper.

Note: Maria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Maria pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business model expansion

loans.name: Yleana Lucelly

texts.es:
For the past 10 years, Yleana has been selling clothing. She began her business because she needed extra income to cover the cost of sending her daughters to school. Her daughters are 11 and 19 years old respectively. She began by selling used clothing to her neighbors, but at her customers' request she began seeing new clothing as well. This caused her sales to increase considerably. Now she has managed to acquire a stand in the market, where she has further increased her number of clients.

In order to provide better service and to improve the image her business gives, Yleana is requesting a loan of $475. She will use this to buy a display case and dummies, with which she hopes to increase her sales. She offers to repay her loan in 6 months. Please help this business grow. Yleana would be very grateful for the support and the opportunity it would give her business to expand.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años, Yleana se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para cubrir los costos de la escuela de sus hijas, ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 19 años de edad. Inició vendiendo bisutería y ropa usada entre sus vecinas, pero a petición de sus clientes incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y sus ventas se mejoraron considerablemente, ahora ha logrado adquirir un puesto en el mercado, donde ha logrado ampliar su número de clientes.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y darle una mejor imagen a su negocio, Yleana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un aparador y exhibidores, con los que espera incrementen sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Yleana agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de crecer como microempresaria.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Limbert Alexander

texts.es:
Limbret Alexander is an honest and responsible man. Three years ago he had the opportunity to acquire a stand in the San Benito market in Merida, Yucatan. Thanks to this he began his own clothing sales business. He started with a small stock but by reinvesting his assets he has managed to expand his business. Currently, Limbert wants to earn money so that he can secure his family's future.

To offer more competitive prices and increase his sales, Limbert is seeking a loan of $475, which he will use to purchase clothing wholesale. He is committed to paying back this loan in 3 months. Become part of Limbert's achievements and contribute to the development of his business. He would sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Limbret Alexander es un hombre honesto y responsable, hace tres años se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un puesto en el mercado San Benito, en Mérida, Yucatán. Y gracias a esto inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, empezó con poca mercancía pero al reinvertir sus utilidades ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, actualmente Limbert vive en unión libre y desea comenzar a formar un patrimonio para ofrecerle lo mejor a su futura familia.

Para ofrecer precios más accesibles a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, Limbert está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de ropa en mayoreo, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Limbert, y contribuye al desarrollo de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Holger

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Holger tiene una experiencia de 12 años con su actividad. Hace 7 se inicio solo con la ayuda de un amigo y su esfuerzo logro conseguir capital de trabajo. Comenzó vendiendo de manera ambulante y pudo conseguir varios clientes. Al momento ha podido mejorar su negocio. Tiene un local en un mercado de la ciudad. Trabajando todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m.

Holger has 12 years of experience in his business of selling fish. He began his business seven years ago with the help of his friend and with his own effort in acquiring working capital. He started selling fish in the streets which gave him the opportunity to meet various clients. To date, he has been able to improve his business. He has a shop in one of the open markets of the city. He works every day of the week from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de un congelador. Con el que aspira comenzar a trabajar en su domicilio. Y otra parte en mercadería para su local.

He will invest part of the loan in purchasing a freezer, which will allow him to work out of his home. The remaining part of the loan will be used to purchase products for his shop.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Holger esta separado de su esposa hace un año. Tiene 51 años y 2 hijos. Los cuales estudian y están a cargo de el. Con su lucha a logrado adecuar su domicilio. De esta manera darle una mejor vida a su familia. Actualmente esta construyendo un segundo piso en su domicilio. Por lo que espera con la inversión que realizara poder terminar de construir su casa.

Holger has been separated from his wife for one year. He is 51 years old and he has two children, who study and who look after him. With personal effort he has been able to remodel his home and provide for his family with a better lifestyle. Currently, he is adding a second floor to his home, which he hopes that the investment to his business will in turn provide income to allow him to finish with the construction of his home.

loans.use: Invertir en una congeladora //  Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios has seven years of experience in the making and sale of hammocks. Since he didn't have a job that would allow him to pay all of the household expenses, he had to start his own business. Fortunately, the quality of his products and the good service he provided have allowed him to increase sales and remain in business for all of these years. He is a very hard-working and responsible man. He is married and has two children, ages 19 and 21 respectively.

In order to increase his production and meet with his clients' demands, Juan de Dios is asking for a loan of $375. He will use the money to buy raw materials from which he will make hammocks. He commits himself to return the money within 5 months. By contributing to the development of this business, you can become an important part of Juan de Dios' life and that of his family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios tiene siete años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ante la falta de empleo para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio, afortunadamente la calidad de los productos que elabora y su buen servicio le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y permanecer durante tanto tiempo en el negocio. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad.

Para poder incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Juan de Dios está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las hamacas, él se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de Juan de Dios y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Liecer

texts.en:
Liecer D. L. L. owns the Colmado Maximo, a general store in Mojarra where she sells everything from bread and bananas to pens and feminine products. Liecer will use this loan to expand her offerings to incluD. more food staples such as ham, sugar, and cooking oil, and to keep her store well-stocked and growing. Liecer helps support her husband Maximo Ventura and their three children: Oscar (14), Luis (10), and Argelis (6). When not studying, Liecer's children spend their time adventuring around Mojarra on their bicycles. According to Liecer, no mango tree is safe from her three boys when school's not in session.

Note: Liecer is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: expand the inventory of her general store

loans.name: Nery Magdalena

texts.es:
Nery is a very hardworking and honest person. She lives with her long-time boyfriend and has a 13 year-old son and an 11 year-old daughter. When she became unemployed three years ago, she took advantage of skills learned in previous jobs and decided to open a small grocery store in her house. Thanks to her liking for sales, and a personality that makes it easy for her to relate to others, Nery has been able to grow her business, attract more customers, and improve her inventory.

Nery is requesting a loan for $475.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so that she can have a better variety of products and meet the needs of her customers. She promises to return the loan in 6 months. Be a part of Nery’s achievements. She and her family thank you for the opportunity you provide them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nery es una mujer muy trabajadora y honesta, vive en unión libre, tiene un hijo de 13 años y una hija de 11 años de edad. Al quedar desempleada hace tres años aprovechando la experiencia de sus anteriores trabajos decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás Nery ha hecho crecer su negocio incrementando sus clientes y surtiendo mejor su tienda.

En estos momentos Nery está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos y atender las necesidades de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de los logros de Nery, ella y su familia agradecen la oportunidad que les das con tu apoyo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 34-year-old single mother of two: Salandre (10) and Davis (14). She works out of her small house, making bags and clothes with a sewing machine that she bought with her first loan. She also knits and crochets different types of clothes as well. With this loan Ana will buy more materials and possibly a different sewing machine, which will enable her to make more complex things and hopefully in turn earn more money. With this increase in profit she hopes to expand her business and possibly have her own store someday that is separate from her house. She would like to be able to provide more for her family.

Note: Ana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $975 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and new equipment for her business

loans.name: Sergio Gerardo

texts.es:
Sergio is an entrepreneurial person and is very responsible. He used to work in a hardware store, but he lost that job three years ago due to problems in the business. Sergio began his own business. When Sergio was let go by the hardware store, they offered part of his severance pay in cash and the other part in hardware materials. This helped him out in the beginning with his paint store, where he sells items necessary for construction and other hardware. Sergio is married and the desire to be able to offer the best to his family is what motivates him to work harder and harder everyday.

Sergio is requesting a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy merchandise. He is committed to returning the loan in 5 months. Be part of the development of this business! Sergio and his family thank you for the opportunity you provide them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sergio es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, anteriormente él trabajaba para una ferretería, hace tres años después que le dieron de baja en su empleo por algunos problemas de la empresa Sergio inició su propio negocio, para pagarle su liquidación le ofrecieron una parte en efectivo y otra en material ferretero esto le ayudo un poco en el comienzo de su tlapalería, donde vende artículos necesarios para la construcción y de ferretería. Sergio es casado y el deseo de poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia es lo que lo motiva a esforzarse cada día más.

Ahora Sergio necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, en busca de darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio para continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte en el desarrollo de este negocio, Sergio y su familia agradecen la oportunidad que les brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Rita Isela

texts.es:
Rita is single and she has two children. She came to Mérida five years ago looking for better opportunities and also to take care of her elderly mother. Since then, in order to make an income that would allow her to provide for her family, Rita has been selling costume jewelry and silver. The good quality of the products, which she makes herself, and her originality, have helped her business to grow. Demand for her products grew quickly.

In order to meet demand from her customers, Rita is requesting a loan of $475.00, which she will use to buy materials that she needs to make her products. She will return the loan in 6 months. Your help would be a great help to this family. Rita thanks you sincerely for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es soltera y tiene dos hijos, desde hace cinco años llegó a Mérida, Yucatán en busca de mejores oportunidades y para poder cuidar de su madre que es de edad avanzada, desde entonces para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su familia Rita inició con la venta de bisutería y plata, la buena calidad de los productos que ella misma elabora y su originalidad le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, pronto la demanda por sus productos se fue incrementando.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Rita está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra del material que necesita en la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, Rita agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Patricia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Patricia is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is an entrepreneurial person with a great desire to overcome. Her parents had a bread store and that experience has been useful to her in her current business. Due to the need for an extra income, because of fact that her husband’s salary is very low, they decided to open a bread store five years ago. Little by little, they have come to be preferred by their customers.

Patricia is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy ingredients, with which she expects to cover the growing demand for her products. She will return the loan in 6 months. The growth of this business and the wellbeing of this family are in your hands. Thank you very much for supporting someone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, es una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, sus padres tenían una panadería que le ha ayudado de experiencia en su actual negocio, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra porque el salario de su esposo era muy bajo, decidieron iniciar su panadería desde hace 5 años, poco a poco se han colocado en el gusto de sus clientes.

Ahora Patricia esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos, con lo que espera cubrir la creciente demanda por sus productos, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el crecimiento de este negocio, así como el bienestar de esta familia, muchas gracias por apoyar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Manuel Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel is married and has three children. He used to work for a soft drink company, but he lost his job 16 years ago when the company reduced its personnel. It was very difficult to find a new job, and so his wife advised him to start his own business selling sweets and fruits. Fortunately, he has achieved good earnings. It is his liking for sales and the good service he offers that have allowed him to stay in business for such a long time.

In order to increase his sales, Manuel is requesting a loan of $275.00, which he will use to buy merchandise so that he can have a better supply and meet the needs of his customers. By contributing to the growth of this business, you can help improve this family's life. They thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel es casado y tiene tres hijos, anteriormente él trabajaba para una compañía de refrescos pero ante recorte de personal quedó desempleado, le fue muy difícil conseguir un nuevo trabajo, ante los consejos de su esposa inició su propio negocio desde hace 16 años con la venta de golosinas y frutas. Afortunadamente ha logrado tener buenas ganancias, su gusto por las ventas y el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido estar en el negocio durante tanto tiempo.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Manuel está solicitando un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, para tener un mejor surtido y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania M. S. supports her four children and two grandchildren with her bakery stand in Mojarra, where she sells bread, pastries, and cakes as well as margarine, salt, vinegar, and flour. Epifania will use her loan to build a permanent structure next to her home to house her growing business. She would also like to expand to offer ham and chloride tablets for water purification. Epifania hopes that the sucess of her business can give her children Marilin (24), Junior (22), Guillermos (22), Rafelina (20), and her grandchildren Wilbur (2), and Wilbanias (5 months) the chance to have the education she never could.

Note: Epifania is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $650 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Storefront construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 57-year-old mother of 3, Hersena (22), Antonio (18), Roberto (19) and wife to Gilberto Mosquea. She sells all sorts of miscellaneous products for everyday life including clothes, shoes, creams, hair products, hats, etc. With her loan she is going to buy more products and she hopes to eventually be able to open up her own boutique with all of her products, because as of now she is selling the items out of her own house. She believes this expansion will enable her to improve her family's quality of life and that she will be able to help her children get started in a business.

Note: Arsenia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $900 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. started out selling shampoo and disinfectant cleaner door-to-door to her neighbors in the town of El Torro. She then expanded her business to sell women's purses as well. Since Maria doesn't have a sewing machine, she stitches each individual purse by hand.

Maria plans to use her loan to buy a sewing machine and more supplies, including chemicals for her shampoo and cleaner business and cloth for her purses. Maria's entrepreneurship helps support her husband Aldofo and their two children. The income from Maria's business will help her keep her kids in school; she hopes Imel (7) will become an engineer and Nectanier (8 months) a doctor.

Note: Maria is one of five micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and each will be accountable to the others for repaying their share of the loan. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Equipment purchase

loans.name: Carmita

texts.en:
Carmita is a clothes saleswoman. She sells clothes from her home and also goes around selling to her friends and acquaintances. She started by using just $150 of her husband's savings to buy clothes and slowly she established a faithful customer base.

Carmita is seeking a second loan with Kiva and Mifex in order to buy clothes at wholesale prices. She has started to improve her home and make it better fit to display the clothes she buys. She is originally from Manabi and traveled to Guayaquil to seek opportunities and work. Her goal is to improve the home where she, her husband and their two children live.

loans.use: Purchase her merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Giannina

texts.en:
Giannina Q. was born in Santa Elena 45 years ago. She runs a small stand selling “fast food,” but not in the American sense of the word. There are hamburgers and hot dogs, but more local specialties such as salchipapas can be found at her “restaurant on wheels.” She works every day from 4:00 pm until 11:00 pm.
