Q. says she learned this business when she was an employee in a cafeteria at a college. With six years of experience in this line of work, she has her loyal clients who love her special flavors. Q. is asking for a second loan that will help her buy a new cart for her son to start a second branch of her business. With her first loan she bought tables, chairs and a radio to play music for her clients.

loans.use: Buy a second cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix up her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA IS 56 YEARS OLD. SHE IS MARRIED AND HAS 11 CHILDREN. SHE AND HER HUSBAND BUY AND SELL HORSES FROM AND TO PEOPLE THAT LIVE ON THE FIELDS AROUND HER COMMUNITY - THEY ARE USED FOR LAND CULTIVATION AND TRANSPORTATION. SHE IS ON GROUP SANTA CATARINA 12, ALONG WITH LUZ ESTHER DIAZ FLORES ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ), AND MRS. MARTHA SANCHEZ ABARCA ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ). MRS. FRANCISCA EXPECTS TO INVEST THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE LIVESTOCK AND MORE FOOD FOR THEM IN ORDER TO IMPROVE STOCK REARING. THE OTHER TWO LADIES WILL APPLY THEIR SHARE OF THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO INCREASE INVENTORY, THUS, INCREASING GAIN.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

FRANCISCA TIENE 56 AÑOS , CASADA 11 HIJOS , TRABAJA CON SU ESPOSO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CABALLOS A LAS PERSONAS DEL CAMPO QUE HABITAN EN LOS ALREDEDORES DE SU COMUNIDAD QUIENES LOS UTILIZAN PARA EL TRABAJO DE SIEMBRA Y DE TRASLADO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 12 JUNTO CON DOÑA LUZ ESTHER DIAZ FLORES ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) Y DOÑA MARTHA SANCHEZ ABARCA ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ).CON EL PRESTAMO DOÑA FRANCISCA ESPERA INVERTIR EN MAS ANIMALES Y ALIMENTO PARA UNA MEJOR CRIANZA. LAS OTRAS DOS SEÑORAS INVERTIRAN SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO EN MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER MEJOR A SUS TIENDAS Y ASI OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: COMPRA Y VENTA DE CABALLOS

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
FLOR DE MARIA IS 33 YEARS OLD. SHE IS MARRIED AND HER HUSBAND WORKS AS A CONSTRUCTION ASSISTANT. SHE PREPARES AND DELIVERS MEALS TO CUSTOMERS THAT HAVE PLACED AN ORDER. SHE INTENDS TO USE HER LOAN TO PURCHASE KITCHENWARE AND ADDITIONAL STORAGE CONTAINERS SO SHE CAN HAUL HER LOAD OF DELIVERIES MORE EFFICIENTLY. SHE IS PART OF GROUP SUPERACION 6 - ALONG WITH LETICIA ROVELO CONSTANTINO ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ), JOSEFA L. H. ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ) AND JOSEFA DE JESUS URBINA ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ). THEY WANT TO PURCHASE MORE NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS AND MORE MERCHANDISE IN GENERAL TO BETTER EQUIP THEIR BUSINESSES.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

FLOR DE MARIA TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA 2 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL.ELLA PREPARA ALIMENTOS EN SU CASA Y POSTERIORMENTE LOS LLEVA A DOMICILIO SEGÚN LOS PEDIDOS QUE LE HAGAN . ELLA ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN UTENSILIOS DE COCINA Y ENVASES PARA PODER TRASLADAR DE MEJOR MANERA LOS ALIMENTOS QUE ENTREGA . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SUPERACION 6 JUNTO CON LETICIA ROVELO CONSTANTINO ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) JOSEFA L. H. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) Y JOSEFA DE JESUS URBINA ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES )ELLAS ESPERAN INVERTIR COMPRANDO ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES Y MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SUS NEGOCIOS.

loans.use: VENTA DE COMIDA

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
ODILIA IS 37 YEARS OLD. SHE IS MARRIED AND HER HUSBAND WORKS AS A HEAVY MACHINERY OPERATOR. SHE WANTS TO INVEST THE LOAN AMOUNT TO OPEN UP A SMALL RESTAURANT IN HER VILLAGE’S CENTRAL AREA – A SPOT AT THE LOCAL MARKET IS EXPECTED TO BE RENTED. SHE BELONGS TO THE WOMEN’S GROUP TRABAJANDO 4.

Translated from Spainsh by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

ODILIA TIENE 37 AÑOS, CASADA, 2 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO OPERADOR DE MAQUINARIA PESADA.ELLA ESPERA INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO COLOCANDO UN PEQUEÑO RESTAURANT EN EL CENTRO DEL PUEBLO POR LO QUE ESPERA ARRENDAR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD .PERTENECE AL GRUPO MUJERES TRABAJANDO 4.

loans.use: RESTAURANT

loans.name: Lilia Berthy

texts.es:
Lilia belongs to the group "Mujeres Trabajando 4." She is 67 years old, married and has 5 children. She currently has a pharmacy in the community she lives because her husband is a traditional medicine doctor. They wish to invest the loan in stocking their pharmacy with more medicne.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LILIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO MUJERES TRABAJANDO 4. TIENE 67 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENE 5 HIJOS , ACTUALMENTE TIENE UNA FARMACIA EN LA COMUNIDAD DONDE ELLA VIVE, YA QUE SU ESPOSO ES MEDICO TRADICIONAL.CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN PROVEER DE MAYOR CANTIDAD DE MEDICAMENTOS SU LOCAL.

loans.use: VENTA DE MEDICAMENTOS

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children. Jovita currently has merchandise which she sells to the neighbors around her community. With the loan, she hopes to open a grocery store and buy more merchandise (sugar, salt, oil, pastas, etc.). Jovita belongs to the group "Mujeres Trabajando 4." She and María Eugenia Martínez Aparicio are also street vendors, they buy and sell coffee. Jovita would like to invest the loan in buying something that can help her carry her products; this way, the products would be in better shape by the time she reaches her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

JOVITA TIENE 51 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENEN 6 HIJOS . TIENE EN LA ACTUALIDAD UNA CANTIDAD DE MERCADERIA QUE VENDE A SUS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COLOCAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES ES POR ESO QUE COMPRARA MERCADERIA (AZUCAR , SAL , ACEITE, PASTAS , ETC ) .PERTENECE AL GRUPO MUJERES TRABAJANDO 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA EUGENIA MARTINEZ APARICIO COMPRA Y VENTA DE CAFÉ EN FORMA AMBULANTE , ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR COMPRANDO UN IMPLEMENTO PARA TRANSPORTAR MEJOR SUS PRODUCTOS Y ASI LLEGAR CON ELLOS EN MEJOR ESTADO AL LUGAR DE VENTA .

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Leticia Isabel

texts.es:
Leticia is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a delivery man at a store while she has a small grocery store in their house. She belongs to the group Angeles 4, of which another member is Anita López Santis, who also has a grocery store. Both women hope to use the loan to buy large amounts of merchandise and share it between the two of them; this way they can reduce costs and gain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LETICIA TIENE 29 AÑOS , CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA TIENDA COMO REPARTIDOR A DOMICILIO.ELLA TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO ANGELES 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA ANITA LOPEZ SANTIS QUIEN TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES .AMBAS ESPERAN INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN COMPRAR GRANDES CANTIDADES DE MERCADERIAS LAS QUE SE REPARTIRAN PARA DISMINUIR EL COSTO DE COMPRA Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS AL VENDER.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Amparo Estela

texts.es:
Amparo is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works for a government organization as a civil servant. She hopes to invest the loan in setting up a grocery store to help support her family. Amparo belongs to the group Angeles 4. Other members of this group include Rosa Jiménez López (raises and sells pigs) and Rosalba H. López (has a grocery store) who would like to invest their loans in their businesses: Rosa wishes to buy more pigs while Rosalba would like to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

AMPARO TIENE 40AÑOS , CASADA 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UN ORGANISMO DE GOBIERNO COMO EMPLEADO PUBLICO.ELLA ESPERA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN COLOCAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES PARA AYUDAR AL PRESUPUESTO FAMILIAR .PERTENECE AL GRUPO ANGELES 4.SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON DOÑA ROSA JIMENEZ LOPEZ (CRIANZA Y VENTA DE PUERCOS ) Y DOÑA ROSALBA H. LOPEZ (TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) QUIENES ESPERAN INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO MAS PUERCOS DOÑA ROSA Y DOÑA ROSALBA MERCADERIA PARA SU TIENDA.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband teaches at a rural school of their community. She has opened a grocery store in her house and with the loan, she hopes to keep it well supplied.

Candelaria belongs to the group Primavera 1. She and Angelina Jiménez López, who also has a grocery store, make tamales (beef, chicken or veggies wrapped in corn husks) every weekend and go around their community, offering them from door to door. With the loan, Candelaria also hopes to be able to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

CANDELARIA TIENE 28 AÑOS , CASADA 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES MAESTRO EN UNA ESCUELA RURAL DE LA COMUNIDAD . ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA ABASTECER DE MERCADERIA SU TIENDA . ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO PRIMAVERA 1 JUNTO CON ANGELINA JIMENEZ L. QUE TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA PREPARA TAMALES ( HOJAS DE ELOTE RELLENAS DE CARNES, POLLO O VERDURAS) Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA EN SU COMUNIDAD .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA TAMBIEN COMPRAR MERCADERIA PARA SU LOCAL .

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband is no longer working and they depend on the government's retirement pension. Lucía goes from house to house selling perfumes, jewelry and natural medicine. She belongs to the group Primavera 1. With the loan, Lucía will buy more merchandise and open a small store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 53 AÑOS , CASADA , 5 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO YA NO TRABAJA Y VIVE DE LA PENSION QUE LES OTORGA EL GOBIERNO .ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES , JOYERIAS Y MEDICINA NATURAL Y LOS SALE A VENDER DE CASA EN CASA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO PRIMAVERA 1. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS PRODUCTOS Y SE ESTABLECERA EN SU CASA CON UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DE VENTA

loans.use: VENTA DE PERFUMES

loans.name: Guardina

texts.es:
Sra. Guardina is 54 years old and married with 8 children. Despite not being able to read or write, she launched and manages her own business manufacturing and selling chipa, a type of bread roll. Chipa is one of the most commonly consumed typical foods of Paraguay. Sra. Guadina works in her house, where she has a clay and brick oven which she uses for the preparation of chipa. Once she has prepared a certain quantity she goes out to sell her products door to door and her children tend to the clients who arrive at her home to buy chipas. Her hard work has allowed her to pay for her children's education.

Guardina is a highly respected member of her community; she has always participated in community groups working to grow and improve the neighborhood. She has previously applied for loans to invest in the construction of ovens, since when she first started her business she prepared her products in an oven borrowed from a neighbor. These days she is eager to continue growing her business, and has decided to build another oven. The new oven would allow her to prepare more chipas; demand for her chipas is high. She is applying for a loan of $210, which she commits to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guardina tiene 54 años, está casada y tiene 8 hijos, y a pesar de ser analfabeta supo emprender y manejar su propio negocio, la elaboración y venta de “chipa”. Chipa es una de las comidas típicas más consumidas de nuestro país; ella trabaja en su casa donde tiene un horno hecho de ladrillos y barro que utiliza para la cocción de la chipa. Una vez que elabora una cierta cantidad de chipas ella sale a venderlas de forma ambulante mientras que en su casa sus hijos la ayudan atendiendo a clientes que se acercan a comprar ahí. Con su noble trabajo ha logrado costear la formación académica de sus hijos. Guardina, es una señora muy respetada en su comunidad por su capacidad de liderazgo, ya que siempre integro grupos comunitarios, con finalidades de crecimiento y mejoramiento de su barrio. Ella ya ha solicitado préstamos con anterioridad invirtiéndolos en la construcción de su horno, ya que no contaba con una y lo prestaba de sus vecinos; hoy día ella está deseosa de seguir creciendo y tiene pensado construir otro horno mas para poder producir en mayor cantidad, ya que la demanda de sus productos es alta, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 210 que se compromete a devolverlos de forma puntual.

loans.use: Construction of a clay and brick oven

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virgina, 49 years old, is one of the many enterprising women in Paraguay. She works selling homemade sweets (jellies) she makes from the fruits of the season. She has been doing this work for more than 27 years. Her business is located in a very busy area which brings her lots of sales. She spends the weekends preparing large quantities of her jellies in order to sell them during the following week.

Virginia is a very dynamic, active and creative woman. She continually looks to diversify the products she sells and has had great results, thanks to the variety of fruit available in Paraguay: strawberries, oranges, pomelos, mandarines, mangos, etc.

These days Doña Virginia is eager to continue expanding her business and wishes to obtain a loan in order to enlarge her stall and increase the variety of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Virginia de 49 años, es una de las tantas mujeres luchadoras de nuestro país. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces caseros (mermeladas) hechos a base de frutas de estación, y lo hace ya desde más de 27 años. Su negocio está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia por lo que el movimiento de sus venta es muy alto. Ella dedica los fines de semana para elaborar en gran cantidad sus dulces para venderlos posteriormente en la semana.

Virginia, es una señora muy dinámica, activa y creativa, ya que en todo momento busca diversificar sus productos que vende y según manifestó esto le resulta debido a que en nuestro país existe mucha diversidad de frutas, tales como la frutillas, naranjas, pomelos, mandarinas (una variedad de fruta cítrica muy dulce), mangos, ananá, etc.

Hoy día, Doña Virginia, está deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio, y desea obtener un préstamo para así poder ampliar su puesto de ventas y aumentar la variedad de sus productos.

loans.use: Contruction and enlargement of the stall where she sells her products

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is 68 years old and married with 6 grown sons. All of her sons are married with their own families except the youngest, César, who is 33 years old and still lives with Gregoria and her husband.

Gregoria makes decorative handcrafted pottery. She says that she started in this profession when she was still a young girl and learned all that she knows from her mother. She has passed all of her knowledge of ceramics to her sons, who, although they have taken up other professions, also work helping Gregoria make her products.

She is the only artesan who crafts the little clay hens known round the world. Gregoria has traveled through several countries exhibiting the decorative little pieces in international fairs. Thanks to her skills and her knowledge of art she has visited Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Brasil and a few European countries. Due to her advanced age, she can no longer make the journey to other countries. Her youngest son, however, continues representing her and bringing her work all over the world, to places as far away as China and Japan.

Gregoria remarks that she always received the support of Fundación Paraguaya when she needed money to cover the costs of her travels to other countries. She is applying for a loan since she sees a lot of demand for her products now that they are well known and available for purchase in her house. She will invest the loan in the wholesale purchase of paints and clay, the raw materials for the crafting of her decorative pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria tiene 68 años y es casada tiene 6 hijos varones ya mayores. Todos están casados y han formado sus respectivas familias a excepción del menor, César, quien tiene 33 años y aún vive con ellos.

Gregoria elabora artesanías decorativas D. barro (arcilla). Cuenta que se inició en la profesión cuando aún era niña y todo lo que sabe lo aprendió D. su madre. Ella, a su vez, fue pasando todos sus conocimientos a sus hijos que a pesar D. haber adquirido otros oficios y profesiones también trabajan apoyando a su madre en la elaboración D. sus productos.

Es la única que elabora las conocidas mundialmente “gallinitas D. barro”, que son figuras decorativas con la que Gregoria ha recorrido varios países exhibiéndolas en ferias internacionales; gracias a su habilidad y su noción del arte ha visitado países como Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Brasil y algunos países D. Europa. Cuenta que debido a su avanzada edad ya no pueD. hacer dichos viajes, no obstante su hijo menor la sigue representando, llevando todo lo que ella elabora a distintos puntos del mundo entre ellos China y Japón.

Remarcó que siempre obtuvo apoyo D. la Fundación Paraguaya que le otorgó préstamos en los casos en que necesitaba D. dinero para cubrir parte D. sus pasajes para sus viajes al exterior. Solicita un crédito ya que tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes que ya la conocen y que compran sus productos D. su casa. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. pinturas y barro (arcilla) en mayor cantidad que son materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración D. sus artículos decorativos.

loans.use: Buy paints, paint brushes and clay

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 51 years old. He has been married for many years to Ermelinda, who is 45 years old. Ermelinda is a housewife and has sacrificed a lot to raise their 4 children, now 24, 22, 19 and 13 years old.

All of José's children live with him. Although the two youngest children are still in school, they help their father with his daily work like their older siblings.

José makes clay planters and flower pots in large quantities which he then sells in various Paraguayan cities. He has a truck in which he transports his products.

He has been working in this busines for more than 30 years. He talks with pride about how he successfully opened foreign markets for himself, thanks to the excellent quality of his products. He is currently exporting a large part of his production to Argentina.

José needs a loan to buy the raw materials that he uses in the manufacture of his planters: clay and the firewood he uses to fire his pots.

José is a very enterprising person who dreams of exporting his products to more countries. In his factory he gives work to 4 other people so that they can support their families with the income they earn with him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José tiene 51 años. Está casado desde hace varios años ya con Ermelinda quien actualmente tiene 45 años. Su esposa es ama de casa y ha criado con mucho sacrificio a sus 4 hijos que tienen 24, 22, 19 y 13 años de edad.

Todos sus hijos viven con él. Los dos últimos aún siguen estudiando y ayudan al padre en sus labores diarios al igual que los dos hermanos mayores.

El Sr. José elabora planteras de barro (macetas para cultivar plantas ornamentales) en grandes cantidades que luego comercializa en distintas ciudades del país. Para ello cuenta con un camión en el que transporta todos sus productos.

Se dedica a la misma actividad hace más de 30 años ya. Cuenta con orgullo que debido a la excelente calidad de sus productos consiguió abrirse mercado en el extranjero y actualmente está exportando gran parte de su producción a la Argentina.

El crédito que el Sr. José necesita es para la compra de materias prima que utiliza en la elaboración de sus planteras, tal como el barro y la leña que utiliza para cocinarlas.

Es una persona muy emprendedora que sueña con exportar a más países sus productos. Además, en su fábrica, da trabajo a 4 personas más para que éstos a su vez puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias con los ingresos que obtienen con dicho trabajo.

loans.use: Buy clay and firewood

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio// Business Description

Dolores tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su negocio. El cual la pudo iniciar gracias a los ahorros que tenia de sus trabajos como empleada domestica. Decide comenzar a trabajar con negocio propio y opta por una tienda. La tiene ubicada en la casa de su suegra con la que lleva una buena relación. Ella solo la atiende por las tardes y por las mañanas su suegra presta su servicio al local. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Dolores has five years of experience in her business. Thanks to her savings from her work in domestic service, she was able to open her own business. She decided to open a shop in her mother-in-law’s house, with whom she has a good relationship with. She attends to the shop in the afternoon and her mother-in-law attends to it in the morning. She works every day of the week from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm.

Uso del Préstamo// Loan Use

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además exhibir otros productos que por falta de capital no compra. Y la gente le pide estos productos. Ella espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos. Y prestarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

She will use the credit to invest in the purchase of products to supply her shop. In addition, she will supply the shop with new products, that clients have asked for, but that to date she was unable to buy due to lack of capital. She hopes that with the investment, she will be able to enhance her income and to give a better service to her clients.

Información Personal// Personal Information

Dolores es madre soltera. Tiene 36 años y tres hijos los que estudian. A pesar de estar separada del padre de sus hijos ha logrado con su esfuerzo y dedicación darle lo que ellos necesitan. Ha podido ir terminando de construir su casita de cemento. Sus hijos en sus momentos libres también le ayudan con la atención del negocio.

Dolores is a single mother. She is 36 years old and has three children that study. Despite being separated from the father of her children, she has accomplished with effort and dedication to provide them with what they need. She has been able to continue building her house of cement. He children also help her in the shop in their spare time.

loans.use: Invertir y exhibir productos nuevos// Invest and supply with new products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Victoria inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Vende víveres, medicinas, bisutería y confites. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -11pm.

Victoria began her business 5 years ago. In her shop, she sells groceries, medicine, imitation jewelry, and sweets. She attends to her clients every day from 6:00 am to 11:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

Victoria necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vitrina horizontal grande y adquisición de nuevos productos. Así como también terminar de adecuar su local. Para poder exhibir de mejor manera los productos que ofrece a su clientela.

Victoria needs the credit to purchase a large horizontal glass display and to purchase new products. In addition, she will use the loan to finish remodeling her store in order to better exhibit the products she sells to her clients.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Victoria tiene 33años tiene esposo y 2 lindos niños. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar siendo empleada en distintos lugares donde adquirió experiencia. La ayuda de su esposo. La motivo para decidirse a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de víveres, medicinas y bisutería. Ocupando parte de la casa de sus padres. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos y algún día poder brindar su propio hogar a sus hijos.

Victoria is 33 years old and has a husband and two lovely children. From a very young age, she was interested in working which led to her acquiring experience from various places. With her husband’s help, she was motivated to open her own shop selling groceries, medicine and imitation jewelry. Her shop is in her parents’ house. She wishes to improve her business and income and to someday be able to offer her own home to her children.

loans.use:
Comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos nuevos
// To buy a glass display to exhibit her new products

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano is 42 years old. He has been married to María Dolores, 42, for 20 years. His wife prepares all kinds of fast food that he later sells in a small restaurant in the Municipal Market of his town, Itá. They have one daughter, 19, who is currently studying nursing. Their daughter still lives with them and is able to continue her studies thanks to the income her parents earn from the restaurant.

Mariano gets up very early every morning and is at work along with his wife at 5 AM. Their work day extends into the early evening, and they work every day of the week. For them, there are no holidays, nor rain days.

Although there are other restaurants located close to his, Mariano explains that his stall attracts more clients because the food he sells is hygienically prepared, looks great and tastes delicious.

They started this business more than 15 years ago, and when it went well, they decided to stay with it and have been growing little by little ever since. In addition to the food they also sell juices and sodas. They need a loan with which to buy cases of beverages. Buying in bulk will allow them to buy at a considerable discount, and they want to build a good stock of beverages; demand for cold beverages is high.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mariano tiene 42 años y está casado hace 20 años con María Dolores que tiene 41 años. Su esposa elabora todo tipo de comida rápida que luego vende en un pequeño comedor (restaurant) que tienen dentro del Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Itá. Tienen una sola hija que tiene 19 años y está estudiando enfermería. Su hija aún vive con ellos y estudia gracias a los ingresos que sus padres obtienen en dicho comedor.

Comenta que todos los días se levantan muy temprano y que a las 5 de la mañana ya están firmes en su puesto de trabajo. Su jornada diaria se extiende hasta casi entrada la noche y trabajan todos los días. Para ellos, no existen días festivos, de lluvia o de frío.

Cerca de su comedor también funcionan otros puestos de venta de comidas pero afirma que su puesto de trabajo tiene más clientela debido a que sus alimentos son elaborados en forma higiénica, presentan un muy buen aspecto y además son deliciosos.

Comenzaron con dicha actividad hace más de 15 años pero en vista de que les fue muy bien desde un principio continuaron y fueron creciendo de a poco. Además de los comestibles también venden jugos y gaseosas. Por ello necesitan un crédito para la comprar bebidas por cajones ya que de esa manera obtienen descuentos importantes y tienen un stock suficiente pues las bebidas tienen mucha demanda.

loans.use: Buy beverages in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MatilD. is 44 years old and married; she lives with her husband. Ramón is 54 years old and currently works in a cleaning products factory.

MatilD. has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. Two of her children are in secondary school. Due to the demands of their school work, the family put in a lot of effort and succeeded in buying a computer for the house so that her children could do their school work at home. The family was able to buy the computer with a loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

MatilD. has worked for 8 years buying and selling all types of clothing. She left the work for a period of 4 years when her mother fell ill, but had to return to it in order to support her husband, a builder who travels continually to Argentina looking for better work opportunities.

MatilD. sells her products door to door, from a small truck owned by the family. She is a very enterprising woman, very sure of her self and willing to make any sacrifice to improve her children's quality of life.

She is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of winter children's clothing. She already has many orders to cover for jackets, T-shirts, jeans, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. MatilD. tiene 44 años, es casada y vive con su esposo. El Sr. Ramón tiene 54 años D. edad y actualmente está trabajando en una fábrica en donD. se elaboran productos D. limpieza.

Tiene 3 hijos: dos varones y una nena. Dos D. sus hijos están estudiando en la secundaria, y debido a las exigencias del estudio han hecho un gran esfuerzo para adquirir una computadora D. manera que sus hijos puedan hacer uso D. ella en su propia casa. Para ello han recurrido en una oportunidad a un préstamo que la Fundación Paraguaya les otorgó para adquirir dicha herramienta.

La Sra. MatilD. se dedica hace 8 años aproximadamente a la actividad D. compra y venta D. ropas D. todo tipo, trabajo que suspendió por un período D. 4 años debido a la enfermedad D. su madre, pero que tuvo que retomar debido a la necesidad D. apoyar a su esposo quien es constructor y que viaja continuamente a Argentina en busca D. mejores horizontes laborales. Hace sus recorridos todos los días por la ciudad D. Itá visitando casa por casa a su clientela en una pequeña camioneta, propiedad D. la familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y segura D. sí misma, dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio a fin D. dar un mejor nivel D. vida a sus hijos. Ella solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra D. ropas D. temporada D. invierno, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que debe cubrir como ser: camperas, remeras, jeans, camisas, etc.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell: jackets, pullovers, Tshirts, jeans

loans.name: Nelson Sabino

texts.es:
Nelson is 42 years old and married. He lives with his wife Zunilda, who is 45. They have a 2 year old son who is the joy of the house. Nelson's wife is a housewife and spends all of her time caring for and educating their only son.

Nelson is a carpenter. He tells the story of how he started out in this profession at the age of 8, helping a well known carpenter in Itá. The carpenter taught him the profession until Nelson had the opportunity to become independent and start his own carpentry workshop in his home.

He crafts all kinds of furniture, including wardrobes, kitchen furniture, chairs and tables, among other pieces. He makes furniture to order for his clients. Nelson comments that he sees a lot of demand for his products, since they are finely finished, and he is one of the least expensive craftsmen in the city.

He sadly tells the story of how he was robbed 22 days ago. The thieves took the motor of one of his wood cutting tools. He urgently needs to buy another in order to continue working and supporting his family.

The motor will cost up to $200 and Nelson needs a loan with which to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nelson tiene 42 años, es casado y vive con su esposa Zunilda que tiene 45 años. Tienen un hijo pequeño de dos años de edad que es la alegría de la casa. La esposa de Nelson es ama de casa y se encarga exclusivamente del cuidado y de la educación de su único hijo.

Nelson es carpintero. Cuenta que se inició en la profesión desde los 8 años de edad. Comenzó ayudando a un conocido carpintero de la ciudad de Itá que fue formándolo en la profesión hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de independizarse y montar su propia carpintería en su casa.

Elabora todo tipo de muebles como roperos, muebles de cocina, sillas, mesas, entre otros, todos a pedido de su clientela ya formada. Cuenta que tiene mucha demanda debido a la fina terminación de sus trabajos, además de ser una de las manos de obra más baratas de la ciudad. El costo de dicho motor asciende a US$ 200 y Nelson necesita de un préstamo para comprarlo.

loans.use: Buy a new motor for the wood-cutting machine

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
"I have over 19 years experience in the business of hardware stores. My husband and I work together, and this business has been our family's main source of income. We have three children and have given each of them an education. Two of them are enrolling in a university, and it is a huge expense. We are requesting a loan of $1200 dollars so that we can buy more merchandise and have a greater inventory, so that we can increase our income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 19 años con el negocio de ferretería en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Este negocio a sido el sustento de muestra familia ya que tenemos 3 hijos los cuales les hemos dado los estudios necesarios. Dos de ellos entran a la universidad y ya es un gasto muy grande estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para comprar mas mercancía y así tener mas inventario y mas ingresos.

loans.use: Supply more hardware merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her mechandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Javier sells cleaning supplies and general household items which he sells on the road to areas near his neighborhod. He started selling those products with a loan he got from his brother in law. Currently he sells not just in cash, but he gives his clients time to pay in full, so his clients have increased because of the options of payment he offers.

Loan Use

Javier needs the credit to buy more merchandise because he needs to increase his clients and range of work. Also he knows that with more merchandise his profits will increase and he will have a prosperous business.

Personal Information

Javier is 35 years old and has 3 children who are in school, his house is made of cement and his wife also helps him selling some products at home.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Javier tiene a la venta artículos de aseo y para el hogar en general que vende de forma ambulante en los sectores próximos a su vecindario. El comenzó a vender dichos productos por la necesidad de trabajar con unos con un préstamo que le hizo a un cuñado. Actualmente no solo vende al contado los artículos sino que se ha ideado una forma de crédito de tal manera que sus clientes han aumentado por la facilidad de pago que el les presta

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería pues necesita ampliar su campo de trabajo e incrementar su cartera de clientes. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero

Información Personal

Javier tiene 35 años de edad y tres hijos quienes estudia y además su casa es de cemento y cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa que que le ayuda en casa vendiendo tambien los productos

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Javier has a pharmacy in a place he has set up in his house which he started with a loan he got of $250. With time and because of a school built diagonal to his pharmacy he also began selling school supplies. Currently he is not just selling medicine but also school and party supplies.

Loan Use

Mr. Javier needs the credit to enlarge his space and wants to set up a phone boot as there is no phone boot near by.

Personal Information

Javier is 26 years old and he has a daughter who is studying, her wife also works, they have family stability and a house made of cement. Javier is sure with the improvements to his business he will improve his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Javier tiene una farmacia en un local que ha acondicionado en su casa pudo emprenderla con la ayuda de un préstamo de $250. Con el tiempo y ya que una escuela se construyo diagonal a su farmacia también comenzó a vende articulo de papelería. Actualmente no solo vende medicamentos sino también productos de papelería y regalos para toda ocasión.

Uso del Préstamo

El Sr. Javier necesita el crédito para hacer una ampliación en su local pues va a implementar un locutorio de una cabina pues en su sector no hay este servicio sino hasta varias cuadras a la redonda.

Información Personal

El tiene 26 años y una niña que estudia su esposa también trabaja su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Javier esta seguro que con las mejoras que de a su negocio podrá dar un mejor futuro as u hijo.

loans.use: Build a phone boot space in his current pharmacy / store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Business Description

Vilma sells uniforms and books to students of a nearby school. The books are a result of her work and investigation and she buys the uniforms from a manufacture and she resells them to the students. She started the business as a request from the parents of the school.

Loan Use

Vilma needs the loan to buy more books requested by more schools of her area and because the sporting weeks are coming she will need more uniforms to sell.

Personal Information

Vilma is 42 years old and has 3 children who are all in school, her house is made of cement.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Vilma tiene a la venta uniformes y libros que los expende a los alumnos de una escuela de su sector. Los libros son fruto de su trabajo e investigación y los uniformes los compra a un fabricante y ella los distribuye a los alumnos de una escuela de su sector. Comenzó este negocio por motivación de los padres de familia de la mencionada escuela

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mas libros que han sido solicitados por mas escuelas de su sector y por que se acercan las semanas deportivas de su zona y tendrá mas uniformes que fabricar ..

Información Personal

Ella tiene 42 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar

loans.use: Buy more books and uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Moraima cooks and sells lunches and snacks mainly traditional Ecuadorian food like bollos (fish and chicken long pasties) , tortas (cakes) , encebollados (fish soup with sour onions), fritadas (fried pork with plantains), some dishes under request, etc…, she has about 2 years experience working by herself. She works from Wednesdays to Sundays delivering meals to homes that place orders.

Loan Use

Moraima needs the loan to improve her working space so people can go to eat her delicious dishes. She needs to improve her local because of the quality of clients she has now.

Personal Information

Moraima is 52 years old, she lives with her husband and 14 year old son who is studying, who also helps her cooking the meals and with household shores, her house is made of cement and very clean. Moraima dreams having a big restaurant very well known so people could go to enjoy the delicious dishes she creates.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Moraima se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de almuerzos y cosas de picar específicamente comidas ecuatorianas como bollos, tortas, platos a la carta, encebollados, fritada, etc... , teniendo como experiencia 2 anos, trabajando independientemente. Trabaja desde los miércoles hasta los domingos entregando la mercadería a los domicilios que les hacen los encargos.

Uso del Préstamo

Moraima necesita el préstamo para adecuar un local que ella posee y así tener su negocio en un lugar estable donde la gente pueda llegar a servirse los deliciosos platos que ella elabora. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Moraima necesita adecuar el local, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Moraima tiene 52 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 14 anos de edad actualmente estudiando, quien también le ayuda con las labores del hogar y negocio, por lo cual tienen su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada. Los sueños de Moraima es tener un gran restauran muy nombrado de tal manera que vaya la gente a disfrutar de los deliciosos platos que ella elabora

loans.use: Improve her working space

payments.comment: Pago el credito en su totalidad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase on her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
I. Matluba is one of the active clients of Micro Invest. Her first loan was $100 and over time she increased her loan limit to $1000. Her business is trade of melons and watermelons in summer time and trade of different kind of salads in the winter season. She buys her products from Khujand district: Uchbog, Begovot and Somgor. She has been engaged in trade for over 6 years.

Her business place is located in the open-air market in Khujand. She sells her produce on one small cart. Due the loans from Micro Invest, Matluba bought a car for importing melons from the districts. She also bought a milk cow for her own use.

She has 3 children. They are a very friendly family and help each other in their family activities. Her elder daughter milks the cow and sells milk in their village. She also help her mother. Her son drives the car, and he is responsible for supplying melons from the districts to the market for his mother.

Matluba decided to increase the volume of her goods and she requests $1000 to purchase the next batch of orange melons.

loans.use: Purchase of 400 melons

loans.name: Oysha

texts.en:
Oysha L. is 58 years old. She has a high education and her specialization is teaching her native language. She is married and has 6 children. Currently she is working in a Yavan college as native language teacher. Oysha has a big family, so in addition to working in the college, she is breeding animal for milk and meat. She use milk for cream, butter, kefir and curd.

Currently she has one dairy cow and two bull-calves. Oysha’s husband is veterinarian so the animals have good care. She is gong to buy one dairy cow for the loan amount of $580. This loan could help to Oysha to increase her milk yield so she can sell dairy products in the neighborhing village at low prices. She is going to pay off the loan in 10 months.

loans.use: To buy dairy cow

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo has over 3 years of experience in trade. She is divorced and she has 2 children. She lives with her father and her brother’s family now. After her divorce, Marhabo was in a difficult situation. She did not have regular work to support her family. She decided to sells brooms because it was their family business. Her mother was a broom maker and taught Marhabo and her brother to make brooms as children. Her father sold brooms in the market.

But now Marhabo’s mother is dead and her father is old and could not help her financially. Her brother has one place for trade and he helped Marhabo rent a place to sell brooms. Marhabo’s children and father prepare the brooms for market. They paint and dry brooms under the sun and then Marhabo and her brother sell them in their business places. You can see Marhabo, her son and her brother in the photo.

Additionally they have 40 hens and 80 chickens at home. They usually deliver about 20-30 eggs for sale to the canteens every day. Now Marhabo is requesting $1000 to purchase 4000 brooms.

loans.use: Purchase of 4000 brooms

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is married and has three children. Two of them are in primary school and one has not yet started school. Donata keeps broiling chickens. She buys chicks from chick-selling companies and raises them for about 30 days before reselling them to restaurants and other buyers. She buys one chick currently at USD 1.17 and sells the same after thirty days at USD 2.96.

The main costs involved in raising the chicks are their feed, medications and electricity. She usually buys a flock of 400 chicks at a time. She wants to increase the number of broilers to 800. She has a big hut to accommodate the increased number of birds. She has also secured a promising market to sell the increased number of birds. She is in need of USD 1000 to buy the chicks, feed and some medications.

loans.use: Purchase chicks, chicks feeds and medicines

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 31 years old, married and has three children. Mwajuma sells “khanga”, a type of cloth worn by majority of women in Tanzania. Currently, she buys one piece of khanga at USD 2.50 and resells the same at USD 5. She sells on credit and collects her receivables on monthly basis.

Currently she buys 150 pieces of khanga at a time. She want to increase this number to 200 pieces. This number could earn her a reasonable profit margin and improve her business. What holds her back is lack of enough working capital, because she has to wait until her customers pay the money before she purchases another consignment. She is in need of USD 550 to purchase the right amount of stock.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cloths

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 26 years old and lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. Twaha is a hawker. What differentiates him from other hawkers is that he buys different consumable items like razor blades, matches, sweets, sewing materials, pens, cosmetics and many other easily carried items, and then sells these items to shops located far from the city center. He sells these items in dozens and he does not sell them at retail; other hawkers sells at retail.

A competitive advantage for Twaha is that he identifies wholesale shops whose prices are lower. He usually takes orders from his clients before he buy the items. He said that he has been in this business for more than five years. He is ambitious about becoming a big wholesaler in his area one day. He is in need of USD 550 to replenish his stock.

loans.use: To purchase different consumables

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia is 37 years old and happily married with 3 children. Her husband, Mr. Parciano A., is 40 years old and contributes to the family's income. Amelia tell us that her life revolves around her family's happiness and her children's well-being. Her oldest son is in primary school. Her second son was born with a mental handicap for which he recieves treatment at an institution of rehabilitation in the capital (2 hours from the city where Amelia lives). Amelia takes him to his treatment weekly, no matter what the weather. Even with that burden, Amelia and her husband's love motivated them to adopt a little girl who had been abandoned by her biological mother.

SInce the family was growing and her son's illness was adding to the family's expenses, Amelia decided to help her husband with the household income. She opened a business selling men's and women's clothing in the Municipal Market in Carapeguá, and went along growing her business, thanks to the loans she received.

Fifteen years have passed since she opened her business, and Amelia is eager to continue expanding her business so that she can increase her earnings. She is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of children's winter clothing; there is a lot of demand for these products in the market. She has shown herself to be an enterprising person who is willing to do all she needs to to improve her quality of life. She considers the loan an essential tool if she is to grow her business sufficiently to proviD. for her children's education, which is her priority.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Amelia tiene 37 años, está felizmente casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido, el Sr. Parciano A. tiene 40 años, es empleado D. una fábrica D. la cuidad y aporta a los ingresos familiares. Amelia nos cuenta que su vida gira en torno a la felicidad D. su familia y el bienestar D. sus hijos; su hijo mayor va a la escuela primaria, su segundo hijo nació con retraso mental por lo cual realiza un tratamiento en un instituto D. rehabilitación en la capital (a dos horas D. la ciudad donD. vive) y lo lleva una vez por semana, haga frio o calor; aun así el inmenso amor D. ella y su marido los llevo a adoptar una niña pequeña que fue abandonada por su madre biológica.

Debido a que la familia fue agrandándose, y la enfermedad D. su hijo demanda muchos gastos, Amelia, decidió ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos D. la casa, abrió un negocio D. ventas D. ropas para damas y caballeros en el Mercado Municipal D. Carapeguá, y fue creciendo gracias a los créditos que obtuvo.

Ya van 15 años desD. que abrió su negocio, y está deseosa D. seguir expandiéndose para aumentar sus ganancias; para ello desea solicitar un crédito, que lo invertirá en la compra D. ropas para niños y D. invierno pues tienen bastante demanda en el mercado; ella demuestra que es una gran persona dispuesta a seguir luchando para lograr aumentar su nivel D. vida y considera al crédito como herramienta fundamental para que su negocio crezca D. manera a asegurar la educación D. sus hijos que es su prioridad.

loans.use: Buy winter clothing for children

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria has a small job selling food, her main source of income, and three children who depend on her, especially since her husband is unemployed. She has small accomodations for field workers who travel from the rural area that are currently disabled due to the lack of equipment (blankets, folding beds, and mirrors).

She asks for a loan to furnish her accomodations. This would give her husband the chance of working and thus help support the family. This is her second credit with Impro. Her timely payment of her first loan allows her access to a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene un puesto pequeño de venta de comida que es su actual y principal fuente de ingreso; tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella pues el esposo se encuentra desempleado. Tiene un Alojamiento pequeño para viajeros campesinos de la Área Rural sin funcionar por falta de equipamiento (frazadas, catres, espejo).

El Crédito requiere para equiparlo el alojamiento, de esa forma el esposo que se encuentra desempleado tendría la posibilidad de trabajar y así poder ayudar en la manutención de la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas en el primer crédito le faculta acceder a este segundo préstamo.

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario produces dairy milk, the same milk which is marketed to Pil Andina (Milk Industrial Plant). He also operates a tractor (tilling other farmers' lands in his region to plant potatoes) and artificially inseminates cows. These are the forms of income with which he maintains his family.

He lives in Batallas, in the village of Huayrocondo (two hours from the city of La Paz). He asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of a cow to increase the production of milk. This is his first loan with Impro, and their evaluation of his cash flow and previous credits with other institutions qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es productor de leche de vaca la misma que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); también trabaja como tractorista (prepara la tierra de otros agricultores en su zona para sembrar papa) y realiza inseminación artificial a las vacas. Estos son los ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.

Vive en la Comunidad de Batallas, en el pueblo llamado Huayrocondo (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada de su flujo de caja y antecedentes crediticios con otras instituciones le califican para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara and her husband raise dairy cows, the same who produce milk marketed to Pil Andina (Milk Industrial Plant). This is their principal source of income, maintaining their 3 children. Genara lives in the community of Laja-Ninachiri (an hour and a half from the city of La Paz).

She asks for a loan to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk. This is Genara's first loan with Impro, and their evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Genara y su esposo se dedican a la criaza de sus vacas lecheras de mediana raza, las mismas que producen leche para comercializarla a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta es su principal fuente de ingreso familiar con que mantiene a sus 3 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Genara vive en la Comunidad de Laja - Ninachiri (A una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino works as a taxi driver in the city of La Paz. This is his principal source of income, allowing him to maintain his family and pay for the education of his three children. Marcelino lives in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz.

He asks for a loan to purchase a motor for his vehicle. This is his third loan with Impro. His timely repayments on previous loans permits him to solicit another loan. This allows him to continue working and making necessary money to pay his debt and support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelino tiene su taxi que trabaja de servicio en la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso la cual le permite mantener a su familia y pagar la educación universitaria de sus tres hijos. Marcelino vive la Zona de Tacagua de Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un Motor para su movilidad. Es el tercer crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago de los anteriores dos créditos le faculta para solicitar otro préstamo, para así de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y hacer el dinero necesario para el pago de la deuda y manutención de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina lives with her two children who attend High School. Her husband has gone to Brazil to work in the clothing industry. Valentina has a grain mill business that brings in income for her family. She lives in the City of Alto Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora in the Villa Esperanza zone. She is requesting this loan to purchase grain (quinoa, corn, barley, etc.) in quintals, (a quintal is a 50 kg or 100 pound bag) for sale in the grocery stores in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This will be her third loan through Impro. Her favorable payment record on her first two loans qualify her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Valentina vive con sus dos hijos que estudian en la secundaria (high school); el esposo se fue a Brasil a trabajar de costurero. Valentina tiene una tienda de molino de cereales del cual genera ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Vive en la Ciudad de El Alto Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora Zona Villa Esperanza. El crédito que ahora solicita será para comprar cereales (quinua, maíz, cebada, etc.) por quintal( un quintal es una bolsa que pesa 50 kilogramos o 100 libras) para la comercialización en las tiendas de abarrotes de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Este será el tercer crédito con Impro; los buenos antecedentes de pago en los dos primeros créditos le facultan para acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona and her husband have a dairy, producing cows’ milk which is sold through PIL Andina (an Industrialized Milk Plant). This business is their primary source of income. They support three children who are attending elementary school. Petrona lives in the Laja-Ninachiri community (an hour and a half outside of La Paz). They will use this loan to purchase a mid-size breed of milk cow to increase their milk production and to raise their level of income. This is their first loan with Impro, and the social and economic evaluation that has been done indicates that their project is viable.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona y esposo son productores de leche de vaca, la que es comercializada a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta actividad es su fuente principal de ingreso con que cuentan; tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos y están cursando el nivel primario de la escuela. Petrona vive en la Comunidad de Laja - Ninachiri (A una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo usara en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y así mejorar su nivel de ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada, tanto social como financiera, muestran que el proyecto que tiene es rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon has an upholstery show that he runs from his home on Juan Pablo II avenue, and 16 de Julio road in the city of El Alto. He lives with his three children and his wife who he supports. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase the raw material (leather and foam rubber) necessary for his shop. This is his third loan with Impro. His two previous loans were paid in full in accordance with the established payment plans. His payment history qualifies him as a level 1 client, meaning excellent.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Simón tiene su taller de Tapicería de vehículos (upholstery) que esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio en la Av. Juan Pablo II / 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; vive con sus tres hijos y esposa que dependen de él. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para comprar materia prima (cuero y esponja) que necesita para su negocio. Es el tercer crédito con Impro. Los dos créditos anteriores fueron pagados en su totalidad y de acuerdo a los planes de pago establecidos. Este historial de pagos lo califica como cliente 1, es decir excelente.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Marilin

texts.es:
Marili lives with her two children, ages 4 and 6. Like many Bolivian women, she lives away from her husband, who left to work in another state in Bolivia (Santa Cruz) leaving her act as both father an mother to her two small children, while working to support them. She is a hand-weaver, and she creates Mantas, traditional woman’s dresses, worn by the indigenous women of in the area. These are sold retail in the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. Marillin lives in a house with her parents on J.J. Perez street in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials (wool). It is her second loan with Impro, and her good payment history has qualified her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Marilin vive con sus dos hijo de 4 y 6 años; como muchas mujeres bolivianas vive alejada de su esposo que se fue a trabajar a otro departamento de Bolivia (Santa Cruz) y ella asume la responsabilidad de padre y madre de sus dos pequeños hijos y trabaja para la manutención de los mismos. Ella es tejedora a mano, realiza mantas para cholitas paceñas y las comercializa por detalle en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Marilin vive en la casa de sus padres en la calle J.J. Pérez de la zona Villa Ingenio de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (lana). Es el segundo crédito con Impro y los buenos antecedentes de pago del primer crédito le facultan acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a public transportation driver. He works as a Trufi driver between La Paz and El Alto. (Trufi is an acronym in Spanish for Set Route Taxi). This job is the source of income that he uses to support his son. Edgar lives on Marcelo Q. Santa Cruz avenue, in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz. The loan that he is requesting will be used to maintain his car, which is the tool that he uses for his job. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for this loan. With this, Edgar will be able to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Edgar es transportista de servicio publico; trabaja de Trufi inter – ciudad La Paz - el Alto (Trufi es un taxi que tiene una ruta fija). Esta es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su hijo. Edgar vive la Av. Marcelo Q. Santa Cruz de la Zona de Pasankeri que esta ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado servirá para el mantenimiento de su movilidad que es su herramienta de trabajo. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo. De esa forma Edgar podrá seguir trabando.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finish his well-digging contract

loans.name: Todos Los Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Todos los Santos D. V. is married and has three children. They were her reason for starting up her business, five years ago. She is a Tarahumara [indigenous people of northern Mexico, famous for their brightly colored clothing] and lives in the state of Chihuahua. She handcrafts the clothing and artifacts of her culture, which she sells in a recently acquired place of business. Her mother and husband help her run the business. Together, they have made the business a success, and through the business they educate people about their traditions and customs.

She is asking for a loan of $700 so that she can increase production and improve the quality of the goods she offers for sale. She will use the loan to buy raw materials. She expects to repay the loan in six months and asks for your help in improving and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Todos los Santos es casada y tiene 3 hijos, quienes fueron la razón para empezar con su negocio hace cinco años, ella pertenece a la etnia taraumara en el estado de Chihuahua y elabora artesanías propias de su cultura, recientemente a adquirido un local en el que las comercializa, donde cuenta con la ayuda de de su madre y su esposo, juntos han logrado sacas adelante su negocio y de esta manera han dado a conocer un poco de sus tradiciones y costumbres.

Para poder incrementar la producción de sus artesanías y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, Todos los Santos está solicitando un préstamo de $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses y espera de tu ayuda para poder mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José Luís is 32. He is married and has a 4-year-old girl. They are originally from Creel, in the state of Chihuaua. He used to do small carpentry jobs, working from house to house, but his lack of tools cost him the best jobs. Using his savings, and with hard work, he converted part of his home into a carpentry shop, and now he makes furniture of all types.

Right now, José Luís needs a loan of $150, which he would use to buy specialized tools for making furniture. These tools will shorten the time he spends in making his furniture and improve its quality. He expects to repay the loan in one month. The family sincerely appreciates your contribution in expanding the business and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

José Luís tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene una pequeña hija de 4 años, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua. Anteriormente él realizaba trabajos pequeños de carpintería casa por casa, contaba con muy poca herramienta lo que le impedían elaborar trabajos de mejor calidad, pero con base en su esfuerzo y ahorros ha logrado acondicionar un lugar de su casa para utilizarla como taller de carpintería, ahora elabora muebles de todo tipo.

En estos momentos, José Luís necesita un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta más especializada para la elaboración de los muebles, esto le permitirá reducir su tiempo de producción y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, él ofrece devolver ese crédito en un meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y contribuye a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Silvino is married and has four children, all grown and married. He used to work as a schoolteacher in Creel, in the state of Chihuahua, and is now retired. He couldn't make ends meet with his retirement pay, so he set himself up in business as a carpenter and furniture maker. He is well respected for the quality of the furniture he produces.

He needs tools to speed up production and improve the quality of his goods. Silvino is asking for a loan of $825, which he expects to repay in only six months. With this loan he will buy the specialized tools and raw materials he needs to stay in business. Silvino thanks all lenders for their support and their contribution toward the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Señor Silvino es casado y tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos casados. Años atrás él se desempeñaba como maestro en la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua, pero una vez que se jubiló la pensión que recibía era muy poca para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ante esta necesidad inició su propio negocio, un taller de carpintería en el que ha logrado realizar muy buenos trabajos y se ha dado a conocer entre sus clientes por la calidad de los muebles que fabrica.

Para agilizar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los productos que elabora, Silvino solicita un crédito por $ 825 dólares que se compromete a regresar en solo 6 meses, de esta manera podrá adquirir mejor herramienta y comprar el material que necesita para continuar con su trabajo. Silvino agradece a todas las personas por su apoyo y contribución para el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy tools and raw materials

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena is thirty-three. She is married and has three children. Her husband works in the construction business in their home town of Creel, in the state of Chihuahua. When she realized that her husband's salary didn't cover their basic expenses, Azucena decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. At first, she sold only to family and friends, but soon she began to get other clients, and her sales increased.

To keep up with client demand, Azucena is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more inventory. She expects to repay the loan in six months. She is grateful for the support of her lenders, their belief in her, and their investment in her business and the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Azucena tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa constructora en la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua, de donde son originarios. Al ver que el salario de su esposo no cubría las necesidades básicas de su hogar Azucena decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó vendiendo sus productos a familiares y amigos pero pronto logró ganar más clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Azucena está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Azucena agradece la confianza y ayuda que puedas depositar en este negocio y en el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock and hire a guard

loans.name: Andriani

texts.en: Andriani is a young woman working in a small school in her small community, called Hato Nuevo. She manages the cafeteria selling various fruit juices, water and food like sandwiches or hot dogs. The school she works in is called "Colegio Mundo de Alegria" (World of Happiness School). It is very small and only has a few classrooms in which the children can attend school.

loans.use: To buy a toaster and blender

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a hard working woman who started her "fritureria" business, which is a place where she fries and sells food to customers. She started it about 7-8 months ago, and before that she used to work at a house as a cleaning lady. She buys her food in the market, and in her establishment she sells salami, plantains, and other foodstuff.

She is a single mother with four children and she was born and raised in her community of Los Caños.

loans.use: To fix her establishment

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta is an elderly lady who has been working in her "Colmado" or mini-market for over six years. In her Colmado she sells rice, beans, salami, cooking oil, and other foodstuff.

Sixta is a widowed mother with 7 children who was born and raised in her community of L. Caños and she travels to the markets around her community like "comercial altagracia" to buy her products for the colmado.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a food cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory of soft drinks

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en:
Eliana A. is the proud owner of Venta de Comestico, a general store in La Union, a quaint community in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. Although she is without a physical storefront, Eliana provides an additional service to her customers by faithfully delivering her customer’s orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand her inventory of cosmetic and hygienic supplies to better meet the needs of her community. Originally from Haiti, the 38-year-old Eliana enjoys spending time with her husband, Ambrody, when she is not tending to her business.

Note: Eliana A. is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $725 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase hair coloring, cosmetic, and hygienic supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on chicken, oil, sugar, butter, plantains

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis L., originally from Haiti, is a single man who lives in a rented home without electricity or running water. With this initial loan, he will establish a clothing store by investing in a varied selection of essential clothing to sell to his community of La Union, in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic

Note: Alexis is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand inventory of pants to begin

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Pilar lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and two children on Buenos Aires Avenue in the hills of La Paz. She is 27 years old and principally dedicates herself to clothing sales, though sometimes she also sells stew as per the special requests of her customers. The capital with which she works, she actually does not obtain in order to supply her business because that is what she saves; she came to IMPRO to ask for a credit to buy and augment her merchandise. She doesn't have historical antecedents, save for her activity and her desire to improve her income; IMPRO suggests that she is qualified to accede the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Pilar vive en la casa de los suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la av. Buenos aires de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa principalmente, aunque algunas veces vende también ollas según sus clientes le hagan pedidos especiales. El capital con el que trabaja actualmente no le alcanza para surtir su negocio por lo que ahora ella vino a Impro a solicitar un crédito para compra y aumento de su mercadería. No tiene antecedente histórico pero por su actividad y su deseo de mejorar sus ingresos IMPRO sugiere que ella esta calificada para acceder al crédito.

loans.use:
Working capital  
Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Mercedes lives in her own home with her husband and her youngest daughter on Landaeta Street in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. She is 53 years old and for some time has been working with the creation of jackets, pants, banners, caps, etc. She currently works with Institutions (IMPRO) carrying out large contracts, because of which she now has three employees in her workshop whom she pays by the piece for completed work.

The loan she now seeks is to buy material; Mercedes is a small business owner who creates jobs and consequently becomes a subject of acceptable credit, moreover her cash flow responds to the financial necessities that permit her to pay off a line of credit while at the same time fulfilling her obligations to pay her employees as well as to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Mercedes vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija menor en la calle Landaeta de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 53 años de edad y desde hace tiempo se dedica a la confección de chamarras, pantalones, bandera, gorras, etc. Actualmente trabaja con Instituciones realizando contratos mayores, por lo cual tiene en su taller tres empleados a los cuales les paga a destajo por prenda realizada. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material; Mercedes es una microempresaria que genera empleo y por consiguiente se convierte en un sujeto de crédito aceptable, además de que su flujo de caja responde a las necesidades financieras que le permiten cancelar el crédito y al mismo tiempo cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago a sus empleadas y utilidad suficiente para cubrir sus gastos personales.

loans.use: Working capital - Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario lives with her parents in their home located on May 4th street in the Buenos Aires zone, La Paz. She is 22 years old and she is in the food service business. At first, she would sell her meals door-to-door, but now she has modified one of the rooms in her home to hold a small, account based restaurant. She does not have any children: she works to make a living and pay her expenses. She wants to invest the loan amount to redecorate the restaurant in order to give it a more pleasant ambiance and attract more patrons. An account based restaurant allows its customers to pay for their meals on a monthly basis, in return customers are guaranteed one meal per day for a whole month. Her credit history with Impro indicates that she has had access to a 6-month-term credit line in January of this year. Her balance has been totally paid off on time. Her good payment history places her in a position to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 22 años de edad y su actividad es la venta de comida; anteriormente vendía en la puerta de su casa, pero actualmente tiene una pensión modesta dentro de la casa en una habitación que fue habilitada para este fin. No tiene hijos, trabaja para poder subsistir y cubrir sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para implementar mejor su pensión y tener un ambiente acogedor y poder captar más clientes. Vale la pena aclarar que una pensión es un pequeño restaurante donde los clientes tienen un contrato mensual para tener un almuerzo seguro cada día del mes y pagan por todo el mes. El antecedente histórico de Rosario con Impro indica que ella ya tuvo acceso a un primer crédito en Enero del presente año por 6 meses y a la fecha el crédito esta pagado en su totalidad. Su calificación como buen cliente le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Antero

texts.es:
Antero is married with three children, 12, 14 and 24 years old. Due to unemployment and in order to earn enough to cover the basic needs of his family, five years ago Antero began his own business in clothing sales; he has refurbished a small part of his home to carry out his sales; his oldest daughter and his wife help him with the business; the coming together of the family has been fundamental to the growth of this business.

At this time, Antero is asking for a loan of $650 that he will use for the purchase of merchandise in order to offer a greater assortment to his clientele and to cater to their preferences; he promises to repay the amount in six months. The growth of this business and the well-being of Antero and his family are in your hands; decide to help them.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Antero es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 12, 14 y 24 años de edad. Ante la falta de un empleo y para poder obtener un ingreso que cubriera las necesidades básicas de su familia, desde hace cinco años Antero inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, ha acondicionado un pequeño lugar de su casa para realizar sus ventas, su hija mayor y su esposa le ayudan con el negocio, la unión familiar ha sido fundamental para el crecimiento de este negocio.

En estos momentos, Antero está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer un mayor surtido a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de Antero y su familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga is married with four children, aged 6, 11, 13 and 16; they were the motivation when she created her own business eight years ago. Her husband works for a construction company and his salary could not cover the cost of all the needs of the family. Olga, as an enterprising woman, began to sell cleaning supplies to help her husband with the costs of the home and their children's education. Little by little she has been improving her business, with greater variety of products. She runs her business out of her garage and has been refurbishing it in order to better serve her clientele.

In order to continue growing, Olga asks for a loan of $375 that she will use for the purchase of merchandise to have a greater variety and to answer the requests of her customers. She promises to repay this amount in just three months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and help Olga and her family. They are grateful for your confidence and your help.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 6, 11, 13 y 16 años de edad, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace ocho años, su esposo labora en una empresa de construcción y su salario no podía cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, Olga como es una mujer emprendedora empezó a vender productos de limpieza para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su negocio, con más variedad de productos, ella realiza sus ventas en la cochera de su casa y ha estado acondicionándola para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a Olga y a su familia, ellos agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning supplies merchandise  - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro is divorced and has one daughter; they are from Escobedo in Nuevo Leon. Socorro is a very hard-working woman who received a very small annuity and seeing that her income would not be sufficient to cover the needs of her home, fifteen years ago she dedicated herself to the making and selling of food. Thanks to the experience that she has acquired and the good quality of her products she has made her business grow; she has also incorporated the sale of cosmetics and clothing, with which she has succeeded in augmenting her profits.

Now, in order to be able to cover the demands of her customers, she asks for a loan of $750 that she will use on the purchase of merchandise and ingredients necessary to the making of her foods. She promises to repay this amount in six months. Socorro is very grateful for the opportunity you offer her with your support for the improvement and continuing growth of her business.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Socorro es divorciada y tiene una hija, ellas son originarias de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León. Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora, recibe una pensión muy baja y al ver que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para las necesidades de su hogar, desde hace 15 años Socorro se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, gracias a la experiencia que ha adquirido y la buena calidad de sus productos ha hecho crecer su negocio, también ha incorporado la venta de cosméticos y ropa, con lo que ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias.

Ahora para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes solicita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía e insumos necesarios en la elaboración de sus comidas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Socorro agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar y de continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and ingredients - Compra de mercancía
